kural.pope_couplet: Who knows what's human life's befitting grace,He lives; the rest 'mongst dead men have their place
kural.pope_exp: He truly lives who knows (and discharges) the proper duties (of benevolence) He who knows them not will be reckoned among the dead
kural.kannan_exp: One who is aligned to the right ways of the world, lives amongst the alive; the others are placed amongst the dead.

kural.pope_couplet: The wealth of men who love the 'fitting way,' the truly wise,Is as when water fills the lake that village needs supplies
kural.pope_exp: The wealth of that man of eminent knowledge who desires to exercise the benevolence approved of by the world, is like the full waters of a city-tank
kural.kannan_exp: The wealth of the wise one who loves, and is loved by, the world, is like a public pond brimming with water.

kural.pope_couplet: A tree that fruits in th' hamlet's central mart,Is wealth that falls to men of liberal heart
kural.pope_exp: The wealth of a man (possessed of the virtue) of benevolence is like the ripening of a fruitful tree in the midst of a town
kural.kannan_exp: Riches falling upon the benevolent, resemble a ripe tree laden with fruits, in the middle of a village.

kural.pope_couplet: Unfailing tree that healing balm distils from every part,Is ample wealth that falls to him of large and noble heart
kural.pope_exp: If wealth be in the possession of a man who has the great excellence (of benevolence), it is like a tree which as a medicine is an infallible cure for disease
kural.kannan_exp: Riches falling upon a person of great qualities, resemble an unfailing herbal tree that is a source of medicines.

kural.pope_couplet: E'en when resources fall, they weary not of 'kindness due,'-They to whom Duty's self appears in vision true
kural.pope_exp: The wise who know what is duty will not scant their benevolence even when they are without wealth
kural.kannan_exp: Even in times of distress, those who dont shy away from beneficence, have clear vision of their moral responsibilities.

kural.pope_couplet: The kindly-hearted man is poor in this alone,When power of doing deeds of goodness he finds none
kural.pope_exp: The poverty of a benevolent man, is nothing but his inability to exercise the same
kural.kannan_exp: A benevolent person turns poor when he laments his inability to do the good deeds he is used to doing.

kural.pope_couplet: Though by 'beneficence,' the loss of all should come,'Twere meet man sold himself, and bought it with the sum
kural.pope_exp: If it be said that loss will result from benevolence, such loss is worth being procured even by the sale of one's self
kural.kannan_exp: What harm can come out of beneficence? Such harm deserves to be bought even by selling oneself.

kural.pope_couplet: Call that a gift to needy men thou dost dispense,All else is void of good, seeking for recompense
kural.pope_exp: To give to the destitute is true charity All other gifts have the nature of (what is done for) a measured return
kural.kannan_exp: Giving to the poor is charity; all else have the quality of anticipating a return.

kural.pope_couplet: Though men declare it heavenward path, yet to receive is ill;Though upper heaven were not, to give is virtue still
kural.pope_exp: To beg is evil, even though it were said that it is a good path (to heaven) To give is good, even though it were said that those who do so cannot obtain heaven
kural.kannan_exp: To receive is a vice, even if it is accepted as a good virtue; to give, is good, even if the heaven is denied.

kural.pope_couplet: 'I've nought' is ne'er the high-born man's reply;He gives to those who raise themselves that cry
kural.pope_exp: (Even in a low state) not to adopt the mean expedient of saying "I have nothing," but to give, is the characteristic of the mad of noble birth
kural.kannan_exp: Charity, without mention of the distress of poverty, is present only in those from a good family.

kural.pope_couplet: The suppliants' cry for aid yields scant delight,Until you see his face with grateful gladness bright
kural.pope_exp: To see men begging from us in disagreeable, until we see their pleasant countenance
kural.kannan_exp: To be asked to give is bitter too, until seeing the smiling face of the recipient.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Mid devotees they're great who hunger's pangs sustain,Who hunger's pangs relieve a higher merit gain
kural.pope_exp: The power of those who perform penance is the power of enduring hunger It is inferior to the power of those who remove the hunger (of others)
kural.kannan_exp: The strength of the strongest is to endure hunger; it trails the ability to eradicate that hunger.

kural.pope_couplet: Let man relieve the wasting hunger men endure;For treasure gained thus finds he treasure-house secure
kural.pope_exp: The removal of the killing hunger of the poor is the place for one to lay up his wealth
kural.kannan_exp: To douse the destructive hunger of the destitute, is the safe to store the riches of the rich.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose soul delights with hungry men to share his meal,The hand of hunger's sickness sore shall never feel
kural.pope_exp: The fiery disease of hunger shall never touch him who habitually distributes his food to others
kural.kannan_exp: Hunger, the deadly disease, never touches one who is accustomed to share his food with others.

kural.pope_couplet: Delight of glad'ning human hearts with gifts do they not know.Men of unpitying eye, who hoard their wealth and lose it so
kural.pope_exp: Do the hard-eyed who lay up and lose their possessions not know the happiness which springs from the pleasure of giving ?
kural.kannan_exp: Do they not know to enjoy the joy of giving, those loveless people, who keep their wealth only to lose it.

kural.pope_couplet: They keep their garners full, for self alone the board they spread;-'Tis greater pain, be sure, than begging daily bread
kural.pope_exp: Solitary and unshared eating for the sake of filling up one's own riches is certainly much more
kural.kannan_exp: Eating alone to increase one’s accumulated wealth, is more distressing than begging.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis bitter pain to die, 'Tis worse to live.For him who nothing finds to give
kural.pope_exp: Nothing is more unpleasant than death: yet even that is pleasant where charity cannot be exercised
kural.kannan_exp: There is nothing more harrowing than death; that too seems sweet, if one is unable to give a thing to the needy.

kural.pope_couplet: See that thy life the praise of generous gifts obtain;Save this for living man exists no real gain
kural.pope_exp: Give to the poor and live with praise There is no greater profit to man than that
kural.kannan_exp: Give, and live with fame; there is no other gain for lives.

kural.pope_couplet: The speech of all that speak agrees to crownThe men that give to those that ask, with fair renown
kural.pope_exp: Whatsoever is spoken in the world will abide as praise upon that man who gives alms to the poor
kural.kannan_exp: All that chroniclers chronicle, is the renown that rests on those who give to the needy.

kural.pope_couplet: Save praise alone that soars on high,Nought lives on earth that shall not die
kural.pope_exp: There is nothing that stands forth in the world imperishable, except fame, exalted in solitary greatness
kural.kannan_exp: Nothing other than incomparable fame, lasts forever in this world.

kural.pope_couplet: If men do virtuous deeds by world-wide ample glory crowned,The heavens will cease to laud the sage for other gifts renowned
kural.pope_exp: If one has acquired extensive fame within the limits of this earth, the world of the Gods will no longer praise those sages who have attained that world
kural.kannan_exp: The world of devas, will cease to praise pure scholars, if one, through his deeds across this world, earns everlasting fame.

kural.pope_couplet: Loss that is gain, and death of life's true bliss fulfilled,Are fruits which only wisdom rare can yield
kural.pope_exp: Prosperity to the body of fame, resulting in poverty to the body of flesh and the stability to the former arising from the death of the latter, are achievable only by the wise
kural.kannan_exp: Growth (of fame) amidst adverstiy and survival (of name) after death, are possible only for the smartest.

kural.pope_couplet: If man you walk the stage, appear adorned with glory's grace;Save glorious you can shine, 'twere better hide your face
kural.pope_exp: If you are born (in this world), be born with qualities conductive to fame From those who are destitute of them it will be better not to be born
kural.kannan_exp: Appear with fame, if you must appear; if not, it is better not to appear than appear.

kural.pope_couplet: If you your days will spend devoid of goodly fame,When men despise, why blame them? You've yourself to blame
kural.pope_exp: Why do those who cannot live with praise, grieve those who despise them, instead of grieving themselves for their own inability
kural.kannan_exp: Why do those, who live with no fame, instead of blaming themselves, blame those who revile them.

kural.pope_couplet: Fame is virtue's child, they say; if, then,You childless live, you live the scorn of men
kural.pope_exp: Not to beget fame will be esteemed a disgrace by the wise in this world
kural.kannan_exp: Reproach will remain for those who, with no fame, have no legacy to leave behind.

kural.pope_couplet: The blameless fruits of fields' increase will dwindle down,If earth the burthen bear of men without renown
kural.pope_exp: The ground which supports a body without fame will diminish in its rich produce
kural.kannan_exp: The unblemished, fertile yield will diminish for the land that bears a body with no repute.

kural.pope_couplet: Who live without reproach, them living men we deem;Who live without renown, live not, though living men they seem
kural.pope_exp: Those live who live without disgrace Those who live without fame live not
kural.kannan_exp: Those who lead a life free of blame, are alive; those who live devoid of fame, are not alive.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth 'mid wealth is wealth 'kindliness';Wealth of goods the vilest too possess
kural.pope_exp: The wealth of kindness is wealth of wealth, in as much as the wealth of property is possessed by the basest of men
kural.kannan_exp: The gains of compassion are most precious; material wealth is possessed even by the despicable.

kural.pope_couplet: The law of 'grace' fulfil, by methods good due trial made,Though many systems you explore, this is your only aid
kural.pope_exp: (Stand) in the good path, consider, and be kind. Even considering according to the conflicting tenets of the different sects, kindness will be your best aid, (in the acquisition of heavenly bliss.)
kural.kannan_exp: Pursue the virtuous path and have compassion; all spiritual quests lead to this companion.

kural.pope_couplet: They in whose breast a 'gracious kindliness' resides,See not the gruesome world, where darkness drear abides
kural.pope_exp: They will never enter the world of darkness and wretchedness whose minds are the abode of kindness
kural.kannan_exp: Those with their hearts filled with compassion will never enter a woeful world of darkness.

kural.pope_couplet: Who for undying souls of men provides with gracious zeal,In his own soul the dreaded guilt of sin shall never feel
kural.pope_exp: (The wise) say that the evils, which his soul would dread, will never come upon the man who exercises kindness and protects the life (of other creatures)
kural.kannan_exp: The compassionate, who care for all other lives, do not fear for their own lives.

kural.pope_couplet: The teeming earth's vast realm, round which the wild winds blow,Is witness, men of 'grace' no woeful want shall know
kural.pope_exp: This great rich earth over which the wind blows, is a witness that sorrow never comes upon the kindhearted
kural.kannan_exp: The fertile world which endows us with breathing air illustrates that there is no sorrow for the compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: Gain of true wealth oblivious they eschew,Who 'grace' forsake, and graceless actions do
kural.pope_exp: (The wise) say that those who neglect kindness and practise cruelties, neglected virtue (in their former birth), and forgot (the sorrows which they must suffer.)
kural.kannan_exp: Those who do evil, abandoning compassion, must have forsaken and forgotten the meaning of life.

kural.pope_couplet: As to impoverished men this present world is not;The 'graceless' in you world have neither part nor lot
kural.pope_exp: As this world is not for those who are without wealth, so that world is not for those who are without kindness
kural.kannan_exp: The poor do not possess this world; likewise, the uncompassionate do not inhabit the other world.

kural.pope_couplet: Who lose the flower of wealth, when seasons change, again may bloom;Who lose 'benevolence', lose all; nothing can change their doom
kural.pope_exp: Those who are without wealth may, at some future time, become prosperous; those who are destitute of kindness are utterly destitute; for them there is no change
kural.kannan_exp: Those who lack wealth may, one day, bloom; those who lack compassion are incorrigible, and are forever, doomed.

kural.pope_couplet: When souls unwise true wisdom's mystic vision see,The 'graceless' man may work true works of charity
kural.pope_exp: If you consider, the virtue of him who is without kindness is like the perception of the true being by him who is without wisdom
kural.kannan_exp: The uncompassionate doing a righteous deed is like the unwise finding true enlightenment.

kural.pope_couplet: When weaker men you front with threat'ning brow,Think how you felt in presence of some stronger foe
kural.pope_exp: When a man is about to rush upon those who are weaker than himself, let him remember how he has stood (trembling) before those who are stronger than himself
kural.kannan_exp: When you confront those meeker than you, think of yourself in front of a stronger person.

kural.pope_couplet: How can the wont of 'kindly grace' to him be known,Who other creatures' flesh consumes to feed his own
kural.pope_exp: How can he be possessed of kindness, who to increase his own flesh, eats the flesh of other creatures
kural.kannan_exp: How can someone possess kindness, if one eats meat from another body to grow one’s own body?

kural.pope_couplet: No use of wealth have they who guard not their estate;No use of grace have they with flesh who hunger sate
kural.pope_exp: As those possess no property who do not take care of it, so those possess no kindness who feed on flesh
kural.kannan_exp: One, who doesn’t value money can’t be wealthy; one, who eats meat, can’t be compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: Like heart of them that murderous weapons bear, his mind,Who eats of savoury meat, no joy in good can find
kural.pope_exp: Like the (murderous) mind of him who carries a weapon (in his hand), the mind of him who feasts with pleasure on the body of another (creature), has no regard for goodness
kural.kannan_exp: The heart of one who has eaten and relished flesh, is like the heart of one leading an army: it cannot be compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: 'What's grace, or lack of grace'? 'To kill' is this, that 'not to kill';To eat dead flesh can never worthy end fulfil
kural.pope_exp: If it be asked what is kindness and what its opposite, the answer would be preservation and destruction of life; and therefore it is not right to feed on the flesh (obtained by taking away life)
kural.kannan_exp: What is compassion, and the lack of it : not killing and killing; it is not virtuous to eat meat got by killing.

kural.pope_couplet: If flesh you eat not, life's abodes unharmed remain;Who eats, hell swallows him, and renders not again
kural.pope_exp: Not to eat flesh contributes to the continuance of life; therefore if a man eat flesh, hell will not open its mouth (to let him escape out, after he has once fallen in)
kural.kannan_exp: Survival of species, depends on not being eaten; those who eat them…hell will not split its mouth to spit them out.

kural.pope_couplet: 'We eat the slain,' you say, by us no living creatures die;Who'd kill and sell, I pray, if none came there the flesh to buy
kural.pope_exp: If the world does not destroy life for the purpose of eating, then no one would sell flesh for the sake of money
kural.kannan_exp: There wont be anyone selling meat for the sake of earning, if the world stops killing for the sake of eating.

kural.pope_couplet: With other beings' ulcerous wounds their hunger they appease;If this they felt, desire to eat must surely cease
kural.pope_exp: If men should come to know that flesh is nothing but the unclean ulcer of a body, let them abstain from eating it
kural.kannan_exp: Meat is the wound of some body; if one gets this realization, stop eating it.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose souls the vision pure and passionless perceive,Eat not the bodies men of life bereave
kural.pope_exp: The wise, who have freed themselves from mental delusion, will not eat the flesh which has been severed from an animal
kural.kannan_exp: Those who have wisdom, free of flaws, would not eat a body, freed of its life.

kural.pope_couplet: Than thousand rich oblations, with libations rare,Better the flesh of slaughtered beings not to share
kural.pope_exp: Not to kill and eat (the flesh of) an animal, is better than the pouring forth of ghee etc, in a thousand sacrifices
kural.kannan_exp: To desist from killing a life and eating it, is better than doing a thousand rituals, offering oblation.

kural.pope_couplet: Who slays nought,- flesh rejects- his feet beforeAll living things with clasped hands adore
kural.pope_exp: All creatures will join their hands together, and worship him who has never taken away life, nor eaten flesh
kural.kannan_exp: To one who doesnt kill and refuses meat, all lives will fold their arms and pay obeisance.

kural.pope_couplet: To bear due penitential pains, while no offenceHe causes others, is the type of 'penitence'
kural.pope_exp: The nature of religious discipline consists, in the endurance (by the ascetic) of the sufferings which it brings on himself, and in abstaining from giving pain to others
kural.kannan_exp: To endure any ordeal and to cause none to other lives, embodies penance.

kural.pope_couplet: To 'penitents' sincere avails their 'penitence';Where that is not, 'tis but a vain pretence
kural.pope_exp: Austerities can only be borne, and their benefits enjoyed, by those who have practised them (in a former birth); it will be useless for those who have not done so, to attempt to practise them (now)
kural.kannan_exp: Penance makes sense only for those who have been virtuous; for others, it is useless.

kural.pope_couplet: Have other men forgotten 'penitence' who striveTo earn for penitents the things by which they live
kural.pope_exp: It is to provide food etc, for the ascetics who have abandoned (the desire of earthly possessions) that other persons have forgotten (to practise) austerity ?
kural.kannan_exp: Is it to assist the ascetics that the others have forgotten penance?

kural.pope_couplet: Destruction to his foes, to friends increase of joyThe 'penitent' can cause, if this his thoughts employ
kural.pope_exp: If (the ascetic) desire the destruction of his enemies, or the aggrandizement of his friends, it will be effected by (the power of) his austerities
kural.kannan_exp: Those who do penance, if they so choose, can crush those who harm them and elevate those who delight them.

kural.pope_couplet: That what they wish may, as they wish, be won,By men on earth are works of painful 'penance' done
kural.pope_exp: Religious dislipline is practised in this world, because it secures the attainment of whatever one may wish to enjoy (in the world to come)
kural.kannan_exp: Since it gives the power to attain whatever one wishes to, penance needs to be attempted at the earliest.

kural.pope_couplet: Who works of 'penance' do, their end attain,Others in passion's net enshared, toil but in vain
kural.pope_exp: Those discharge their duty who perform austerities; all others accomplish their own destruction, through the entanglement of the desire (of riches and sensual pleasure)
kural.kannan_exp: Those who do penance do their duty; others, engage in futile tasks, ensnared in desire.

kural.pope_couplet: The hotter glows the fining fire, the gold the brighter shines;The pain of penitence, like fire, the soul of man refines
kural.pope_exp: Just as gold is purified as heated in the fire, will those shine, who have endured the burning of pain (in frequent austerities)
kural.kannan_exp: Like flame that makes gold glitter more, pangs of pain can only enlighten those who do penance.

kural.pope_couplet: Who gains himself in utter self-control,Him worships every other living soul
kural.pope_exp: All other creatures will worship him who has attained the control of his own soul
kural.kannan_exp: One, who has given up the thought of ‘I,myself’, will be hailed by all.

kural.pope_couplet: E'en over death the victory he may gain,If power by penance won his soul obtain
kural.pope_exp: Those who have attained the power which religious discipline confers, will be able also to pass the limit of Yama, (the God of death)
kural.kannan_exp: Those, who have mastered penance, will find it possible to even defer death.

kural.pope_couplet: The many all things lack! The cause is plain,The 'penitents' are few The many shun such pain
kural.pope_exp: Because there are few who practise austerity and many who do not, there are many destitute and few rich in this world
kural.kannan_exp: The poor are abundant, since those who observe abstinence are few, and those who dont are more.

kural.pope_couplet: Who with deceitful mind in false way walks of covert sin,The five-fold elements his frame compose, decide within
kural.pope_exp: The five elements (of his body) will laugh within him at the feigned conduct of the deceitful minded man
kural.kannan_exp: The deceitful conduct of a treacherous mind, will be sneered at by the five elements within.

kural.pope_couplet: What gain, though virtue's semblance high as heaven his fame exalt,If heart dies down through sense of self-detected fault
kural.pope_exp: What avails an appearance (of sanctity) high as heaven, if his mind suffers (the indulgence) of conscious sin
kural.kannan_exp: Is a sky-high prominence of any use, when one’s heart knowingly harbors a vice.

kural.pope_couplet: As if a steer should graze wrapped round with tiger's skin,Is show of virtuous might when weakness lurks within
kural.pope_exp: The assumed appearance of power, by a man who has no power (to restrain his senses and perform austerity), is like a cow feeding on grass covered with a tiger's skin
kural.kannan_exp: A person with a frail heart assuming an imposing appearance is like a cow grazing wearing a tiger’s skin.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis as a fowler, silly birds to snare, in thicket lurksWhen, clad in stern ascetic garb, one secret evil works
kural.pope_exp: He who hides himself under the mask of an ascetic and commits sins, like a sportsman who conceals himself in the thicket to catch birds
kural.kannan_exp: Doing misdeeds in the guise of an ascetic is like a hunter capturing birds from behind the bushes.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Our souls are free,' who say, yet practise evil secretly,'What folly have we wrought!' by many shames o'er-whelmed, shall cry
kural.pope_exp: The false conduct of those who say they have renounced all desire will one day bring them sorrows that will make them cry out, "Oh! what have we done, what have we done."
kural.kannan_exp: If those who claim to have given up material desires, indulge in deceitful conduct, it will cause suffering aplenty leading to self-pity.

kural.pope_couplet: In mind renouncing nought, in speech renouncing every tie,Who guileful live,- no men are found than these of 'harder eye'
kural.pope_exp: Amongst living men there are none so hard-hearted as those who without to saking (desire) in their heart, falsely take the appearance of those who have forsaken (it)
kural.kannan_exp: There is nobody more evil than those who pretend to be ascetics when their hearts haven’t renounced desire.

kural.pope_couplet: Outward, they shine as 'kunri' berry's scarlet bright;Inward, like tip of 'kunri' bead, as black as night
kural.pope_exp: (The world) contains persons whose outside appears (as fair) as the (red) berry of the Abrus, but whose inside is as black as the nose of that berry
kural.kannan_exp: There are people, even if they, externally, resemble the lustrous exterior of a ‘kunri’ pea, have hearts like the dark nose of the pea.

kural.pope_couplet: Many wash in hollowed waters, living lives of hidden shame;Foul in heart, yet high upraised of men in virtuous fame
kural.pope_exp: There are many men of masked conduct, who perform their ablutions, and (make a show) of
kural.kannan_exp: There are many, who, like holy men, take a dip in the river, but hide the impurities of their heart.

kural.pope_couplet: Cruel is the arrow straight, the crooked lute is sweet,Judge by their deeds the many forms of men you meet
kural.pope_exp: As, in its use, the arrow is crooked, and the curved lute is straight, so by their deeds, (and not by their appearance) let (the uprightness or crookedness of) men be estimated
kural.kannan_exp: Judge a person by his deeds: the straight arrow is destructive and yazh, the bent musical bow, is sweet.

kural.pope_couplet: What's the worth of shaven head or tresses long,If you shun what all the world condemns as wrong
kural.pope_exp: There is no need of a shaven crown, nor of tangled hair, if a man abstain from those deeds which the wise have condemned
kural.kannan_exp: Tonsuring or growing long tresses is unnecessary, if one refrains from doing what the world disdains.

kural.pope_couplet: Who seeks heaven's joys, from impious levity secure,Let him from every fraud preserve his spirit pure
kural.pope_exp: Let him, who desires not to be despised, keep his mind from (the desire of) defrauding another of the smallest thing
kural.kannan_exp: If one wishes not to be ridiculed, let him protect his heart from thoughts of swindling.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis sin if in the mind man but thought conceive;'By fraud I will my neighbour of his wealth bereave.'
kural.pope_exp: Even the thought (of sin) is sin; think not then of crafiily stealing the property of another
kural.kannan_exp: Even to think such thoughts is evil : thoughts of swindling others’ property.

kural.pope_couplet: The gain that comes by fraud, although it seems to growWith limitless increase, to ruin swift shall go
kural.pope_exp: The property, which is acquired by fraud, will entirely perish, even while it seems to increase
kural.kannan_exp: Swindled wealth, will seem to swell, but will breach its limits and bust.

kural.pope_couplet: The lust inveterate of fraudful gain,Yields as its fruit undying pain
kural.pope_exp: The eager desire of defrauding others will, when it brings forth its fruit, produce undying sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: The love for swindling, when it yields, yields indestructible distress.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Grace' is not in their thoughts, nor know they kind affection's power,Who neighbour's goods desire, and watch for his unguarded hour
kural.pope_exp: The study of kindness and the exercise of benevolence is not with those who watch for another's forgetfulness, though desire of his property
kural.kannan_exp: Love, inspired by compassion, doesnt occur to those who await others’ lapses to grab their wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: They cannot walk restrained in wisdom's measured bound,In whom inveterate lust of fraudful gain is found
kural.pope_exp: They cannot walk steadfastly, according to rule, who eagerly desire to defraud others
kural.kannan_exp: The excessive love for swindling renders a person unable to abide by the limits of reason.

kural.pope_couplet: Practice of fraud's dark cunning arts they shun,Who long for power by 'measured wisdom' won
kural.pope_exp: That black-knowledge which is called fraud, is not in those who desire that greatness which is called rectitude
kural.kannan_exp: The clouded intelligence for defrauding is not for those who understand the limits of reason and morality.

kural.pope_couplet: As virtue dwells in heart that 'measured wisdom' gains;Deceit in hearts of fraudful men established reigns
kural.pope_exp: Deceit dwells in the mind of those who are conversant with fraud, even as virtue in the minds of those who are conversant with rectitude
kural.kannan_exp: Guile lies in the heart of the fraudulent like righteousness residing in the hearts of those who operate within boundaries.

kural.pope_couplet: Who have no lore save that which fraudful arts supply,Acts of unmeasured vice committing straightway die
kural.pope_exp: Those, who are acquainted with nothing but fraud, will perish in the very commission of transgression
kural.kannan_exp: Those, who have mastered nothing but swindling, will exceed all limits and fall instantly.

kural.pope_couplet: The fraudful forfeit life and being here below;Who fraud eschew the bliss of heavenly beings know
kural.pope_exp: Even their body will fail the fraudulent; but even the world of the gods will not fail those who are free from fraud
kural.kannan_exp: The fraudulent will lose their living state; those who desist from defrauding will not be denied the world of Devas.

kural.pope_couplet: You ask, in lips of men what 'truth' may be;'Tis speech from every taint of evil free
kural.pope_exp: Truth is the speaking of such words as are free from the least degree of evil (to others)
kural.kannan_exp: Truth is defined as speaking words that cause no harm.

kural.pope_couplet: Falsehood may take the place of truthful word,If blessing, free from fault, it can afford
kural.pope_exp: Even falsehood has the nature of truth, if it confer a benefit that is free from fault
kural.kannan_exp: Even a lie will be placed on par with the truth, if it yields unblemished benefits.

kural.pope_couplet: Speak not a word which false thy own heart knowsSelf-kindled fire within the false one's spirit glows
kural.pope_exp: Let not a man knowingly tell a lie; for after he has told the lie, his mind will burn him (with the memory of his guilt)
kural.kannan_exp: Do not lie consciously; once you lie so, your own conscience will sear you.

kural.pope_couplet: True to his inmost soul who lives,- enshrinedHe lives in souls of all mankind
kural.pope_exp: He who, in his conduct, preserves a mind free from deceit, will dwell in the minds of all men
kural.kannan_exp: One who, guided by his heart, lives without lies, will forever live in the hearts of all.

kural.pope_couplet: Greater is he who speaks the truth with full consenting mindThan men whose lives have penitence and charity combined
kural.pope_exp: He, who speaks truth with all his heart, is superior to those who make gifts and practise austerities
kural.kannan_exp: One who tells the truth, with all his heart, is ahead of those who do penance and charity.

kural.pope_couplet: No praise like that of words from falsehood free;This every virtue yields spontaneously
kural.pope_exp: There is no praise like the praise of never uttering a falsehood: without causing any suffering, it will lead to every virtue
kural.kannan_exp: No other fame equals not lying; without any physical strain it yields all virtues.

kural.pope_couplet: If all your life be utter truth, the truth alone,'Tis well, though other virtuous acts be left undone
kural.pope_exp: If a man has the power to abstain from falsehood, it will be well with him, even though he practise no other virtue
kural.kannan_exp: Not lying, not lying, if practiced, makes it acceptable not to do, not to do other righteous deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: Outward purity the water will bestow;Inward purity from truth alone will flow
kural.pope_exp: Purity of body is produced by water and purity of mind by truthfulness
kural.kannan_exp: Water ensures cleanliness externally; truthfulness makes inner purity evident.

kural.pope_couplet: Every lamp is not a lamp in wise men's sight;That's the lamp with truth's pure radiance bright
kural.pope_exp: All lamps of nature are not lamps; the lamp of truth is the lamp of the wise
kural.kannan_exp: All light is not light; for noble scholars, truthfulness is the true light of enlightenment.

kural.pope_couplet: Of all good things we've scanned with studious care,There's nought that can with truthfulness compare
kural.pope_exp: Amidst all that we have seen (described) as real (excellence), there is nothing so good as truthfulness
kural.kannan_exp: Of all the known truths, there is nothing more significant than truthfulness.

kural.pope_couplet: Where thou hast power thy angry will to work, thy wrath restrain;Where power is none, what matter if thou check or give it rein
kural.pope_exp: He restrains his anger who restrains it when it can injure; when it cannot injure, what does it matter whether he restrain it, or not ?
kural.kannan_exp: Restrain anger where anger will be effective; where it won’t be, does it matter whether one restrains it or not?

kural.pope_couplet: Where power is none to wreak thy wrath, wrath importent is ill;Where thou hast power thy will to work, 'tis greater, evil still
kural.pope_exp: Anger is bad, even when it cannot injure; when it can injure; there is no greater evil
kural.kannan_exp: Where it can’t have an impact, anger is harmful; where it can, there is still nothing more harmful.

kural.pope_couplet: If any rouse thy wrath, the trespass straight forget;For wrath an endless train of evils will beget
kural.pope_exp: Forget anger towards every one, as fountains of evil spring from it
kural.kannan_exp: Erase your anger against anyone; only harm springs forth from it.

kural.pope_couplet: Wrath robs the face of smiles, the heart of joy,What other foe to man works such annoy
kural.pope_exp: What other foe to man works such annoy?
kural.kannan_exp: Is there a foe other than anger, which anhilates smile and joy.

kural.pope_couplet: If thou would'st guard thyself, guard against wrath alway;'Gainst wrath who guards not, him his wrath shall slay
kural.pope_exp: If a man would guard himself, let him guard against anger; if he do not guard it, anger will kill him
kural.kannan_exp: If one seeks to protect oneself, control anger, lest anger destroys oneself. If you seek to protect yourself, curb your anger, lest anger destroys you.

kural.pope_couplet: Wrath, the fire that slayeth whose draweth near,Will burn the helpful 'raft' of kindred dear
kural.pope_exp: The fire of anger will burn up even the pleasant raft of friendship
kural.kannan_exp: Anger, the fire known to destroy those who harbor it, will also burn down the lifeboat, namely, one’s clan.

kural.pope_couplet: The hand that smites the earth unfailing feels the sting;So perish they who nurse their wrath as noble thing
kural.pope_exp: Destruction will come upon him who ragards anger as a good thing, as surely as the hand of him who strikes the ground will not fail
kural.kannan_exp: One, who possesses anger as a trait, will perish with the unfailing precision of a hand that slams the ground.

kural.pope_couplet: Though men should work thee woe, like touch of tongues of fire'Tis well if thou canst save thy soul from burning ire
kural.pope_exp: Though one commit things against you as painful (to bear) as if a bundle of fire had been thrust upon you, it will be well, to refrain, if possible, from anger
kural.kannan_exp: Even if taunted with a harmful deed, tantamount to toasting in a multi-tongued fire, better try not to be angered.

kural.pope_couplet: If man his soul preserve from wrathful fires,He gains with that whate'er his soul desires
kural.pope_exp: If a man never indulges anger in his heart, he will at once obtain whatever he has thought of
kural.kannan_exp: If the heart doesn’t harbour anger, one would attain instantly all that it aspires to.

kural.pope_couplet: Men of surpassing wrath are like the men who've passed away;Who wrath renounce, equals of all-renouncing sages they
kural.pope_exp: Those, who give way to excessive anger, are no better than dead men; but those, who are freed from it, are equal to those who are freed (from death)
kural.kannan_exp: Those who yield to anger are as good as dead; those who’ve shed anger are in effect saints.

kural.pope_couplet: Though ill to neighbour wrought should glorious pride of wealth secure,No ill to do is fixed decree of men in spirit pure
kural.pope_exp: It is the determination of the spotless not to cause sorrow to others, although they could (by so causing) obtain the wealth which confers greatness
kural.kannan_exp: Even if it yields glory and riches galore, refraining from harming others is the principled path of the impeccable.

kural.pope_couplet: Though malice work its worst, planning no ill return, to endure,And work no ill, is fixed decree of men in spirit pure
kural.pope_exp: It is the determination of the spotless not to do evil, even in return, to those who have cherished enmity and done them evil
kural.kannan_exp: Not to hurt those who have caused harm before, out of wrath, is the principled path of the impeccable.

kural.pope_couplet: Though unprovoked thy soul malicious foes should sting,Retaliation wrought inevitable woes will bring
kural.pope_exp: In an ascetic inflict suffering even on those who hate him, when he has not done them any evil, it will afterwards give him irretrievable sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: To harm even those who antagonize us unprovoked, will bring boundless suffering.

kural.pope_couplet: To punish wrong, with kindly benefits the doers ply;Thus shame their souls; but pass the ill unheeded by
kural.pope_exp: The (proper) punishment to those who have done evil (to you), is to put them to shame by showing them kindness, in return and to forget both the evil and the good done on both sides
kural.kannan_exp: The way to punish those who harmed us is to shame them by doing them good.

kural.pope_couplet: From wisdom's vaunted lore what doth the learner gain,If as his own he guard not others' souls from pain
kural.pope_exp: What benefit has he derived from his knowledge, who does not endeavour to keep off pain from another as much as from himself ?
kural.kannan_exp: What use is it to be wise, if one cant treat others’ woes as one’s own.

kural.pope_couplet: What his own soul has felt as bitter pain,From making others feel should man abstain
kural.pope_exp: Let not a man consent to do those things to another which, he knows, will cause sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Shy away from doing to others what you perceive would have harmed you.

kural.pope_couplet: To work no wilful woe, in any wise, through all the days,To any living soul, is virtue's highest praise
kural.pope_exp: It is the chief of all virtues not knowingly to do any person evil, even in the lowest degree, and at any time
kural.kannan_exp: Never do a harmful deed, however small, to anyone, in any circumstance, consciously or otherwise.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose soul has felt the bitter smart of wrong, how canHe wrongs inflict on ever-living soul of man
kural.pope_exp: Why does a man inflict upon other creatures those sufferings, which he has found by experience are sufferings to himself ?
kural.kannan_exp: Why does one hurt other lives, doing what he knows can hurt oneself?

kural.pope_couplet: If, ere the noontide, you to others evil do,Before the eventide will evil visit you
kural.pope_exp: If a man inflict sorrow upon others in the morning, it will come upon him unsought in the very evening
kural.kannan_exp: If you harm others in the forenoon, harm will visit you, by itself, in the afternoon.

kural.pope_couplet: O'er every evil-doer evil broodeth still;He evil shuns who freedom seeks from ill
kural.pope_exp: Sorrow will come upon those who cause pain to others; therfore those, who desire to be free from sorrow, give no pain to others
kural.kannan_exp: Harm descends on those who harm others; hence, those who wish not to be harmed, do no harm.

kural.pope_couplet: What is the work of virtue? 'Not to kill';For 'killing' leads to every work of ill
kural.pope_exp: Never to destroy life is the sum of all virtuous conduct The destruction of life leads to every evil
kural.kannan_exp: What is a righteous deed? Not killing. Killing leads to everything evil.

kural.pope_couplet: Let those that need partake your meal; guard every-thing that lives;This the chief and sum of lore that hoarded wisdom gives
kural.pope_exp: The chief of all (the virtues) which authors have summed up, is the partaking of food that has been shared with others, and the preservation of the mainfold life of other creatures
kural.kannan_exp: Sharing food and taking care of all lives, is the foremost amongst all virtues compiled in all scriptures.

kural.pope_couplet: Alone, first of goods things, is 'not to slay';The second is, no untrue word to say
kural.pope_exp: Not to destroy life is an incomparably (great) good next to it in goodness ranks freedom from falsehood
kural.kannan_exp: Not killing is the foremost virtue; it is good to follow that up with not lying.

kural.pope_couplet: You ask, What is the good and perfect way?'Tis path of him who studies nought to slay
kural.pope_exp: Good path is that which considers how it may avoid killing any creature
kural.kannan_exp: What is a perfect path? It is the pursuit of the principle of not slaying any being.

kural.pope_couplet: Of those who 'being' dread, and all renounce, the chief are they,Who dreading crime of slaughter, study nought to slay
kural.pope_exp: Of all those who, fearing the permanence of earthly births, have abandoned desire, he is the chief who, fearing (the guilt of) murder, considers how he may avoid the destruction of life
kural.kannan_exp: Of all those who, despising material existence, have embraced renunciation, the foremost are those who fear and shun killing.

kural.pope_couplet: Ev'n death that life devours, their happy days shall spare,Who law, 'Thou shall not kill', uphold with reverent care
kural.pope_exp: Yama, the destroyer of life, will not attack the life of him, who acts under the determination of never destroying life
kural.kannan_exp: Death dares not trample on the life of one who abides by the principle of not killing any life.

kural.pope_couplet: Though thine own life for that spared life the price must pay,Take not from aught that lives gift of sweet life away
kural.pope_exp: Let no one do that which would destroy the life of another, although he should by so doing, lose his own life
kural.kannan_exp: Even if one were to sacrifice one’s own life, do not commit the act of taking another life.

kural.pope_couplet: Though great the gain of good should seem, the wiseWill any gain by staughter won despise
kural.pope_exp: The advantage which might flow from destroying life in sacrifice, is dishonourable to the wise (who renounced the world), even although it should be said to be productive of great good
kural.kannan_exp: Even if great wealth leads to great benefits, great men loathe wealth obtained by sacrifice of lives.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose trade is 'killing', always vile they show,To minds of them who what is vileness know
kural.pope_exp: To minds of them who what is vileness know
kural.kannan_exp: For those who can see the folly of it, the savage imbeciles in any profession involving killing are doing a despicable job.

kural.pope_couplet: Who lead a loathed life in bodies sorely pained,Are men, the wise declare, by guilt of slaughter stained
kural.pope_exp: (The wise) will say that men of diseased bodies, who live in degradation and in poverty, are those who separated the life from the body of animals (in a former birth)
kural.kannan_exp: Those with a rotting sickly body and a rotten life mired in poverty, must have killed other beings before.

kural.pope_couplet: Lowest and meanest lore, that bids men trust secure,In things that pass away, as things that shall endure
kural.pope_exp: That ignorance which considers those things to be stable which are not so, is dishonourable (to the wise)
kural.kannan_exp: To believe that transient things will last forever is deplorable stupidity.

kural.pope_couplet: As crowds round dancers fill the hall, is wealth's increase;Its loss, as throngs dispersing, when the dances cease
kural.pope_exp: The acquisition of wealth is like the gathering together of an assembly for a theatre; its expenditure is like the breaking up of that assembly
kural.kannan_exp: Great wealth accumulates like a crowd assembled at a theatre; when it goes, it vanishes like the crowd at the end of the play.

kural.pope_couplet: Unenduring is all wealth; if you wealth enjoy,Enduring works in working wealth straightway employ
kural.pope_exp: Wealth is perishable; let those who obtain it immediately practise those (virtues) which are imperishable
kural.kannan_exp: Wealth is transient; when it comes about, use it to do a lasting righteous deed.

kural.pope_couplet: As 'day' it vaunts itself; well understood, 'tis knife',That daily cuts away a portion from thy life
kural.pope_exp: Time, which shows itself (to the ignorant) as if it were something (real) is in the estimation of the wise (only) a saw which cuts down life
kural.kannan_exp: The wise get this : Time, that manifests itself as days, is a sword that slices off life.

kural.pope_couplet: Before the tongue lie powerless, 'mid the gasp of gurgling breath,Arouse thyself, and do good deeds beyond the power of death
kural.pope_exp: Let virtuous deeds be done quickly, before the hiccup comes making the tongue silent
kural.kannan_exp: Before your tongue goes numb and you let out your last breath, make haste to do a good deed.

kural.pope_couplet: Existing yesterday, today to nothing hurled!-Such greatness owns this transitory world
kural.pope_exp: This world possesses the greatness that one who yesterday was is not today
kural.kannan_exp: Who was there yesterday, is gone today: the world is thus.

kural.pope_couplet: Who know not if their happy lives shall last the day,In fancies infinite beguile the hours away
kural.pope_exp: Innumerable are the thoughts which occupy the mind of (the unwise), who know not that they shall live another moment
kural.kannan_exp: They, who, hold over a billion thoughts in their minds, know not how to live their lives for a moment.

kural.pope_couplet: Birds fly away, and leave the nest deserted bare;Such is the short-lived friendship soul and body share
kural.pope_exp: The love of the soul to the body is like (the love of) a bird to its egg which it flies away from and leaves empty
kural.kannan_exp: A bird breaks away from the egg, leaving the shells alone; so is life related to body.

kural.pope_couplet: Death is sinking into slumbers deep;Birth again is waking out of sleep
kural.pope_exp: Death is like sleep; birth is like awaking from it
kural.kannan_exp: Death is like going off to sleep; birth is like waking up from it.

kural.pope_couplet: The soul in fragile shed as lodger courts repose:-Is it because no home's conclusive rest it knows
kural.pope_exp: It seems as if the soul, which takes a temporary shelter in a body, had not attained a home
kural.kannan_exp: Doesn’t life have a permanent dwelling? It has taken shelter in this body.

kural.pope_couplet: From whatever, aye, whatever, man gets free,From what, aye, from that, no more of pain hath he
kural.pope_exp: Whatever thing, a man has renounced, by that thing; he cannot suffer pain
kural.kannan_exp: Pain, there is none, from all those one renounces.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Renunciation' made- ev'n here true pleasures men acquire;'Renounce' while time is yet, if to those pleasures you aspire
kural.pope_exp: After a man has renounced (all things), there will still be many things in this world (which he may enjoy); if he should desire them, let him, while it is time abandon (the world)
kural.kannan_exp: The pleasures of this world after renouncing are immense; if you wish those, renounce when you can .

kural.pope_couplet: 'Perceptions of the five' must all expire;-Relinquished in its order each desire
kural.pope_exp: Let the five senses be destroyed; and at the same time, let everything be abandoned that (the ascetic) has (formerly) desired
kural.kannan_exp: To renounce all that one desires, the five senses should be overcome.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Privation absolute' is penance true;'Possession' brings bewilderment anew
kural.pope_exp: To be altogether destitute is the proper condition of those who perform austerities; if they possess anything, it will change (their resolution) and bring them back to their confused state
kural.kannan_exp: Not to have a thing is the essense of penance; any possession lures one away from it.

kural.pope_couplet: To those who sev'rance seek from being's varied strife,Flesh is burthen sore; what then other bonds of life
kural.pope_exp: What means the addition of other things those who are attempting to cut off (future) births, when even their body is too much (for them)
kural.kannan_exp: For those ascetics seeking relief from rebirth, own flesh is an excess. what purpose do other affinities serve?

kural.pope_couplet: Who kills conceit that utters 'I' and 'mine',Shall enter realms above the powers divine
kural.pope_exp: Shall enter realms above the powers divine
kural.kannan_exp: One who severs the vanity of ‘I’ and ‘Mine’, shall reach some place better than paradise.

kural.pope_couplet: Who cling to things that cling and eager clasp,Griefs cling to them with unrelaxing grasp
kural.pope_exp: Sorrows will never let go their hold of those who give not up their hold of desire
kural.kannan_exp: Miseries will not near those who desist from desire.

kural.pope_couplet: Who thoroughly 'renounce' on highest height are set;The rest bewildered, lie entangled in the net
kural.pope_exp: Those who have entirely renounced (all things and all desire) have obtained (absorption into God); all others wander in confusion, entangled in the net of (many) births
kural.kannan_exp: Those who renounce completely, surge ahead; others get enticed and end up entangled in a web.

kural.pope_couplet: When that which clings falls off, severed is being's tie;All else will then be seen as instability
kural.pope_exp: At the moment in which desire has been abandoned, (other) births will be cut off; when that has not been done, instability will be seen
kural.kannan_exp: Only when all attachments are severed, the cycle of life and death is broken; anything short of it is transient.

kural.pope_couplet: Cling thou to that which He, to Whom nought clings, hath bid thee cling,Cling to that bond, to get thee free from every clinging thing
kural.pope_exp: Desire the desire of Him who is without desire; in order to renounce desire, desire that desire
kural.kannan_exp: Be attached to God, who is attached to none, only so that you leverage that attachment to let go of all other attachments.

kural.pope_couplet: Of things devoid of truth as real things men deem;-Cause of degraded birth the fond delusive dream
kural.pope_exp: Inglorious births are produced by the confusion (of mind) which considers those things to be real which are not real
kural.kannan_exp: To be deluded into accepting anything untrue as gospel truth leads to a wasted life.

kural.pope_couplet: Darkness departs, and rapture springs to men who see,The mystic vision pure, from all delusion free
kural.pope_exp: A clear, undimmed vision of things will deliver its possessors from the darkness of future births, and confer the felicity (of heaven)
kural.kannan_exp: Darkness will give way to joy, when delusion is replaced with a flawless vision.

kural.pope_couplet: When doubts disperse, and mists of error rollAway, nearer is heav'n than earth to sage's soul
kural.pope_exp: Heaven is nearer than earth to those men of purified minds who are freed from from doubt
kural.kannan_exp: For those with conviction, who have dispelled all doubts, the skies are nearer than the earth.

kural.pope_couplet: Five-fold perception gained, what benefits accrueTo them whose spirits lack perception of the true
kural.pope_exp: Even those who have all the knowledge which can be attained by the five senses, will derive no benefit from it, if they are without a knowledge of the true nature of things
kural.kannan_exp: Conquering the five senses makes no sense, when there is no comprehension of truth.

kural.pope_couplet: Whatever thing, of whatsoever kind it be,'Tis wisdom's part in each the very thing to see
kural.pope_exp: (True) knowledge is the perception concerning every thing of whatever kind, that that thing is the true thing
kural.kannan_exp: Whatever seems to be the nature of anything, wisdom lies in seeking to grasp its true nature.

kural.pope_couplet: Who learn, and here the knowledge of the true obtain,Shall find the path that hither cometh not again
kural.pope_exp: They, who in this birth have learned to know the True Being, enter the road which returns not into this world
kural.kannan_exp: Those who have learnt and grasped the true essence here, will find a path that will not bring them back here.

kural.pope_couplet: The mind that knows with certitude what is, and ponders well,Its thoughts on birth again to other life need not to dwell
kural.pope_exp: Let it not be thought that there is another birth for him whose mind having thoroughly considered (all it has been taught) has known the True Being
kural.kannan_exp: The mind that, after careful consideration, ascertains the truth conclusively, would not contemplate rebirth.

kural.pope_couplet: When folly, cause of births, departs; and soul can viewThe truth of things, man's dignity- 'tis wisdom true
kural.pope_exp: True knowledge consists in the removal of ignorance; which is (the cause of) births, and the perception of the True Being who is (the bestower of) heaven
kural.kannan_exp: For the vanity of birth to vanish, fathom those ultimate truths of true significance.

kural.pope_couplet: The true 'support' who knows- rejects 'supports' he sought before-Sorrow that clings all destroys, shall cling to him no more
kural.pope_exp: He who so lives as to know Him who is the support of all things and abandon all desire, will be freed from the evils which would otherwise cleave to him and destroy (his efforts after absorption)
kural.kannan_exp: To understand our desires, and to give up those desires, decimates the distress caused by those desires.

kural.pope_couplet: When lust and wrath and error's triple tyranny is o'er,Their very names for aye extinct, then pain shall be no more
kural.pope_exp: If the very names of these three things, desire, anger, and confusion of mind, be destroyed, then will also perish evils (which flow from them)
kural.kannan_exp: Live such that even the labels for Desire, anger and ignorance do not exist; then, the ills caused by them will cease.

kural.pope_couplet: The wise declare, through all the days, to every living thingThat ceaseless round of birth from seed of strong desire doth spring
kural.pope_exp: (The wise) say that the seed, which produces unceasing births, at all times, to all creatures, is desire
kural.kannan_exp: Desire is the seed which, for all lives, unfailingly, leads to an endless cycle of birth.

kural.pope_couplet: If desire you feel, freedom from changing birth require!'I' will come, if you desire to 'scape, set free from all desire
kural.pope_exp: If anything be desired, freedom from births should be desired; that (freedom from births) will be attained by desiring to be without desire
kural.kannan_exp: If you desire, desire for freedom from birth; desiring not to desire, too, leads to that freedom.

kural.pope_couplet: No glorious wealth is here like freedom from desire;To bliss like this not even there can soul aspire
kural.pope_exp: There is in this world no excellence equal to freedom from desire; and even in that world, there is nothing like it
kural.kannan_exp: There is no wealth here better than lack of desire; nowhere else is there anything that equals it.

kural.pope_couplet: Desire's decease as purity men know;That, too, from yearning search for truth will grow
kural.pope_exp: Purity (of mind) consists in freedom from desire; and that (freedom from desire) is the fruit of the love of truth
kural.kannan_exp: Purity is absence of desire; which, is obtained through the quest for truth.

kural.pope_couplet: Men freed from bonds of strong desire are free;None other share such perfect liberty
kural.pope_exp: They are said to be free (from future birth) who are freed from desire; all others (who, whatever else they may be free from, are not freed from desire) are not thus free
kural.kannan_exp: Only those who’ve renounced desire have renounced; the rest, who’ve renounced all else, have not truly renounced.

kural.pope_couplet: Desire each soul beguiles;True virtue dreads its wiles
kural.pope_exp: It is the chief duty of (an ascetic) to watch against desire with (jealous) fear; for it has power to deceive (and destroy) him
kural.kannan_exp: Desire is a deceptive trap; fearing it, is a virtue.

kural.pope_couplet: Who thoroughly rids his life of passion-prompted deed,Deeds of unfailing worth shall do, which, as he plans, succeed
kural.pope_exp: If a man thoroughly cut off all desire, the deeds, which confer immortality, will come to him, in the path in which he seeks them
kural.kannan_exp: One can do flawless deeds the way one wants to do, when desire is destroyed completely.

kural.pope_couplet: Affliction is not known where no desires abide;Where these are, endless rises sorrow's tide
kural.pope_exp: There is no sorrow to those who are without desire; but where that is, (sorrow) will incessantly come, more and more
kural.kannan_exp: Those who are devoid of desire are free from misery; for others, it keeps piling up.

kural.pope_couplet: When dies away desire, that woe of woesEv'n here the soul unceasing rapture knows
kural.pope_exp: Even while in this body, joy will never depart (from the mind, in which) desire, that sorrow of sorrows, has been destroyed
kural.kannan_exp: When desire, the misery of miseries, is decimated, unending joy abounds.

kural.pope_couplet: Drive from thy soul desire insatiate;Straight'way is gained the moveless blissful state
kural.pope_exp: The removal of desire, whose nature it is never to be satisfied, will immediately confer a nature that can never be changed
kural.kannan_exp: Eternal bliss ensues, when insatiable desire ends.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth-giving fate power of unflinching effort brings;From fate that takes away idle remissness springs
kural.pope_exp: Perseverance comes from a prosperous fate, and idleness from an adverse fate
kural.kannan_exp: Constructive ool causes tireless endeavor leading to prosperity; destructive ool causes indolence.

kural.pope_couplet: The fate that loss ordains makes wise men's wisdom foolishness;The fate that gain bestows with ampler powers will wisdom bless
kural.pope_exp: An adverse fate produces folly, and a prosperous fate produces enlarged knowledge
kural.kannan_exp: Malign ool blunts one’s intelligence; in its turn, benign ool sharpens it.

kural.pope_couplet: In subtle learning manifold though versed man be,'The wisdom, truly his, will gain supremacy
kural.pope_exp: Although (a man) may study the most polished treatises, the knowledge which fate has decreed to him will still prevail
kural.kannan_exp: Even if knowledge comes through profound books, one’s innate wisdom remains dominant.

kural.pope_couplet: Two fold the fashion of the world: some live in fortune's light;While other some have souls in wisdom's radiance bright
kural.pope_exp: There are (through fate) two different natures in the world, hence the difference (observable in men) in (their acquisition of) wealth, and in their attainment of knowledge
kural.kannan_exp: The world is stratified based on two factors: wealth and wisdom; and, they are not correlated.

kural.pope_couplet: All things that good appear will oft have ill success;All evil things prove good for gain of happiness
kural.pope_exp: In the acquisition of property, every thing favourable becomes unfavourable, and (on the other hand) everything unfavourable becomes favourable, (through the power of fate)
kural.kannan_exp: While seeking wealth, positive aspects can turn harmful; and negative aspects beneficial.

kural.pope_couplet: Things not your own will yield no good, howe'er you guard with pain;Your own, howe'er you scatter them abroad, will yours remain
kural.pope_exp: Whatever is not conferred by fate cannot be preserved although it be guarded with most painful care; and that, which fate has made his, cannot be lost, although one should even take it and throw it away
kural.kannan_exp: Strive hard, we may; but what we don’t deserve doesn’t stay, and what we deserve, we can’t dispose.

kural.pope_couplet: Save as the 'sharer' shares to each in due degree,To those who millions store enjoyment scarce can be
kural.pope_exp: Even those who gather together millions will only enjoy them, as it has been determined by the disposer (of all things)
kural.kannan_exp: One may amass wealth worth crores, but can consume only as ordained by the Ordainer (based on ool).

kural.pope_couplet: The destitute with ascetics merit share,If fate to visit with predestined ills would spare
kural.pope_exp: The destitute will renounce desire (and become ascetics), if (fate) do not make them suffer the hindrances to which they are liable, and they pass away
kural.kannan_exp: Even those who possess nothing to enjoy will ‘renounce’, if only one can escape the misery that is to be suffered.

kural.pope_couplet: When good things come, men view them all as gain;When evils come, why then should they complain
kural.pope_exp: How is it that those, who are pleased with good fortune, trouble themselves when evil comes, (since both are equally the decree of fate) ?
kural.kannan_exp: Why bemoan the misery caused by ool, when one enjoys the good without complaint.

kural.pope_couplet: What powers so great as those of Destiny? Man's skillSome other thing contrives; but fate's beforehand still
kural.pope_exp: What is stronger than fate ? If we think of an expedient (to avert it), it will itself be with us before (the thought)
kural.kannan_exp: Is there anything mightier than ool? It remains dominant despite all plans devised to counter it.

kural.pope_couplet: An army, people, wealth, a minister, friends, fort: six things-Who owns them all, a lion lives amid the kings
kural.pope_exp: He who possesses these six things, an army, a people, wealth, ministers, friends and a fortress, is a lion among kings
kural.kannan_exp: The military, citizenry, resources, advisers, friends and fortresses : who owns these six is a lion amongst kings.

kural.pope_couplet: Courage, a liberal hand, wisdom, and energy: these fourAre qualities a king adorn for evermore
kural.pope_exp: Never to fail in these four things, fearlessness, liberality, wisdom, and energy, is the kingly character
kural.kannan_exp: Fearlessness, generosity, wisdom and vitality: these four are persistent characteristics expected of a king.

kural.pope_couplet: A sleepless promptitude, knowledge, decision strong:These three for aye to rulers of the land belong
kural.pope_exp: These three things, viz, vigilance, learning, and bravery, should never be wanting in the ruler of a country
kural.kannan_exp: Vigilance, erudition and boldness: these three never abandon a competent ruler.

kural.pope_couplet: Kingship, in virtue failing not, all vice restrains,In courage failing not, it honour's grace maintains
kural.pope_exp: He is a king who, with manly modesty, swerves not from virtue, and refrains from vice
kural.kannan_exp: Not swerving from righteousness and justice (aram); and deterring any violations; assuming greatness and pride through benevolent courage : a ruler should do.

kural.pope_couplet: A king is he who treasure gains, stores up, defends,And duly for his kingdom's weal expends
kural.pope_exp: He is a king who is able to acquire (wealth), to lay it up, to guard, and to distribute it
kural.kannan_exp: Strategizing, earning revenues, preserving and allocating resources : a government should be capable of.

kural.pope_couplet: Where king is easy of access, where no harsh word repels,That land's high praises every subject swells
kural.pope_exp: The whole world will exalt the country of the king who is easy of access, and who is free from harsh language
kural.kannan_exp: The world will eulogize a ruler , who is easily accessible and refrains from rude rebukes.

kural.pope_couplet: With pleasant speech, who gives and guards with powerful liberal hand,He sees the world obedient all to his command
kural.pope_exp: The world will praise and submit itself to the mind of the king who is able to give with affability, and to protect all who come to him
kural.kannan_exp: For those who, with sweet words, are capable of giving generously and protecting their people, the world is how they wish it to be.

kural.pope_couplet: Who guards the realm and justice strict maintains,That king as god o'er subject people reigns
kural.pope_exp: That king, will be esteemed a God among men, who performs his own duties, and protects (his subjects).
kural.kannan_exp: A righteous king who renders justice, and nurtures his people, will be hailed as an almighty leader.

kural.pope_couplet: The king of worth, who can words bitter to his ear endure,Beneath the shadow of his power the world abides secure
kural.pope_exp: The whole world will dwell under the umbrella of the king, who can bear words that embitter the ear
kural.kannan_exp: The leader who heeds to counsel that stings the ear, will have the world rest under his sceptre.

kural.pope_couplet: Gifts, grace, right sceptre, care of people's weal;These four a light of dreaded kings reveal
kural.pope_exp: He is the light of kings who has there four things, beneficence, benevolence, rectitude, and care for his people
kural.kannan_exp: Charity, love, justice and safeguarding the people: who has these four is the guiding light for all leaders.

kural.pope_couplet: So learn that you may full and faultless learning gain,Then in obedience meet to lessons learnt remain
kural.pope_exp: Let a man learn thoroughly whatever he may learn, and let his conduct be worthy of his learning
kural.kannan_exp: Learn, what is to be learnt, with no flaws; once learnt, stand by what you learned.

kural.pope_couplet: The twain that lore of numbers and of letters giveAre eyes, the wise declare, to all on earth that live
kural.pope_exp: Letters and numbers are the two eyes of man
kural.kannan_exp: Numbers and letters, they are known as; eyes to humans, they are.

kural.pope_couplet: Men who learning gain have eyes, men say;Blockheads' faces pairs of sores display
kural.pope_exp: The learned are said to have eyes, but the unlearned have (merely) two sores in their face
kural.kannan_exp: The erudite have eyes; the ignorant have on their faces, two gashes.

kural.pope_couplet: You meet with joy, with pleasant thought you part;Such is the learned scholar's wonderous art
kural.pope_exp: It is the part of the learned to give joy to those whom they meet, and on leaving, to make them think (Oh! when shall we meet them again.)
kural.kannan_exp: Elation when they meet, and nostalgia when they part, are effects of the erudite’s deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: With soul submiss they stand, as paupers front a rich man's face;Yet learned men are first; th'unlearned stand in lowest place
kural.pope_exp: The unlearned are inferior to the learned, before whom they stand begging, as the destitute before the wealthy
kural.kannan_exp: Learned are those, who, like the poor before rich, stay humble before others, lovingly, to learn; those who thus don’t learn are lowly.

kural.pope_couplet: In sandy soil, when deep you delve, you reach the springs below;The more you learn, the freer streams of wisdom flow
kural.pope_exp: Water will flow from a well in the sand in proportion to the depth to which it is dug, and knowledge will flow from a man in proportion to his learning
kural.kannan_exp: The deeper a well is dug, the more the water that springs; the more one learns, the more the wisdom it brings.

kural.pope_couplet: The learned make each land their own, in every city find a home;Who, till they die; learn nought, along what weary ways they roam
kural.pope_exp: How is it that any one can remain without learning, even to his death, when (to the learned man) every country is his own (country), and every town his own (town) ?
kural.kannan_exp: For the learned, every nation is their nation; and every place their place; why then, does one shun learning till death.

kural.pope_couplet: The man who store of learning gains,In one, through seven worlds, bliss attains
kural.pope_exp: The learning, which a man has acquired in one birth, will yield him pleasure during seven births
kural.kannan_exp: Learning acquired once will stand in good stead for seven births.

kural.pope_couplet: Their joy is joy of all the world, they see; thus moreThe learners learn to love their cherished lore
kural.pope_exp: The learned will long (for more learning), when they see that while it gives pleasure to themselves, the world also derives pleasure from it
kural.kannan_exp: Seeing that what they enjoy, the world enjoys too, the erudite fall more in love with learning.

kural.pope_couplet: Learning is excellence of wealth that none destroy;To man nought else affords reality of joy
kural.pope_exp: Learning is the true imperishable riches; all other things are not riches
kural.kannan_exp: Learning is the indestructubile, and significant, wealth; other riches are not true wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: Like those at draughts would play without the chequered square,Men void of ample lore would counsels of the learned share
kural.pope_exp: To speak in an assembly (of the learned) without fullness of knowledge, is like playing at chess (on a board) without squares
kural.kannan_exp: Speaking before an audience, without reading relevant books, is like rolling the dice without drawing the squares.

kural.pope_couplet: Like those who doat on hoyden's undeveloped charms are they,Of learning void, who eagerly their power of words display
kural.pope_exp: The desire of the unlearned to speak (in an assembly), is like a woman without breasts desiring (the enjoyment of ) woman-hood
kural.kannan_exp: An illiterate wishing to make a speech is like a breastless androgyne wishing to become a woman.

kural.pope_couplet: The blockheads, too, may men of worth appear,If they can keep from speaking where the learned hear
kural.pope_exp: The unlearned also are very excellent men, if they know how to keep silence before the learned
kural.kannan_exp: Even the ignorant will be considered good if they shut themselves up before the learned.

kural.pope_couplet: From blockheads' lips, when words of wisdom glibly flow,The wise receive them not, though good they seem to show
kural.pope_exp: Although the natural knowledge of an unlearned man may be very good, the wise will not accept for true knowledge
kural.kannan_exp: Though the illiterate may display streaks of intelligence, they would still not be acknowledged by the learned.

kural.pope_couplet: As worthless shows the worth of man unlearned,When council meets, by words he speaks discerned
kural.pope_exp: The self-conceit of an unlearned man will fade away, as soon as he speaks in an assembly (of
kural.kannan_exp: The vanity of the ignorant vanishes, when they start speaking in a gathering.

kural.pope_couplet: 'They are': so much is true of men untaught;But, like a barren field, they yield us nought
kural.pope_exp: The unlearned are like worthless barren land: all that can be said of them is, that they exist
kural.kannan_exp: The illiterate are seen as existing to fill space; they are like barren waste lands.

kural.pope_couplet: Who lack the power of subtle, large, and penetrating sense,Like puppet, decked with ornaments of clay, their beauty's vain pretence
kural.pope_exp: The beauty and goodness of one who is destitute of knowledge by the study of great and exquisite works, is like (the beauty and goodness) of a painted earthen doll
kural.kannan_exp: A person who has no in-depth learning and intellectual acumen, is as impressive as a doll made of mud.

kural.pope_couplet: To men unlearned, from fortune's favour greater-evil springsThan poverty to men of goodly wisdom brings
kural.pope_exp: Wealth, gained by the unlearned, will give more sorrow than the poverty which may come upon the learned
kural.kannan_exp: Not even the penury of the good is as pernicious as the wealth that has fallen on the ignorant.

kural.pope_couplet: Lower are men unlearned, though noble be their race,Than low-born men adorned with learning's grace
kural.pope_exp: The unlearned, though born in a high caste, are not equal in dignity to the learned; though they may have been born in a low caste
kural.kannan_exp: The uneducated maybe of higher birth; but they are not respected as much as the learned men born in low classes.

kural.pope_couplet: Learning's irradiating grace who gain,Others excel, as men the bestial train
kural.pope_exp: As beasts by the side of men, so are other men by the side of those who are learned in celebrated works
kural.kannan_exp: Animal amongst men are those uneducated amongst the erudite.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth of wealth is wealth acquired be ear attent;Wealth mid all wealth supremely excellent
kural.pope_exp: Wealth (gained) by the ear is wealth of wealth; that wealth is the chief of all wealth
kural.kannan_exp: The richness of the ear is the wealth amongst all wealth, the foremost wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: When 'tis no longer time the listening ear to feedWith trifling dole of food supply the body's need
kural.pope_exp: When there is no food for the ear, give a little also to the stomach
kural.kannan_exp: When food there is none for the ear, spare a little for the belly.

kural.pope_couplet: Who feed their ear with learned teachings rare,Are like the happy gods oblations rich who share
kural.pope_exp: Those who in this world enjoy instruction which is the food of the ear, are equal to the Gods, who enjoy the food of the sacrifices
kural.kannan_exp: Those who can feed aurally through listening, are equal, in this world, to the noble beings devouring divine food.

kural.pope_couplet: Though learning none hath he, yet let him hear alway:In weakness this shall prove a staff and stay
kural.pope_exp: Although a man be without learning, let him listen (to the teaching of the learned); that will be to him a staff in adversity
kural.kannan_exp: Even if you can’t learn by reading, listen; it is the crutch in times of crisis.

kural.pope_couplet: Like staff in hand of him in slippery ground who straysAre words from mouth of those who walk in righteous ways
kural.pope_exp: The words of the good are like a staff in a slippery place
kural.kannan_exp: A steadying staff on a skiddy surface, are the words of those who possess utmost propriety.

kural.pope_couplet: Let each man good things learn, for e'en as heShall learn, he gains increase of perfect dignity
kural.pope_exp: Let a man listen, never so little, to good (instruction), even that will bring him great dignity
kural.kannan_exp: Listen to the good; doesn’t matter, how much; whatever be the quantum, immense greatness, it will bring.

kural.pope_couplet: Not e'en through inadvertence speak they foolish word,With clear discerning mind who've learning's ample lessons heard
kural.pope_exp: Not even when they have imperfectly understood (a matter), will those men speak foolishly, who have profoundly studied and diligently listened (to instruction)
kural.kannan_exp: Misconstrue they may, but, ludicrous words, they will not utter: those who’ve always listened, analysed, and learnt.

kural.pope_couplet: Where teaching hath not oped the learner's ear,The man may listen, but he scarce can hear
kural.pope_exp: The ear which has not been bored by instruction, although it hears, is deaf
kural.kannan_exp: Hear, they can; but deaf they are: the ears that are not pierced by aural learning (*kelvi*).

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis hard for mouth to utter gentle, modest word,When ears discourse of lore refined have never heard
kural.pope_exp: It is a rare thing to find modesty, a reverend mouth- with those who have not received choice instruction
kural.kannan_exp: Unless one is an intense, attentive aural learner, it is unlikely that one will be have a humble tongue.

kural.pope_couplet: His mouth can taste, but ear no taste of joy can give!What matter if he die, or prosperous live
kural.pope_exp: What does it matter whether those men live or die, who can judge of tastes by the mouth, and not by the ear ?
kural.kannan_exp: Those beings who know the taste, only of the tongue,and not of the ear : does it matter whether die or live?

kural.pope_couplet: True wisdom wards off woes, A circling fortress high;Its inner strength man's eager foes Unshaken will defy
kural.pope_exp: Wisdom is a weapon to ward off destruction; it is an inner fortress which enemies cannot destroy
kural.kannan_exp: Wisdom is the shield against suffering; and the fortress, impregnable and indestructible for the foes.

kural.pope_couplet: Wisdom restrains, nor suffers mind to wander where it would;From every evil calls it back, and guides in way of good
kural.pope_exp: Not to permit the mind to go where it lists, to keep it from evil, and to employ it in good, this is wisdom
kural.kannan_exp: Without letting the mind to wander on its own will, wisdom steers it away from harm, and towards good.

kural.pope_couplet: Though things diverse from divers sages' lips we learn,'Tis wisdom's part in each the true thing to discern
kural.pope_exp: To discern the truth in every thing, by whomsoever spoken, is wisdom
kural.kannan_exp: Whatever whoever may say, listen to it, and wisdom is to comprehend the true meaning of it.

kural.pope_couplet: Wisdom hath use of lucid speech, words that acceptance win,And subtle sense of other men's discourse takes in
kural.pope_exp: To speak so as that the meaning may easily enter the mind of the hearer, and to discern the subtlest thought which may lie hidden in the words of others, this is wisdom
kural.kannan_exp: Wisdom is to keep it simple for your audience, and to comprehend complexities in others’ speech.

kural.pope_couplet: Wisdom embraces frank the world, to no caprice exposed;Unlike the lotus flower, now opened wide, now petals strictly closed
kural.pope_exp: To secure the friendship of the great is true wisdom; it is (also) wisdom to keep (that friendship unchanged, and) not opening and closing (like the lotus flower)
kural.kannan_exp: Wisdom, it is to embrace the world, and not to be overtly delighted or dismayed.

kural.pope_couplet: As dwells the world, so with the world to dwellIn harmony- this is to wisely live and well
kural.pope_exp: To live as the world lives, is wisdom
kural.kannan_exp: What the world conforms to, wisdom lies in conforming to those.

kural.pope_couplet: The wise discern, the foolish fail to see,And minds prepare for things about to be
kural.pope_exp: The wise are those who know beforehand what will happen; those who do not know this are the unwise
kural.kannan_exp: The wise anticipate the outcomes; unwise are those who can’t.

kural.pope_couplet: Folly meets fearful ills with fearless heart;To fear where cause of fear exists is wisdom's part
kural.pope_exp: Not to fear what ought to be feared, is folly; it is the work of the wise to fear what should be feared
