kural.kannan_exp: It is foolish, not to fear, what ought to be feared; the wise fear those that must be feared.

kural.pope_couplet: The wise with watchful soul who coming ills foresee;From coming evil's dreaded shock are free
kural.pope_exp: No terrifying calamity will happen to the wise, who (foresee) and guard against coming evils
kural.kannan_exp: The wise who are perceptive and take preventive measures, will not be staggered by any harm.

kural.pope_couplet: The wise is rich, with ev'ry blessing blest;The fool is poor, of everything possessed
kural.pope_exp: Those who possess wisdom, possess every thing; those who have not wisdom, whatever they may possess, have nothing
kural.kannan_exp: The wise have everything; the unwise have nothing, irrespective of whatever they may possess.

kural.pope_couplet: Who arrogance, and wrath, and littleness of low desire restrain,To sure increase of lofty dignity attain
kural.pope_exp: Truly great is the excellence of those (kings) who are free from pride, anger, and lust
kural.kannan_exp: Those who lack arrogance, wrath and pettiness: wealth, in their hands, assumes dignity.

kural.pope_couplet: A niggard hand, o'erweening self-regard, and mirthUnseemly, bring disgrace to men of kingly brith
kural.pope_exp: Avarice, undignified pride, and low pleasures are faults in a king
kural.kannan_exp: Avarice, ignominious pride, and repulsive gloating, are fatal flaws in a leader.

kural.pope_couplet: Though small as millet-seed the fault men deem;As palm tree vast to those who fear disgrace 'twill seem
kural.pope_exp: Those who fear guilt, if they commit a fault small as a millet seed, will consider it to be as large as a palmyra tree
kural.kannan_exp: For those who fear disgrace, their faults, though grain-sized, woud seem gigantic.

kural.pope_couplet: Freedom from faults is wealth; watch heedfully'Gainst these, for fault is fatal enmity
kural.pope_exp: Guard against faults as a matter (of great consequence; for) faults are a deadly enemy
kural.kannan_exp: Fend off your own flaws; those flaws are your fatal foes.

kural.pope_couplet: His joy who guards not 'gainst the coming evil day,Like straw before the fire shall swift consume away
kural.pope_exp: The prosperity of him who does not timely guard against faults, will perish like straw before fire
kural.kannan_exp: Having no safeguards before the onset of trouble, will make our lives, dry straws before a raging fire.

kural.pope_couplet: Faultless the king who first his own faults cures, and thenPermits himself to scan faults of other men
kural.pope_exp: What fault will remain in the king who has put away his own evils, and looks after the evils of others
kural.kannan_exp: What flaw could fall upon a leader who rectifies his faults before observing and assailing others’ faults.

kural.pope_couplet: Who leaves undone what should be done, with niggard mind,His wealth shall perish, leaving not a wrack behind
kural.pope_exp: The wealth of the avaricious man, who does not expend it for the purposes for which he ought to expend it will waste away and not continue
kural.kannan_exp: The wealth of one who, out of pettiness, doesn’t do what ought to done, will vanish without growth.

kural.pope_couplet: The greed of soul that avarice men call,When faults are summed, is worst of all
kural.pope_exp: Griping avarice is not to be reckoned as one among other faults; (it stands alone - greater than all)
kural.kannan_exp: Clinging to wealth, out of avarice, is worse than the any other flaw.

kural.pope_couplet: Never indulge in self-complaisant mood,Nor deed desire that yields no gain of good
kural.pope_exp: Let no (one) praise himself, at any time; let him not desire to do useless things
kural.kannan_exp: Never give in to egotism; never indulge in vain acts that benefit none.

kural.pope_couplet: If, to your foes unknown, you cherish what you love,Counsels of men who wish you harm will harmless prove
kural.pope_exp: If (a king) enjoys, privately the things which he desires, the designs of his enemies will be useless
kural.kannan_exp: Those who enjoys what they enjoy, unknown to foes, are difficult to defeat.

kural.pope_couplet: As friends the men who virtue know, and riper wisdom share,Their worth weighed well, the king should choose with care
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) ponder well its value, and secure the friendship of men of virtue and of mature knowledge
kural.kannan_exp: Assess, know the potential, and secure the company of virtuous, veteran, wise men.

kural.pope_couplet: Cherish the all-accomplished men as friends,Whose skill the present ill removes, from coming ill defends
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) procure and kindly care for men who can overcome difficulties when they occur, and guard against them before they happen
kural.kannan_exp: Nurture the relationship of those who relieve, and ward off your miseries.

kural.pope_couplet: To cherish men of mighty soul, and make them all their own,Of kingly treasures rare, as rarest gift is known
kural.pope_exp: To cherish great men and make them his own, is the most difficult of all difficult things
kural.kannan_exp: It is most precious to nurture, and possess the company of great men.

kural.pope_couplet: To live with men of greatness that their own excels,As cherished friends, is greatest power that with a monarch dwells
kural.pope_exp: So to act as to make those men, his own, who are greater than himself is of all powers the highest
kural.kannan_exp: The mightiest of all strengths is to patronize, and pay heed to those who are better than us.

kural.pope_couplet: The king, since counsellors are monarch's eyes,Should counsellors select with counsel wise
kural.pope_exp: As a king must use his ministers as eyes (in managing his kingdom), let him well examine their character and qualifications before he engages them
kural.kannan_exp: A ruler rules best with wise counsellors as eyes; select them after watchful scrutiny.

kural.pope_couplet: The king, who knows to live with worthy men allied,Has nought to fear from any foeman's pride
kural.pope_exp: There will be nothing left for enemies to do, against him who has the power of acting (so as to secure) the fellowship of worthy men
kural.kannan_exp: When a capable leader feels at ease with capable associates, there is nothing his foes can do to harm him.

kural.pope_couplet: What power can work his fall, who faithful ministersEmploys, that thunder out reproaches when he errs
kural.pope_exp: Who are great enough to destroy him who has servants that have power to rebuke him ?
kural.kannan_exp: One who leads companions who can admonish him : who is capable of harming him?

kural.pope_couplet: The king with none to censure him, bereft of safeguards all,Though none his ruin work, shall surely ruined fall
kural.pope_exp: The king, who is without the guard of men who can rebuke him, will perish, even though there be no one to destroy him
kural.kannan_exp: A ruler unprotected by companions who can admonish him, will face ruin without any foes ruining him.

kural.pope_couplet: Who owns no principal, can have no gain of usury;Who lacks support of friends, knows no stability
kural.pope_exp: There can be no gain to those who have no capital; and in like manner there can be no permanence to
kural.kannan_exp: There is no return without investment; for leaders, there is no stability without the prop of their supporters.

kural.pope_couplet: Than hate of many foes incurred, works greater woeTen-fold, of worthy men the friendship to forego
kural.pope_exp: It is tenfold more injurious to abandon the friendship of the good, than to incur the hatred of the many
kural.kannan_exp: Tenfold worse it is, to lose the company of the good, than to earn the hostility of many foes.

kural.pope_couplet: The great of soul will mean association fear;The mean of soul regard mean men as kinsmen dear
kural.pope_exp: (True) greatness fears the society of the base; it is only the low - minded who will regard them as friends
kural.kannan_exp: The great, fear petty company; the petty, perceive, and accept, them as their own.

kural.pope_couplet: The waters' virtues change with soil through which they flow;As man's companionship so will his wisdom show
kural.pope_exp: As water changes (its nature), from the nature of the soil (in which it flows), so will the character of men resemble that of their associates
kural.kannan_exp: Water assumes the quality of the land; wisdom depends on the company one keeps.

kural.pope_couplet: Perceptions manifold in men are of the mind alone;The value of the man by his companionship is known
kural.pope_exp: The power of knowing is from the mind; (but) his character is from that of his associates
kural.kannan_exp: Senses are governed by the brain; reputation is determined by one’s company.

kural.pope_couplet: Man's wisdom seems the offspring of his mind;'Tis outcome of companionship we find
kural.pope_exp: Wisdom appears to rest in the mind, but it really exists to a man in his companions
kural.kannan_exp: Wisdom seems to stem from the mind but is shaped by people around us.

kural.pope_couplet: Both purity of mind, and purity of action clear,Leaning no staff of pure companionship, to man draw near
kural.pope_exp: Chaste company is the staff on which come, these two things, viz, purity of mind and purity of conduct
kural.kannan_exp: Purity of mind, and deeds, depends on the quality of one’s associations.

kural.pope_couplet: From true pure-minded men a virtuous race proceeds;To men of pure companionship belong no evil deeds
kural.pope_exp: To the pure-minded there will be a good posterity By those whose associates are pure, no deeds will be done that are not good
kural.kannan_exp: Those who are pure at heart, will leave behind good children and legacy; those who have clean company will find no good task impossible.

kural.pope_couplet: Goodness of mind to lives of men increaseth gain;And good companionship doth all of praise obtain
kural.pope_exp: Goodness of mind will give wealth, and good society will bring with it all praise, to men
kural.kannan_exp: The goodness of heart is a treasure for humans; goodness of company leads to glory.

kural.pope_couplet: To perfect men, though minds right good belong,Yet good companionship is confirmation strong
kural.pope_exp: Yet good companionship is confirmation strong
kural.kannan_exp: Even for noble scholars, who are good at heart, good company offers strong protection.

kural.pope_couplet: Although to mental goodness joys of other life belong,Yet good companionship is confirmation strong
kural.pope_exp: Future bliss is (the result) of goodness of mind; and even this acquires strength from the society of the good
kural.kannan_exp: Goodness of heart leads to joy even after death; good company protects it from straying.

kural.pope_couplet: Than good companionship no surer help we know;Than bad companionship nought causes direr woe
kural.pope_exp: There is no greater help than the company of the good; there is no greater source of sorrow than the company of the wicked
kural.kannan_exp: There is no better ally than good company; no woe can be worse than bad company.

kural.pope_couplet: Expenditure, return, and profit of the deedIn time to come; weigh these- than to the act proceed
kural.pope_exp: Let a man reflect on what will be lost, what will be acquired and (from these) what will be his ultimate gain, and (then, let him) act
kural.kannan_exp: What gets consumed, what gets created, and the returns the creation yields : consider all before starting a task.

kural.pope_couplet: With chosen friends deliberate; next use the private thought;Then act By those who thus proceed all works with ease are wrought
kural.pope_exp: There is nothing too difficult to (be attained by) those who, before they act, reflect well themselves, and thoroughly consider (the matter) with chosen friends
kural.kannan_exp: Nothing is impossible for those who start a task with aptly chosen associates, and after thorough assessment.

kural.pope_couplet: To risk one's all and lose, aiming at added gain,Is rash affair, from which the wise abstain
kural.pope_exp: Wise men will not, in the hopes of profit, undertake works that will consume their principal
kural.kannan_exp: Losing the capital in pursuit of profit is not a task the wise will undertake.

kural.pope_couplet: A work of which the issue is not clear,Begin not they reproachful scorn who fear
kural.pope_exp: Those who fear reproach will not commence anything which has not been (thoroughly considered) and made clear to them
kural.kannan_exp: Without assessing and getting clarity, will they not start, they who fear the stain of ignominy.

kural.pope_couplet: With plans not well matured to rise against your foe,Is way to plant him out where he is sure to grow
kural.pope_exp: One way to promote the prosperity of an enemy, is (for a king) to set out (to war) without having thoroughly weighed his ability (to cope with its chances)
kural.kannan_exp: Leaping before you look is like planting foes, and nurturing them.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis ruin if man do an unbefitting thing;Fit things to leave undone will equal ruin bring
kural.pope_exp: He will perish who does not what is not fit to do; and he also will perish who does not do what it is fit to
kural.kannan_exp: To do what ought not to be done is disastrous; not to do what ought to be done is equally so.

kural.pope_couplet: Think, and then dare the deed! Who cry,'Deed dared, we'll think,' disgraced shall be
kural.pope_exp: Consider, and then undertake a matter; after having undertaken it, to say "We will consider," is folly
kural.kannan_exp: Think before you start; to think that you can think after starting spells doom.

kural.pope_couplet: On no right system if man toil and strive,Though many men assist, no work can thrive
kural.pope_exp: The work, which is not done by suitable methods, will fail though many stand to uphold it
kural.kannan_exp: Hard work, the wrong way, will be futile even if the world applauds.

kural.pope_couplet: Though well the work be done, yet one mistake is made,To habitudes of various men when no regard is paid
kural.pope_exp: There are failures even in acting well, when it is done without knowing the various dispositions of men
kural.kannan_exp: Well-intended actions could go awry, if they are not customized to suit the nature of all those involved.

kural.pope_couplet: Plan and perform no work that others may despise;What misbeseems a king the world will not approve as wise
kural.pope_exp: Let a man reflect, and do things which bring no reproach; the world will not approve, with him, of things which do not become of his position to adopt
kural.kannan_exp: The world doesn’t accept what it can’t approve; assess and act such that you are not ridiculed.

kural.pope_couplet: The force the strife demands, the force he owns, the force of foes,The force of friends; these should he weigh ere to the war he goes
kural.pope_exp: Let (one) weigh well the strength of the deed (he purposes to do), his own strength, the strength of his enemy, and the strength of the allies (of both), and then let him act
kural.kannan_exp: Assess before an action, the strengths of the task, self, opponents and companions.

kural.pope_couplet: Who know what can be wrought, with knowledge of the means, on this,Their mind firm set, go forth, nought goes with them amiss
kural.pope_exp: There is nothing which may not be accomplished by those who, before they attack (an enemy), make themselves acquainted with their own ability, and with whatever else is (needful) to be known, and
kural.kannan_exp: Know what is achievable, gain requisite knowledge, and stay focussed : nothing is impossible. Anticipate outcomes, learn what needs to be learnt, and stay focussed : nothing is impossible.

kural.pope_couplet: Ill-deeming of their proper powers, have many monarchs striven,And midmost of unequal conflict fallen asunder riven
kural.pope_exp: There are many who, ignorant of their (want of) power (to meet it), have haughtily set out to war, and broken down in the midst of it
kural.kannan_exp: Many have boken down midway, having started with fervour without assessing their capabilities.

kural.pope_couplet: Who not agrees with those around, no moderation knows,In self-applause indulging, swift to ruin goes
kural.pope_exp: He will quickly perish who, ignorant of his own resources flatters himself of his greatness, and does
kural.kannan_exp: One who neither collaborates nor knows his capabilities, but, is narcissistic, is slated to fail fast.

kural.pope_couplet: With peacock feathers light, you load the wain;Yet, heaped too high, the axle snaps in twain
kural.pope_exp: The axle tree of a bandy, loaded only with peacocks' feathers will break, if it be greatly overloaded
kural.kannan_exp: A cart, though laden with only peacock feathers, may yet have its axle broken, when overloaded.

kural.pope_couplet: Who daring climbs, and would himself upraiseBeyond the branch's tip, with life the forfeit pays
kural.pope_exp: There will be an end to the life of him who, having climbed out to the end of a branch, ventures to go further
kural.kannan_exp: Having climbed to the tip of a branch, striving to go further, will be fatal.

kural.pope_couplet: With knowledge of the measure due, as virtue bids you give!That is the way to guard your wealth, and seemly live
kural.pope_exp: Let a man know the measure of his ability (to give), and let him give accordingly; such giving is the way to preserve his property
kural.kannan_exp: Do charity, but within your means; that is the way to utilize, and protect, wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: Incomings may be scant; but yet, no failure there,If in expenditure you rightly learn to spare
kural.pope_exp: Even though the income (of a king) be small, it will not cause his (ruin), if his outgoings be not larger than his income
kural.kannan_exp: Though revenues are limited, no harm – if you don’t let expenses exceed them.

kural.pope_couplet: Who prosperous lives and of enjoyment knows no bound,His seeming wealth, departing, nowhere shall be found
kural.pope_exp: The prosperity of him who lives without knowing the measure (of his property), will perish, even while it seems to continue
kural.kannan_exp: A life lived beyond one’s means, will look glitzy but will lose its sheen and give way to gloom.

kural.pope_couplet: Beneficence that measures not its bound of means,Will swiftly bring to nought the wealth on which it leans
kural.pope_exp: The measure of his wealth will quickly perish, whose liberality weighs not the measure of his property
kural.kannan_exp: Generosity beyond the limits of one’s resources, is bound to cease soon, after exhausting the resources.

kural.pope_couplet: A crow will conquer owl in broad daylight;The king that foes would crush, needs fitting time to fight
kural.pope_exp: A crow will overcome an owl in the day time; so the king who would conquer his enemy must have (a suitable) time
kural.kannan_exp: A crow will defeat an owl during the day; a king needs to pick the right time to defeat his foes.

kural.pope_couplet: The bond binds fortune fast is ordered effort made,Strictly observant still of favouring season's aid
kural.pope_exp: Acting at the right season, is a cord that will immoveably bind success (to a king)
kural.kannan_exp: Doing the right things at the right time, is the rope which binds the wealth, making it boundless.

kural.pope_couplet: Can any work be hard in very fact,If men use fitting means in timely act
kural.pope_exp: Is there anything difficult for him to do, who acts, with (the right) instruments at the right time ?
kural.kannan_exp: Does an impossible task exist, when the right resources and strategy are deployed at the right time?

kural.pope_couplet: The pendant world's dominion may be won,In fitting time and place by action done
kural.pope_exp: Though (a man) should meditate (the conquest of) the world, he may accomplish it if he acts in the right time, and at the right place
kural.kannan_exp: Desire the world, you may, and it will be yours, if, for your actions, you choose the right time and place.

kural.pope_couplet: Who think the pendant world itself to subjugate,With mind unruffled for the fitting time must wait
kural.pope_exp: They who thoughtfully consider and wait for the (right) time (for action), may successfully meditate (the conquest of) the world
kural.kannan_exp: They will await the opportune moment – they, who determinedly desire the world.

kural.pope_couplet: The men of mighty power their hidden energies repress,As fighting ram recoils to rush on foe with heavier stress
kural.pope_exp: The self-restraint of the energetic (while waiting for a suitable opportunity), is like the drawing back of a fighting-ram in order to butt
kural.kannan_exp: The ardent and the mighty too can stay subdued like a rampant ram that withdraws before it pounces.

kural.pope_couplet: The glorious once of wrath enkindled make no outward show,At once; they bide their time, while hidden fires within them glow
kural.pope_exp: The wise will not immediately and hastily shew out their anger; they will watch their time, and restrain it within
kural.kannan_exp: The wise will not break into an external rage instantly; they will keep their anger suppressed, biding their time.

kural.pope_couplet: If foes' detested form they see, with patience let them bear;When fateful hour at last they spy,- the head lies there
kural.pope_exp: If one meets his enemy, let him show him all respect, until the time for his destruction is come; when that is come, his head will be easily brought low
kural.kannan_exp: Bear with your foes; when the time is ripe, turn things around.

kural.pope_couplet: When hardest gain of opportunity at last is won,With promptitude let hardest deed be done
kural.pope_exp: If a rare opportunity occurs, while it lasts, let a man do that which is rarely to be accomplished (but for such an opportunity)
kural.kannan_exp: When the rarest of moments comes about, grab it to accomplish the toughest of tasks.

kural.pope_couplet: As heron stands with folded wing, so wait in waiting hour;As heron snaps its prey, when fortune smiles, put forth your power
kural.pope_exp: At the time when one should use self-control, let him restrain himself like a heron; and, let him like it, strike, when there is a favourable opportunity
kural.kannan_exp: Like a heron, be still when the time is not ripe, and spear the prey when it is near.

kural.pope_couplet: Begin no work of war, depise no foe,Till place where you can wholly circumvent you know
kural.pope_exp: Let not (a king) despise (an enemy), nor undertake any thing (against him), until he has obtained (a suitable) place for besieging him
kural.kannan_exp: Start not a task, thinking it is easy, until you choose the right place to accomplish it.

kural.pope_couplet: Though skill in war combine with courage tried on battle-field,The added gain of fort doth great advantage yield
kural.pope_exp: Even to those who are men of power and expedients, an attack in connection with a fortification will yield many advantages
kural.kannan_exp: Even for the mighty, seeking to conquer, a fortress offers benefits galore.

kural.pope_couplet: E'en weak ones mightily prevail, if place of strong defence,They find, protect themselves, and work their foes offence
kural.pope_exp: Even the powerless will become powerful and conquer, if they select a proper field (of action), and guard themselves, while they make war on their enemies
kural.kannan_exp: Even the meek will battle and win, when they tenaciously take on their foes at the right place.

kural.pope_couplet: The foes who thought to triumph, find their thoughts were vain,If hosts advance, seize vantage ground, and thence the fight maintain
kural.pope_exp: If they who draw near (to fight) choose a suitable place to approach (their enemy), the latter, will have to relinquish the thought which they once entertained, of conquering them
kural.kannan_exp: Their dismissive opponents will lose the plot, when those who undertake a task, do it right at the right place.

kural.pope_couplet: The crocodile prevails in its own flow of water wide,If this it leaves, 'tis slain by anything beside
kural.pope_exp: In deep water, a crocodile will conquer (all other animals); but if it leave the water, other animals will conquer it
kural.kannan_exp: In deep waters, the crocodile wins. When it gets out, it is vanquished.

kural.pope_couplet: The lofty car, with mighty wheel, sails not o'er watery main,The boat that skims the sea, runs not on earth's hard plain
kural.pope_exp: Wide chariots, with mighty wheels, will not run on the ocean; neither will ships that the traverse ocean, move on the earth
kural.kannan_exp: Neither will the strongest chariots sail the seas, nor will the seafaring ships ride the land.

kural.pope_couplet: Save their own fearless might they need no other aid,If in right place they fight, all due provision made
kural.pope_exp: You will need no other aid than fearlessness, if you thoroughly reflect (on what you are to do), and select (a suitable) place for your operations
kural.kannan_exp: If, after considering all angles, one chooses to do a task at an apt place, he needs no company other than fearlessness.

kural.pope_couplet: If lord of army vast the safe retreat assailOf him whose host is small, his mightiest efforts fail
kural.pope_exp: The power of one who has a large army will perish, if he goes into ground where only a small army can act
kural.kannan_exp: If a king with a measly army battles from a strategic location, the confidence of the mighty foe gets shattered.

kural.pope_couplet: Though fort be none, and store of wealth they lack,'Tis hard a people's homesteads to attack
kural.pope_exp: It is a hazardous thing to attack men in their own country, although they may neither have power nor a good fortress
kural.kannan_exp: Even if the foes are devoid of fortresses and exceptional valour, it is tough to beat them on their turf.

kural.pope_couplet: The jackal slays, in miry paths of foot-betraying fen,The elephant of fearless eye and tusks transfixing armed men
kural.pope_exp: A fox can kill a fearless, warrior-faced elephant, if it go into mud in which its legs sink down
kural.kannan_exp: An uncontrollable tusker that has gored many a spearman, when stuck in a deep quagmire, is easy prey for a fox.

kural.pope_couplet: How treats he virtue, wealth and pleasure? How, when life's at stake,Comports himself? This four-fold test of man will full assurance make
kural.pope_exp: Let (a minister) be chosen, after he has been tried by means of these four things, viz,-his virtue, (love of) money, (love of) sexual pleasure, and tear of (losing) life
kural.kannan_exp: Assess the attitude of a person on these four aspects before choosing him: righteousness (aram), money, lust and fear for life.

kural.pope_couplet: Of noble race, of faultless worth, of generous prideThat shrinks from shame or stain; in him may king confide
kural.pope_exp: (The king's) choice should (fall) on him, who is of good family, who is free from faults, and who has the modesty which fears the wounds (of sin)
kural.kannan_exp: Accept only a person who is of good birth, is clear of flaws, has fear for infamy and shame.

kural.pope_couplet: Though deeply learned, unflecked by fault, 'tis rare to see,When closely scanned, a man from all unwisdom free
kural.pope_exp: When even men, who have studied the most difficult works, and who are free from faults, are (carefully) examined, it is a rare thing to find them without ignorance
kural.kannan_exp: Even a person who is known to be erudite and faultless, if assessed well, will rarely be free of flaws and ignorance.

kural.pope_couplet: Weigh well the good of each, his failings closely scan,As these or those prevail, so estimate the man
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) consider (a man's) good qualities, as well as his faults, and then judge (of his character) by that which prevails
kural.kannan_exp: Weigh the virtues and vices, discern which is more, and thus decide.

kural.pope_couplet: Of greatness and of meanness too,The deeds of each are touchstone true
kural.pope_exp: A man's deeds are the touchstone of his greatness and littleness
kural.kannan_exp: The touchstone for greatness or unworthiness is one’s own deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: Beware of trusting men who have no kith of kin;No bonds restrain such men, no shame deters from sin
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) avoid choosing men who have no relations; such men have no attachment, and thereforehave no fear of crime
kural.kannan_exp: Choose not those who have made no friends : devoid of any affinity, they won’t dread disgrace.

kural.pope_couplet: By fond affection led who trusts in men of unwise soul,Yields all his being up to folly's blind control
kural.pope_exp: Yields all his being up to folly's blind control
kural.kannan_exp: Out of affection, choosing those who know not what needs to be known, will result in folly.

kural.pope_couplet: Who trusts an untried stranger, brings disgrace,Remediless, on all his race
kural.pope_exp: Sorrow that will not leave even his posterity will come upon him chooses a stranger whose character he has not known
kural.kannan_exp: One who accepts without assessing, will invite harm that will last for generations.

kural.pope_couplet: Trust no man whom you have not fully tried,When tested, in his prudence proved confide
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) choose no one without previous consideration; after he has made his choice, let him unhesitatingly select for each such duties as are appropriate
kural.kannan_exp: Choose not anyone without assessment; once chosen, trust the person to deliver on the assigned tasks.

kural.pope_couplet: Trust where you have not tried, doubt of a friend to feel,Once trusted, wounds inflict that nought can heal
kural.pope_exp: To make choice of one who has not been examined, and to entertain doubts respecting one who has been chosen, will produce irremediable sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Selecting without assessing, and doubting after selecting, will ensure enduring distress.

kural.pope_couplet: Who good and evil scanning, ever makes the good his joy;Such man of virtuous mood should king employ
kural.pope_exp: He should be employed (by a king), whose nature leads him to choose the good, after having weighed both the evil and the good in any undertaking
kural.kannan_exp: A person, because of his ability to execute well by assessing pros and cons, will assume charge of key assignments. A person, who assesses pros and cons, and has done well, will be entrusted with key responsibilities. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Who swells the revenues, spreads plenty o'er the land,Seeks out what hinders progress, his the workman's hand
kural.pope_exp: Let him do (the king's) work who can enlarge the sources (of revenue), increase wealth and considerately prevent the accidents (which would destroy it)
kural.kannan_exp: Let him do that task – he, who has multiplied the sources of income, generated revenues, and analysed and overcome hurdles.

kural.pope_couplet: A loyal love with wisdom, clearness, mind from avarice free;Who hath these four good gifts should ever trusted be
kural.pope_exp: Let the choice (of a king) fall upon him who largely possesses these four things, love, knowledge, a clear mind and freedom from covetousness
kural.kannan_exp: Love, wisdom, fearless analytical mind and lack of misdirected desire: go for a person who scores high on these.

kural.pope_couplet: Even when tests of every kind are multiplied,Full many a man proves otherwise, by action tried
kural.pope_exp: Even when (a king) has tried them in every possible way, there are many men who change, from the nature of the works (in which they may be employed)
kural.kannan_exp: In whatever way we may have assessed and chosen people, they stand out based on quality of execution. In whatever way we may have assessed and chosen people, they are differentiated based on quality of execution. V2

kural.pope_couplet: No specious fav'rite should the king's commission bear,But he that knows, and work performs with patient care
kural.pope_exp: (A king's) work can only be accomplished by a man of wisdom and patient endurance; it is not of a nature to be given to one from mere personal attachment
kural.kannan_exp: Assign the task to those who know it, can plan, execute and get it done; and not to the most prominent, or likeable, person.

kural.pope_couplet: Let king first ask, 'Who shall the deed perform?' and 'What the deed?'Of hour befitting both assured, let every work proceed
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) act, after having considered the agent (whom he is to employ), the deed (he desires to do), and the time which is suitable to it
kural.kannan_exp: Assign a task after assessing the person, the task and the most suited time.

kural.pope_couplet: 'This man, this work shall thus work out,' let thoughtful king command;Then leave the matter wholly in his servant's hand
kural.pope_exp: After having considered, "this man can accomplish this, by these means", let (the king) leave with him the discharge of that duty
kural.kannan_exp: This task – he can do, using these resources : once you reason it out thus, leave the task to him. Assess and determine that he can do this task, using these resources, and empower him to do the task. v2

kural.pope_couplet: As each man's special aptitude is known,Bid each man make that special work his own
kural.pope_exp: Having considered what work a man is fit for, let (the king) employ him in that work
kural.kannan_exp: After figuring out who should own a task, equip and empower him to get the task done.

kural.pope_couplet: Fortune deserts the king who ill can bear,Informal friendly ways of men his tolls who share
kural.pope_exp: Prosperity will leave (the king) who doubts the friendship of the man who steadily labours in the discharge of his duties
kural.kannan_exp: Wealth will desert the leader who doubts the intimacy of the expert doing a task on account of the task.

kural.pope_couplet: Let king search out his servants' deeds each day;When these do right, the world goes rightly on its way
kural.pope_exp: Let a king daily examine the conduct of his servants; if they do not act crookedly, the world will not act crookedly
kural.kannan_exp: The ruler should review progress regularly – as long as his officials don’t falter, his state won’t falter.

kural.pope_couplet: When wealth is fled, old kindness still to show,Is kindly grace that only kinsmen know
kural.pope_exp: Even when (a man's) property is all gone, relatives will act towards him with their accustomed (kindness)
kural.kannan_exp: Even when all wealth is lost, it is the kin who will maintain their ties.

kural.pope_couplet: The gift of kin's unfailing love bestowsMuch gain of good, like flower that fadeless blows
kural.pope_exp: If (a man's) relatives remain attached to him with unchanging love, it will be a source of everincreasing wealth
kural.kannan_exp: If one gets kin who never lose their love, wealth never ceases sprouting in different ways.

kural.pope_couplet: His joy of life who mingles not with kinsmen gathered round,Is lake where streams pour in, with no encircling bound
kural.pope_exp: The wealth of one who does not mingle freely with his relatives, will be like the filling of water in a
kural.kannan_exp: The life of one with no intimate relationship, is like water flowing into a pond with no bounds.

kural.pope_couplet: The profit gained by wealth's increase,Is living compassed round by relatives in peace
kural.pope_exp: To live surrounded by relatives, is the advantage to be derived from the acquisition of wealth
kural.kannan_exp: To live surrounded by the kin, is the benefit gained by gaining wealth. To live such that you are surrounded by the kin, is the purpose served by gaining wealth. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Who knows the use of pleasant words, and liberal gifts can give,Connections, heaps of them, surrounding him shall live
kural.pope_exp: He will be surrounded by numerous relatives who manifests generosity and affability
kural.kannan_exp: One who practices generosity and kind words, will be encircled by an extended family.

kural.pope_couplet: Than one who gifts bestows and wrath restrains,Through the wide world none larger following gains
kural.pope_exp: No one, in all the world, will have so many relatives (about him), as he who makes large gift, and does not give way to anger
kural.kannan_exp: He gives generously and is free of anger – none on this earth can have better kin than him.

kural.pope_couplet: The crows conceal not, call their friends to come, then eat;Increase of good such worthy ones shall meet
kural.pope_exp: The crows do not conceal (their prey), but will call out for others (to share with them) while they eat it; wealth will be with those who show a similar disposition (towards their relatives)
kural.kannan_exp: The crow never conceals food but cries out for company; wealth and progress too stays only with those of such quality.

kural.pope_couplet: Where king regards not all alike, but each in his degree,'Neath such discerning rule many dwell happily
kural.pope_exp: Many relatives will live near a king, when they observe that he does not look on all alike, but that he looks on each man according to his merit
kural.kannan_exp: A king who avoids an undifferentiated approach but tailors it to suit differing capabilities, will retain many who will appreciate it.

kural.pope_couplet: Who once were his, and then forsook him, as beforeWill come around, when cause of disagreement is no more
kural.pope_exp: Those who have been friends and have afterwards forsaken him, will return and join themselves (to him), when the cause of disagreement is not to be found in him
kural.kannan_exp: Well-wishers who had broken with you before, will return if the cause for resentment is rectified.

kural.pope_couplet: Who causeless went away, then to return, for any cause, ask leave;The king should sift their motives well, consider, and receive
kural.pope_exp: When one may have left him, and for some cause has returned to him, let the king fulfil the object (for which he has come back) and thoughtfully receive him again
kural.kannan_exp: When defectors return for any reason, the ruler should be open to accept them, after due assessment.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis greater ill, it rapture of o'erweening gladness to the soulBring self-forgetfulness than if transcendent wrath control
kural.pope_exp: More evil than excessive anger, is forgetfulness which springs from the intoxication of great joy
kural.kannan_exp: Getting slack and smug when relishing a joyous moment is more harmful than excessive anger.

kural.pope_couplet: Perpetual, poverty is death to wisdom of the wise;When man forgets himself his glory dies
kural.pope_exp: Forgetfulness will destroy fame, even as constant poverty destroys knowledge
kural.kannan_exp: Complacence, sloth and contempt slaughter one’s reputation just as begging and gorging will kill one’s wisdom.

kural.pope_couplet: 'To self-oblivious men no praise'; this ruleDecisive wisdom sums of every school
kural.pope_exp: Thoughtlessness will never acquire fame; and this tenet is upheld by all treatises in the world
kural.kannan_exp: There is no fame for those who are smug, lax or derisive : scholars of all walks and beliefs concur on this.

kural.pope_couplet: 'To cowards is no fort's defence'; e'en soThe self-oblivious men no blessing know
kural.pope_exp: Just as the coward has no defence (by whatever fortifications ha may be surrounded), so the thoughtless has no good (whatever advantages he may possess)
kural.kannan_exp: No fortress is good enough for those who’ve fear; no good can occur to those who are smug, slack or derisive.

kural.pope_couplet: To him who nought foresees, recks not of anything,The after woe shall sure repentance bring
kural.pope_exp: The thoughtless man, who provides not against the calamities that may happen, will afterwards repent for his fault
kural.kannan_exp: One who is complacent and derisive, and doesn’t anticipate the repercussions, will resent his lapses later.

kural.pope_couplet: Towards all unswerving, ever watchfulness of soul retain,Where this is found there is no greater gain
kural.pope_exp: There is nothing comparable with the possession of unfailing thoughtfulness at all times; and towards all persons
kural.kannan_exp: Never be complacent about any task or deride anyone : nothing is better than following this unswervingly.

kural.pope_couplet: Though things are arduous deemed, there's nought may not be won,When work with mind's unslumbering energy and thought is done
kural.pope_exp: There is nothing too difficult to be accomplished, if a man set about it carefully, with unflinching endeavour
kural.kannan_exp: The impossible doesn’t exist when you do the task diligently, with an alert, incomplacent mind.

kural.pope_couplet: Let things that merit praise thy watchful soul employ;Who these despise attain through sevenfold births no joy
kural.pope_exp: Let (a man) observe and do these things which have been praised (by the wise); if he neglects and fails to perform them, for him there will be no (happiness) throughout the seven births
kural.kannan_exp: Do, diligently, deeds that have been extolled; not in seven births will they benefit – those who derisively avoid those deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: Think on the men whom scornful mind hath brought to nought,When exultation overwhelms thy wildered thought
kural.pope_exp: Let (a king) think of those who have been ruined by neglect, when his mind is elated with joy
kural.kannan_exp: Think of those who were doomed due to derision and negligence, when you bask smugly in the glory of your might.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis easy what thou hast in mind to gain,If what thou hast in mind thy mind retain
kural.pope_exp: It is easy for (one) to obtain whatever he may think of, if he can again think of it
kural.kannan_exp: Easy it is, to get what you seek, if you’re focused on that you seek.

kural.pope_couplet: Search out, to no one favour show; with heart that justice lovesConsult, then act; this is the rule that right approves
kural.pope_exp: To examine into (the crimes which may be committed), to show no favour (to any one), to desire to act with impartiality towards all, and to inflict (such punishments) as may be wisely resolved on,
kural.kannan_exp: Investigating intensely, leading fairly without unduly favoring anyone, analysing and acting, constitute justice.

kural.pope_couplet: All earth looks up to heav'n whence raindrops fall;All subjects look to king that ruleth all
kural.pope_exp: When there is rain, the living creation thrives; and so when the king rules justly, his subjects thrive
kural.kannan_exp: The world survives, looking up to the skies for rain; the people live, looking up to their ruler’s sceptre for justice.

kural.pope_couplet: Learning and virtue of the sages spring,From all-controlling sceptre of the king
kural.pope_exp: The sceptre of the king is the firm support of the Vedas of the Brahmin, and of all virtues therein described
kural.kannan_exp: The scriptures that scholars write and the virtues they extol, have their roots in the sceptre of the ruler.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose heart embraces subjects all, lord over mighty landWho rules, the world his feet embracing stands
kural.pope_exp: The world will constantly embrace the feet of the great king who rules over his subjects with love
kural.kannan_exp: The world will embrace the feet of the ruler, who embraces his people and renders justice.

kural.pope_couplet: Where king, who righteous laws regards, the sceptre wields,There fall the showers, there rich abundance crowns the fields
kural.pope_exp: Rain and plentiful crops will ever dwell together in the country of the king who sways his sceptre with justice
kural.kannan_exp: In the state of the king who rules justly, as befits a king, even monsoons and harvests will happen unfailingly.

kural.pope_couplet: Not lance gives kings the victory,But sceptre swayed with equity
kural.pope_exp: It is not the javelin that gives victory, but the king's sceptre, if it do no injustice
kural.kannan_exp: It is not the spear that gives victory; it is the king’s sceptre, the one that never tilts unjustly.

kural.pope_couplet: The king all the whole realm of earth protects;And justice guards the king who right respects
kural.pope_exp: The king defends the whole world; and justice, when administered without defect, defends the king
kural.kannan_exp: A king protects all the world; he is protected by the justice that he dispenses resolutely.

kural.pope_couplet: Hard of access, nought searching out, with partial handThe king who rules, shall sink and perish from the land
kural.pope_exp: The king who gives not facile audience (to those who approach him), and who does not examine and pass judgment (on their complaints), will perish in disgrace
kural.kannan_exp: A king who isn’t readily accessible and doesn’t rule justly, will be ruined by his own lowly deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: Abroad to guard, at home to punish, bringsNo just reproach; 'tis work assigned to kings
kural.pope_exp: In guarding his subjects (against injury from others), and in preserving them himself; to punish crime
kural.kannan_exp: To punish a crime, in order to protect and nurture one’s subjects, is not a blot on the king but his duty.

kural.pope_couplet: By punishment of death the cruel to restrain,Is as when farmer frees from weeds the tender grain
kural.pope_exp: For a king to punish criminals with death, is like pulling up the weeds in the green corn
kural.kannan_exp: The king punishing, severely, those brutal murderers, is akin to clearing weeds from the crop.

kural.pope_couplet: Than one who plies the murderer's trade, more cruel is the kingWho all injustice works, his subjects harassing
kural.pope_exp: The king who gives himself up to oppression and acts unjustly (towards his subjects) is more cruel than the man who leads the life of a murderer
kural.kannan_exp: He is worse than assassins, the ruler who harries his citizens, and indulges in unjust acts.

kural.pope_couplet: As 'Give' the robber cries with lance uplift,So kings with sceptred hand implore a gift
kural.pope_exp: The request (for money) of him who holds the sceptre is like the word of a highway robber who stands with a weapon in hand and says "give up your wealth"
kural.kannan_exp: The extortion and graft done wielding the sceptre is no different from robbery done pointing a spear.

kural.pope_couplet: Who makes no daily search for wrongs, nor justly rules, that kingDoth day by day his realm to ruin bring
kural.pope_exp: The country of the king who does not daily examine into the wrongs done and distribute justice, will daily fall to ruin
kural.kannan_exp: The ruler who doesn’t assess and administer justly, day after day, will let his state rot day by day.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose rod from right deflects, who counsel doth refuse,At once his wealth and people utterly shall lose
kural.pope_exp: The king, who, without reflecting (on its evil consequences), perverts justice, will lose at once both his wealth and his subjects
kural.kannan_exp: The king who lets his sceptre tilt towards tyranny will lose all his wealth, people and state.

kural.pope_couplet: His people's tears of sorrow past endurance, are not theySharp instruments to wear the monarch's wealth away
kural.pope_exp: Will not the tears, shed by a people who cannot endure the oppression which they suffer (from their king), become a saw to waste away his wealth ?
kural.kannan_exp: The tears shed by citizens subjected to intolerable grief are the weapons that erode the rulers’ wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: To rulers' rule stability is sceptre right;When this is not, quenched is the rulers' light
kural.pope_exp: Righteous government gives permanence to (the fame of) kings; without that their fame will have no endurance
kural.kannan_exp: Just rule yields lasting fame to a ruler; no justice, no fame.

kural.pope_couplet: As lack of rain to thirsty lands beneath,Is lack of grace in kings to all that breathe
kural.pope_exp: As is the world without rain, so live a people whose king is without kindness
kural.kannan_exp: Just as lack of rain is to the world, so is to mankind – rulers’ lack of benevolence.

kural.pope_couplet: To poverty it adds a sharper sting,To live beneath the sway of unjust king
kural.pope_exp: Property gives more sorrow than poverty, to those who live under the sceptre of a king without justice
kural.kannan_exp: Being wealthy is worse than being poor, under an unjust ruler.

kural.pope_couplet: Where king from right deflecting, makes unrighteous gain,The seasons change, the clouds pour down no rain
kural.pope_exp: If the king acts contrary to justice, rain will become unseasonable, and the heavens will withhold their showers
kural.kannan_exp: If the king lets his sceptre of justice waver, the skies won’t yield and monsoons will fail.

kural.pope_couplet: Where guardian guardeth not, udder of kine grows dry,And Brahmans' sacred lore will all forgotten lie
kural.pope_exp: If the guardian (of the country) neglects to guard it, the produce of the cows will fail, and the men of six duties viz, the Brahmins will forget the vedas
kural.kannan_exp: The cows’ milk will dry up; the brahmans will forget the scriptures; when the king stops being their saviour.

kural.pope_couplet: Who punishes, investigation made in due degree,So as to stay advance of crime, a king is he
kural.pope_exp: He is a king who having equitably examined (any injustice which has been brought to his notice), suitably punishes it, so that it may not be again committed
kural.kannan_exp: Investigating neutrally, and punishing appropriately, so as to deter the repeat of a crime, is the duty of the king.

kural.pope_couplet: For length of days with still increasing joys on Heav'n who call,Should raise the rod with brow severe, but let it gently fall
kural.pope_exp: Let the king, who desires that his prosperity may long remain, commence his preliminary enquires with strictness, and then punish with mildness
kural.kannan_exp: Raise the sceptre swift and stern, but land it softly, those who wish never to lose what they possess.

kural.pope_couplet: Where subjects dread of cruel wrongs endure,Ruin to unjust king is swift and sure
kural.pope_exp: The cruel-sceptred king, who acts so as to put his subjects in fear, will certainly and quickly come to ruin
kural.kannan_exp: A king will be isolated and will face rapid ruin, if he becomes a tyrant indulging in terrifying deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Ah! cruel is our king', where subjects sadly say,His age shall dwindle, swift his joy of life decay
kural.pope_exp: The king who is spoken of as cruel will quickly perish; his life becoming shortened
kural.kannan_exp: “My king – he is a tyrant” : such a denouncement is certain to hasten a king’s downfall.

kural.pope_couplet: Whom subjects scarce may see, of harsh forbidding countenance;His ample wealth shall waste, blasted by demon's glance
kural.pope_exp: The great wealth of him who is difficult of access and possesses a sternness of countenance, is like that which has been obtained by a devil
kural.kannan_exp: Inaccessible and has a harsh countenance – his huge wealth resembles a treasure protected by demons.

kural.pope_couplet: The tyrant, harsh in speach and hard of eye,His ample joy, swift fading, soon shall die
kural.pope_exp: The abundant wealth of the king whose words are harsh and whose looks are void of kindness, will instantly perish instead of abiding long, with him
kural.kannan_exp: If he is of harsh words, and has no compassion, his extensive wealth will become extinct soon.

kural.pope_couplet: Harsh words and punishments severe beyond the right,Are file that wears away the monarch's conquering might
kural.pope_exp: Severe words and excessive punishments will be a file to waste away a king's power for destroying (his enemies)
kural.kannan_exp: Harsh words and excessive punishments form the saw that files away the king’s military might.

kural.pope_couplet: Who leaves the work to those around, and thinks of it no more;If he in wrathful mood reprove, his prosperous days are o'er
kural.pope_exp: The prosperity of that king will waste away, who without reflecting (on his affairs himself), commits them to his ministers, and (when a failure occurs) gives way to anger, and rages against them
kural.kannan_exp: When the king doesn’t take counsel of his advisers, and tends to explode with rage, his wealth starts imploding.

kural.pope_couplet: Who builds no fort whence he may foe defy,In time of war shall fear and swiftly die
kural.pope_exp: The king who has not provided himself with a place of defence, will in times of war be seized with fear and quickly perish
kural.kannan_exp: When the foes strike, a king who has not built his defences, will fall swiftly, trembling with fear.

kural.pope_couplet: Tyrants with fools their counsels share:Earth can no heavier burthen bear
kural.pope_exp: The earth bears up no greater burden than ignorant men whom a cruel sceptre attaches to itself (as the ministers of its evil deeds)
kural.kannan_exp: A tyrant will assemble an ensemble of the unlearned; but for them, there is no burden for the earth.

kural.pope_couplet: Since true benignity, that grace exceeding great, residesIn kingly souls, world in happy state abides
kural.pope_exp: The world exists through that greatest ornament (of princes), a gracious demeanour
kural.kannan_exp: There exists this stupendous beauty called compassion; and therefore, the world exists.

kural.pope_couplet: The world goes on its wonted way, since grace benign is there;All other men are burthen for the earth to bear
kural.pope_exp: The prosperity of the world springs from the kindliness, the existence of those who have no (kindliness) is a burden to the earth
kural.kannan_exp: It is compassion that keeps the world functioning as it should; there are those who lack it, and they burden the earth.

kural.pope_couplet: Where not accordant with the song, what use of sounding chordsWhat gain of eye that no benignant light affords
kural.pope_exp: Of what avail is a song if it be inconsistent with harmony ? what is the use of eyes which possess no kindliness
kural.kannan_exp: Of what use is a tune that can’t suit any song? of what use are eyes, which have no compassion?

kural.pope_couplet: The seeming eye of face gives no expressive light,When not with duly meted kindness bright
kural.pope_exp: Beyond appearing to be in the face, what good do they do, those eyes in which is no well-regulated kindness ?
kural.kannan_exp: An eye that is not abound with compassion, what purpose is it serving on the face, feigning existence?

kural.pope_couplet: Benignity is eyes' adorning grace;Without it eyes are wounds disfiguring face
kural.pope_exp: Kind looks are the ornaments of the eyes; without these they will be considered (by the wise) to be merely two sores
kural.kannan_exp: Eyes are adorned by compassion; but for it, they would be considered wounds.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose eyes 'neath brow infixed diffuse no rayOf grace; like tree in earth infixed are they
kural.pope_exp: They resemble the trees of the earth, who although they have eyes, never look kindly (on others)
kural.kannan_exp: Trees rooted to the land they resemble, those though born with eyes, don’t use them to be compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: Eyeless are they whose eyes with no benignant lustre shine;Who've eyes can never lack the light of grace benign
kural.pope_exp: Men without kind looks are men without eyes; those who (really) have eyes are also not devoid of kind looks
kural.kannan_exp: Those who lack compassion have no eyes; who truly have eyes can’t lack compassion.

kural.pope_couplet: Who can benignant smile, yet leave no work undone;By them as very own may all the earth be won
kural.pope_exp: The world is theirs (kings) who are able to show kindness, without injury to their affairs, (administration of justice)
kural.kannan_exp: The world belongs to those who do their duty unfalteringly, while being compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: To smile on those that vex, with kindly face,Enduring long, is most excelling grace
kural.pope_exp: Patiently to bear with, and show kindness to those who grieve us, is the most excellent of all dispositions
kural.kannan_exp: Being compassionate and patient, even with those who hurt us, is a quality, most admirable.

kural.pope_couplet: They drink with smiling grace, though poison interfused they see,Who seek the praise of all-esteemed courtesy
kural.pope_exp: Those who desire (to cultivate that degree of) urbanity which all shall love, even after swallowing the poison served to them by their friends, will be friendly with them
kural.kannan_exp: Even after seeing poison being poured, they will consume it and converse cordially, they who seek to be captivatingly civilized and compassionate.

kural.pope_couplet: These two: the code renowned and spies,In these let king confide as eyes
kural.pope_exp: Let a king consider as his eyes these two things, a spy and a book (of laws) universally esteemed
kural.kannan_exp: Intelligence operations and highly regarded books – a king should consider them his eyes.

kural.pope_couplet: Each day, of every subject every deed,'Tis duty of the king to learn with speed
kural.pope_exp: 'Tis duty of the king to learn with speed
kural.kannan_exp: Knowing everything that happens to everyone – to always gain such intelligence at great speed is the duty of a king.

kural.pope_couplet: By spies who spies, not weighing things they bring,Nothing can victory give to that unwary king
kural.pope_exp: There is no way for a king to obtain conquests, who knows not the advantage of discoveries made by a spy
kural.kannan_exp: There is no better way to victory for a king than deploying spies on surveillance and gathering credible intelligence.

kural.pope_couplet: His officers, his friends, his enemies,All these who watch are trusty spies
kural.pope_exp: He is a spy who watches all men, to wit, those who are in the king's employment, his relatives, and his enemies
kural.kannan_exp: Having everyone – officials, kin and foes, under surveillance is the job of a spy.

kural.pope_couplet: Of unsuspected mien and all-unfearing eyes,Who let no secret out, are trusty spies
kural.pope_exp: A spy is one who is able to assume an appearance which may create no suspicion (in the minds of others), who fears no man's face, and who never reveals (his purpose)
kural.kannan_exp: A spy should be capable of inconspicuous appearance, fearlessly looking into others’ eyes and never disclosing critical facts.

kural.pope_couplet: As monk or devotee, through every hindrance making way,A spy, whate'er men do, must watchful mind display
kural.pope_exp: He is a spy who, assuming the appearance of an ascetic, goes into (whatever place he wishes), examines into (all, that is needful), and never discovers himself, whatever may be done to him
kural.kannan_exp: A spy should be able to go incognito, as an ascetic and others, infiltrate all places, and tirelessly gather intelligence by any means.

kural.pope_couplet: A spy must search each hidden matter out,And full report must render, free from doubt
kural.pope_exp: A spy is one who is able to discover what is hidden and who retains no doubt concerning what he has known
kural.kannan_exp: A spy should be capable of extracting top secrets nonchalantly, and verifying their veracity beyond doubt.

kural.pope_couplet: Spying by spies, the things they tellTo test by other spies is well
kural.pope_exp: Let not a king receive the information which a spy has discovered and made known to him, until he has examined it by another spy
kural.kannan_exp: Ascertain even the intelligence gathered by a spy by deploying another spy.

kural.pope_couplet: One spy must not another see: contrive it so;And things by three confirmed as truth you know
kural.pope_exp: Let a king employ spies so that one may have no knowledge of the other; and when the information of three agrees together, let him receive it
kural.kannan_exp: Lead the sleuths such that they don’t know each other; when three of them concur on an input, you know it is reliable.

kural.pope_couplet: Reward not trusty spy in others' sight,Or all the mystery will come to light
kural.pope_exp: Let not a king publicly confer on a spy any marks of his favour; if he does, he will divulge his own secret
kural.kannan_exp: When you honour a spy, do it not in public; else, you would broadcast your own secret.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis energy gives men o'er that they own a true control;They nothing own who own not energy of soul
kural.pope_exp: Energy makes out the man of property; as for those who are destitute of it, do they (really) possess what they possess ?
kural.kannan_exp: The haves are haves if they have zeal; if they have it not, they are have-nots, whatever else they may have.

kural.pope_couplet: The wealth of mind man owns a real worth imparts,Material wealth man owns endures not, utterly departs
kural.pope_exp: The possession of (energy of) mind is true property; the possession of wealth passes away and abides not
kural.kannan_exp: Possessing passion is the true possession; all other wealth is transient and will vanish.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Lost is our wealth,' they utter not this cry distressed,The men of firm concentred energy of soul possessed
kural.pope_exp: They who are possessed of enduring energy will not trouble themselves, saying, "we have lost our property."
kural.kannan_exp: They will not bemoan the loss of wealth, they who have enduring zeal.

kural.pope_couplet: The man of energy of soul inflexible,Good fortune seeks him out and comes a friend to dwell
kural.pope_exp: Wealth will find its own way to the man of unfailing energy
kural.kannan_exp: Wealth, on its own, will find the way to reach those with unflagging fervor.

kural.pope_couplet: With rising flood the rising lotus flower its stem unwinds;The dignity of men is measured by their minds
kural.pope_exp: The stalks of water-flowers are proportionate to the depth of water; so is men's greatness proportionate to their minds
kural.kannan_exp: The depth of water determines how tall an aquatic plant grows; zeal in the heart dictates how far man goes.

kural.pope_couplet: Whate'er you ponder, let your aim be loftly still,Fate cannot hinder always, thwart you as it will
kural.pope_exp: In all that a king thinks of, let him think of his greatness; and if it should be thrust from him (by fate), it will have the nature of not being thrust from him
kural.kannan_exp: Fervently aspire for the best; even if you fail, it is still as good as succeeding.

kural.pope_couplet: The men of lofty mind quail not in ruin's fateful hour,The elephant retains his dignity mind arrows' deadly shower
kural.pope_exp: The strong minded will not faint, even when all is lost; the elephant stands firm, even when wounded by a shower of arrows
kural.kannan_exp: The zealous won’t flinch in the face of trouble; the elephant, even if buried under a barrage of arrows, never relents.

kural.pope_couplet: The soulless man can never gainTh' ennobling sense of power with men
kural.pope_exp: Those who have no (greatness of) mind, will not acquire the joy of saying in the world, "we have excercised liaberality"
kural.kannan_exp: Those without zeal, will never attain the pride of being hailed as generous.

kural.pope_couplet: Huge bulk of elephant with pointed tusk all armed,When tiger threatens shrinks away alarmed
kural.pope_exp: Although the elephant has a large body, and a sharp tusk, yet it fears the attack of the tiger
kural.kannan_exp: It is huge; it has sharp tusks; yet, the tusker is frightened when the tiger attacks.

kural.pope_couplet: Firmness of soul in man is real excellance;Others are trees, their human form a mere pretence
kural.pope_exp: Energy is mental wealth; those men who are destitute of it are only trees in the form of men
kural.kannan_exp: Abundant zeal is one’s strength and wisdom; those without it are trees, their human form being the only difference.

kural.pope_couplet: Of household dignity the lustre beaming bright,Flickers and dies when sluggish foulness dims its light
kural.pope_exp: By the darkness, of idleness, the indestructible lamp of family (rank) will be extinguished
kural.kannan_exp: The inextinguishable flame of distinguished ancestry will be put out, if the filth of sloth starts blocking it.

kural.pope_couplet: Let indolence, the death of effort, die,If you'd uphold your household's dignity
kural.pope_exp: Let those, who desire that their family may be illustrious, put away all idleness from their conduct
kural.kannan_exp: Only laziness can harm as much as laziness; treat it as such if you wish your family to remain a family. Kill laziness, if you wish your clan to become a reputed clan.

kural.pope_couplet: Who fosters indolence within his breast, the silly elf!The house from which he springs shall perish ere himself
kural.pope_exp: The (lustre of the) family of the ignorant man, who acts under the influence of destructive laziness will perish, even before he is dead
kural.kannan_exp: The imbecile who lives clutching the fatal indolence, will see his family’s demise before his own.

kural.pope_couplet: His family decays, and faults unheeded thrive,Who, sunk in sloth, for noble objects doth not strive
kural.pope_exp: Family (greatness) will be destroyed, and faults will increase, in those men who give way to laziness, and put forth no dignified exertions
kural.kannan_exp: A ruler who falls into the lap of laziness and doesn’t strive hard, will witness the destruction of his subjects and an upsurge in crime.

kural.pope_couplet: Delay, oblivion, sloth, and sleep: these fourAre pleasure-boat to bear the doomed to ruin's shore
kural.pope_exp: Procrastination, forgetfulness, idleness, and sleep, these four things, form the vessel which is desired by those destined to destruction
kural.kannan_exp: Procrastination, neglect, sloth and slumber : these four are the ship that is boarded lovingly by habitual losers.

kural.pope_couplet: Though lords of earth unearned possessions gain,The slothful ones no yield of good obtain
kural.pope_exp: It is a rare thing for the idle, even when possessed of the riches of kings who ruled over the whole earth, to derive any great benefit from it
kural.kannan_exp: It is unlikely that the lazy will prosper, even if they inherit the riches of an emperor.

kural.pope_couplet: Who hug their sloth, nor noble works attempt,Shall bear reproofs and words of just contempt
kural.pope_exp: Those who through idleness, and do not engage themselves in dignified exertion, will subject
kural.kannan_exp: Well-meaning rebukes will be followed by ridicule, if one is indolent and refrains from striving hard.

kural.pope_couplet: If sloth a dwelling find mid noble family,Bondsmen to them that hate them shall they be
kural.pope_exp: If idleness take up its abode in a king of high birth, it will make him a slave of his enemies
kural.kannan_exp: If laziness rests on a state and its rulers, it will be enslaved by its foes.

kural.pope_couplet: Who changes slothful habits savesHimself from all that household rule depraves
kural.pope_exp: When a man puts away idleness, the reproach which has come upon himself and his family will disappear
kural.kannan_exp: The ills that befell his state and leadership, will vanish if one gives up his indolence.

kural.pope_couplet: The king whose life from sluggishness is rid,Shall rule o'er all by foot of mighty god bestrid
kural.pope_exp: The king who never gives way to idleness will obtain entire possession of (the whole earth) passed over by him who measured (the worlds) with His foot
kural.kannan_exp: The ruler who has no sloth will attain all that was attained by the one who measured the world with his feet.

kural.pope_couplet: Say not, 'Tis hard', in weak, desponding hour,For strenuous effort gives prevailing power
kural.pope_exp: Yield not to the feebleness which says, "this is too difficult to be done"; labour will give the greatness (of mind) which is necessary (to do it)
kural.kannan_exp: Shun not a task because it is tough; perseverance brings respect.

kural.pope_couplet: In action be thou, 'ware of act's defeat;The world leaves those who work leave incomplete
kural.pope_exp: Take care not to give up exertion in the midst of a work; the world will abandon those who abandon their unfinished work
kural.kannan_exp: The world deserts those who desert an essential task; while executing, don’t wilt and let the task fail.

kural.pope_couplet: In strenuous effort doth resideThe power of helping others: noble pride
kural.pope_exp: The lustre of munificence will dwell only with the dignity of laboriousness or efforts
kural.kannan_exp: The greatness of benevolence rests on those who have the quality of perseverance.

kural.pope_couplet: Beneficent intent in men by whom no strenuous work is wrought,Like battle-axe in sexless being's hand availeth nought
kural.pope_exp: The liberality of him, who does not labour, will fail, like the manliness of a hermaphrodite, who has a sword in its hand
kural.kannan_exp: Benevolence of the person without persistence, will turn futile like a sword in the hands of a coward.

kural.pope_couplet: Whose heart delighteth not in pleasure, but in action finds delight,He wipes away his kinsmen's grief and stands the pillar of their might
kural.pope_exp: He who desires not pleasure, but desires labour, will be a pillar to sustain his relations, wiping away their sorrows
kural.kannan_exp: Forsaking gratification, he who perseveres, is a pillar for one’s kin – wiping and bearing their woes.

kural.pope_couplet: Effort brings fortune's sure increase,Its absence brings to nothingness
kural.pope_exp: Labour will produce wealth; idleness will bring poverty
kural.kannan_exp: Effort creates wealth; lack of it induces poverty.

kural.pope_couplet: In sluggishness is seen misfortune's lurid form, the wise declare;Where man unslothful toils, she of the lotus flower is there
kural.pope_exp: They say that the black Mudevi (the goddess of adversity) dwells with laziness, and the Latchmi (the goddess of prosperity) dwells with the labour of the industrious
kural.kannan_exp: Thus they speak : the angel of poverty resides with the sluggard; the lotus-residing angel of wealth rests on the efforts of the unsluggish.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis no reproach unpropitious fate should ban;But not to do man's work is foul disgrace to man
kural.pope_exp: Adverse fate is no disgrace to any one; to be without exertion and without knowing what should be known, is disgrace
kural.kannan_exp: Lack of good fortune brings not disgrace; not gaining requisite knowledge, and not persisting, is disgraceful.

kural.pope_couplet: Though fate-divine should make your labour vain;Effort its labour's sure reward will gain
kural.pope_exp: Although it be said that, through fate, it cannot be attained, yet labour, with bodily exertion, will yield its reward
kural.kannan_exp: Even if god has given up, perseverance will pay the wages for one’s efforts. Even if ool or god doesn’t aid, perseverance will pay the wages for one’s efforts. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Who strive with undismayed, unfaltering mind,At length shall leave opposing fate behind
kural.pope_exp: They who labour on, without fear and without fainting will see even fate (put) behind their back
kural.kannan_exp: They will defeat and see the back of ool (fate) – they who persevere resolutely without respite. They will triumph over ool (fate) – they who persevere resolutely without respite. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Smile, with patient, hopeful heart, in troublous hour;Meet and so vanquish grief; nothing hath equal power
kural.pope_exp: If troubles come, laugh; there is nothing like that, to press upon and drive away sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Smile in times of trouble; it is without equal, in repeatedly trouncing trouble.

kural.pope_couplet: Though sorrow, like a flood, comes rolling on,When wise men's mind regards it,- it is gone
kural.pope_exp: A flood of troubles will be overcome by the (courageous) thought which the minds of the wise will entertain, even in sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Floods of tribulation will be wiped away, when the wise set their minds on overcoming it.

kural.pope_couplet: Who griefs confront with meek, ungrieving heart,From them griefs, put to grief, depart
kural.pope_exp: They give sorrow to sorrow, who in sorrow do not suffer sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: They will torment the torment, those who don’t get tormented by torment.

kural.pope_couplet: Like bullock struggle on through each obstructed way;From such an one will troubles, troubled, roll away
kural.pope_exp: Troubles will vanish (i.e., will be troubled) before the man who (struggles against difficulties) as a
kural.kannan_exp: Whenever stuck in a mire, if one chugs along like a bull, trouble will be distressed.

kural.pope_couplet: When griefs press on, but fail to crush the patient heart,Then griefs defeated, put to grief, depart
kural.pope_exp: The troubles of that man will be troubled (and disappear) who, however thickly they may come upon him, does not abandon (his purpose)
kural.kannan_exp: Even under an onslaught of adversities, if one is unfazed, his torments will be tormented.

kural.pope_couplet: Who boasted not of wealth, nor gave it all their heart,Will not bemoan the loss, when prosperous days depart
kural.pope_exp: Will those men ever cry out in sorrow, "we are destitute" who, (in their prosperity), give not way to (undue desire) to keep their wealth
kural.kannan_exp: Will they be distressed by poverty – those who, in times of wealth, don’t stingily cling to their wealth?

kural.pope_couplet: 'Man's frame is sorrow's target', the noble mind reflects,Nor meets with troubled mind the sorrows it expects
kural.pope_exp: The great will not regard trouble as trouble, knowing that the body is the butt of trouble
kural.kannan_exp: Knowing that the human body is ever a target for afflictions, the wise will not be distressed by distress.

kural.pope_couplet: He seeks not joy, to sorrow man is born, he knows;Such man will walk unharmed by touch of human woes
kural.pope_exp: That man never experiences sorrow, who does not seek for pleasure, and who considers distress to be natural (to man)
kural.kannan_exp: He who yearns not for pleasures, dismisses adversities as inevitable, will never be distressed.

kural.pope_couplet: Mid joys he yields not heart to joys' controlMid sorrows, sorrow cannot touch his soul
kural.pope_exp: He does not suffer sorrow, in sorrow who does not look for pleasure in pleasure
kural.kannan_exp: He who yearns not for pleasure in joyous times, will not be distressed in times of sorrow.

kural.pope_couplet: Who pain as pleasure takes, he shall acquireThe bliss to which his foes in vain aspire
kural.pope_exp: The elevation, which even his enemies will esteem, will be gained by him, who regards pain as pleasure
kural.kannan_exp: If one accepts adversities as pleasures, his adversaries too will acclaim him.

kural.pope_couplet: A minister is he who grasps, with wisdom large,Means, time, work's mode, and functions rare he must discharge
kural.pope_exp: The minister is one who can make an excellent choice of means, time, manner of execution, and the difficult undertaking (itself)
kural.kannan_exp: A minister is one who can envisage rare deeds, the resources and time entailed, and the means to execute.

kural.pope_couplet: A minister must greatness own of guardian power, determined mind,Learn'd wisdom, manly effort with the former five combined
kural.pope_exp: The minister is one who in addition to the aforesaid five things excels in the possession of firmness,
kural.kannan_exp: Resolve, protecting the citizens, learning and perseverance – a minister is one who is capable in these too.

kural.pope_couplet: A minister is he whose power can foes divide,Attach more firmly friends, of severed ones can heal the breaches wide
kural.pope_exp: The minister is one who can effect discord (among foes), maintain the good-will of his friends and restore to friendship those who have seceded (from him)
kural.kannan_exp: A minister is adept at these : splitting the foes, binding the allies, and uniting the estranged.

kural.pope_couplet: A minister has power to see the methods help afford,To ponder long, then utter calm conclusive word
kural.pope_exp: The minister is one who is able to comprehend (the whole nature of an undertaking), execute it in the best manner possible, and offer assuring advice (in time of necessity)
kural.kannan_exp: A minister should be proficient in assessing, executing and articulating unequivocally.

kural.pope_couplet: The man who virtue knows, has use of wise and pleasant wordsWith plans for every season apt, in counsel aid affords
kural.pope_exp: He is the best helper (of the king) who understanding the duties, of the latter, is by his special learning, able to tender the fullest advice, and at all times conversant with the best method (of
kural.kannan_exp: He knows righteousness; he can enunciate eruditely; he is always adroit at execution : he is an apt counsellor.

kural.pope_couplet: When native subtilty combines with sound scholastic lore,'Tis subtilty surpassing all, which nothing stands before
kural.pope_exp: What (contrivances) are there so acute as to resist those who possess natural acuteness in addition to learning ?
kural.kannan_exp: For one who has an impressive intellect, and is well-read, is there any task that can be extremely challenging?

kural.pope_couplet: Though knowing all that books can teach, 'tis truest tactTo follow common sense of men in act
kural.pope_exp: Though you are acquainted with the (theoretical) methods (of performing an act), understand the ways of the world and act accordingly
kural.kannan_exp: Even if you know well how to do a task, do it knowing the nature of your world.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis duty of the man in place aloud to sayThe very truth, though unwise king may cast his words away
kural.pope_exp: Although the king be utterly ignorant, it is the duty of the minister to give (him) sound advice
kural.kannan_exp: Even when the king stubs out the wise counsel, and knows not by himself, it is the duty of the minister to advise firmly. V1 The king ought to listen to good counsel; even if he doesn’t know or listen, it is the duty of the minister to advise firmly. V2

kural.pope_couplet: A minister who by king's side plots evil thingsWorse woes than countless foemen brings
kural.pope_exp: Far better are seventy crores of enemies (for a king) than a minister at his side who intends (his) ruin
kural.kannan_exp: It is better to face 700 million foes than have a scheming minister.

kural.pope_couplet: For gain of end desired just counsel nought availsTo minister, when tact in execution fails
kural.pope_exp: Those ministers who are destitute of (executive) ability will fail to carry out their projects, although they may have contrived aright
kural.kannan_exp: They plan meticulously but yet can’t take it to completion, those who are poor at execution.

kural.pope_couplet: A tongue that rightly speaks the right is greatest gain,It stands alone midst goodly things that men obtain
kural.pope_exp: The possession of that goodness which is called the goodness of speech is (even to others) better than any other goodness
kural.kannan_exp: The benefits of a gifted tongue, outclass the benefits of anything else.
