kural.pope_couplet: Since gain and loss in life on speech depend,From careless slip in speech thyself defend
kural.pope_exp: Since (both) wealth and evil result from (their) speech, ministers should most carefully guard themselves against faultiness therein
kural.kannan_exp: It creates and destructs; hence ensure there is never a blemish in your speech.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis speech that spell-bound holds the listening ear,While those who have not heard desire to hear
kural.pope_exp: The (minister's) speech is that which seeks (to express) elements as bind his friends (to himself) and is so delivered as to make even his enemies desire (his friendship)
kural.kannan_exp: Speak with such quality that it binds those who lend their ears, and casts a spell on even those who don’t. Speak such that the quality binds those who hear, and makes those who don’t hear yearn to hear. V2 Speak with such quality that it binds those who queried, and casts a spell on even those who didn’t. V3 Speak with such quality that it binds the erudite, and casts a spell on even the ignorant. V4 Speak with such quality that it binds the friends who listen, and casts a spell on even the foes who don’t. V5

kural.pope_couplet: Speak words adapted well to various hearers' state;No higher virtue lives, no gain more surely great
kural.pope_exp: Understand the qualities (of your hearers) and (then) make your speech; for superior to it, there is neither virtue nor wealth
kural.kannan_exp: Speak words that befit the capabilities; there is no greater virtue and wealth than that. Speak words that befit your capabilities and those of the listener; there is no greater virtue and wealth than that. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Speak out your speech, when once 'tis past disputeThat none can utter speech that shall your speech refute
kural.pope_exp: Deliver your speech, after assuring yourself that no counter speech can defeat your own
kural.kannan_exp: Say a word such that no other word can surpass that word.

kural.pope_couplet: Charming each hearer's ear, of others' words to seize the sense,Is method wise of men of spotless excellence
kural.pope_exp: It is the opinion of those who are free from defects in diplomacy that the minister should speak so as to make his hearers desire (to hear more) and grasp the meaning of what he hears himself
kural.kannan_exp: Speaking alluring words, and seeking to learn when others speak, is the way of those with impeccable qualities.

kural.pope_couplet: Mighty in word, of unforgetful mind, of fearless speech,'Tis hard for hostile power such man to overreach
kural.pope_exp: It is impossible for any one to conquer him by intrique who possesses power of speech, and is neither faulty nor timid
kural.kannan_exp: If he is capable with words, tireless,and fearless; it is impossible to confront and defeat him. If he speaks capably, flawlessly, and fearlessly, it is impossible to confront and defeat him. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Swiftly the listening world will gather round,When men of mighty speech the weighty theme propound
kural.pope_exp: If there be those who can speak on various subjects in their proper order and in a pleasing manner, the world would readily accept them
kural.kannan_exp: The world will instantly pay heed to those who can speak coherently and pleasingly.

kural.pope_couplet: Who have not skill ten faultless words to utter plain,Their tongues will itch with thousand words man's ears to pain
kural.pope_exp: They will desire to utter many words, who do not know how to speak a few faultless ones
kural.kannan_exp: Those who know not how to converse clearly and flawlessly in a few words, love to speak profusely.

kural.pope_couplet: Like scentless flower in blooming garland boundAre men who can't their lore acquired to other's ears expound
kural.pope_exp: Those who are unable to set forth their acquirements (before others) are like flowers blossoming in a cluster and yet without fragrance
kural.kannan_exp: Those who cannot convey, and make others comprehend, what they have learnt, are like a bunch of bloomed flowers that have no fragrance.

kural.pope_couplet: The good external help confers is worldly gain;By action good men every needed gift obtain
kural.pope_exp: The efficacy of support will yield (only) wealth; (but) the efficacy of action will yield all that is desired
kural.kannan_exp: Good companions lead to valuable gains, and good deeds lead to everything needed.

kural.pope_couplet: From action evermore thyself restrainOf glory and of good that yields no gain
kural.pope_exp: Ministers should at all times avoid acts which, in addition to fame, yield no benefit (for the future)
kural.kannan_exp: They should be desisted from forever: deeds not leading to the good and yielding fame.

kural.pope_couplet: Who tell themselves that nobler things shall yet be wonAll deeds that dim the light of glory must they shun
kural.pope_exp: Those who say, "we will become (better)" should avoid the performance of acts that would destroy (their fame)
kural.kannan_exp: They who seek greater heights should shun deeds that dent their reputation.

kural.pope_couplet: Though troubles press, no shameful deed they do,Whose eyes the ever-during vision view
kural.pope_exp: Those who have infallible judgement though threatened with peril will not do acts which have brought disgrace (on former ministers)
kural.kannan_exp: Even in distress, they won’t do deplorable deeds, those with unfaltering clarity and vision.

kural.pope_couplet: Do nought that soul repenting must deplore,If thou hast sinned, 'tis well if thou dost sin no more
kural.pope_exp: Let a minister never do acts of which he would have to grieve saying, "what is this I have done"; (but) should he do (them), it were good that he grieved not
kural.kannan_exp: ‘What have I done?’ – do not do deeds leading to such regret; even if you do, do not ever repeat them. ‘What have I done’ – do not do deeds leading to such regret; having regretted thus, do not ever repeat such deeds. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Though her that bore thee hung'ring thou behold, no deedDo thou, that men of perfect soul have crime decreed
kural.pope_exp: Though a minister may see his mother starve; let him do not act which the wise would (treat with contempt)
kural.kannan_exp: Even when you see your mother starving, don’t do deeds deplored by those, noble and respected.

kural.pope_couplet: Than store of wealth guilt-laden souls obtain,The sorest poverty of perfect soul is richer gain
kural.pope_exp: Far more excellent is the extreme poverty of the wise than wealth obtained by heaping up of sinful
kural.kannan_exp: Far better than ill-gotten wealth is the extreme poverty fallen on the noble and exemplary.

kural.pope_couplet: To those who hate reproof and do forbidden thingWhat prospers now, in after days shall anguish bring
kural.pope_exp: The actions of those, who have not desisted from doing deeds forbidden (by the great), will, even if they succeed, cause them sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Though successful, they yield nothing but pain, when deplorable deeds are done rather than being shunned.

kural.pope_couplet: What's gained through tears with tears shall go;From loss good deeds entail harvests of blessings grow
kural.pope_exp: All that has been obtained with tears (to the victim) will depart with tears (to himself); but what has been by fair means; though with loss at first, will afterwards yield fruit
kural.kannan_exp: What is acquired with others’ tears, goes away with your tears; good deeds, even if begun with losses, will yield fruits later on.

kural.pope_couplet: In pot of clay unburnt he water pours and would retain,Who seeks by wrong the realm in wealth and safety to maintain
kural.pope_exp: (For a minister) to protect (his king) with wealth obtained by foul means is like preserving a vessel of wet clay by filling it with water
kural.kannan_exp: Being content with ill-gotten wealth, is like storing water in a fresh unbaked mud pot.

kural.pope_couplet: What men call 'power in action' know for 'power of mind'Externe to man all other aids you find
kural.pope_exp: Firmness in action is (simply) one's firmness of mind; all other (abilities) are not of this nature
kural.kannan_exp: Execution focus lies in the resolve of the mind; all else is secondary.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Each hindrance shun', 'unyielding onward press, If obstacle be there,'These two define your way, so those that search out truth declare
kural.pope_exp: Not to perform a ruinous act, and not to be discouraged by the ruinous termination of an act, are the two maxims which, the wise say, from the principles of those who have investigated the subject
kural.kannan_exp: Doing flawlessly, and resolute in the event of a flaw, are the paths shown by the learned.

kural.pope_couplet: Man's fitting work is known but by success achieved;In midst the plan revealed brings ruin ne'er to be retrieved
kural.pope_exp: So to perform an act as to publish it (only) at its termination is (true) manliness; for to announce it beforehand, will cause irremediable sorrow
kural.kannan_exp: Virility lies in taking a task to completion; giving up midway causes endless misery.

kural.pope_couplet: Easy to every man the speech that shows the way;Hard thing to shape one's life by words they say
kural.pope_exp: To say (how an act is to be performed) is (indeed) easy for any one; but far difficult it is to do according to what has been said
kural.kannan_exp: Easy it is, to say; rare it is, the ability to do what one says.

kural.pope_couplet: The power in act of men renowned and great,With king acceptance finds and fame through all the state
kural.pope_exp: The firmness in action of those who have become great by the excellence (of their counsel) will, by attaining its fulfilment in the person of the king, be esteemed (by all).
kural.kannan_exp: Those who have gained great acclaim for their execution resolve, bring good to their rulers, and are hence thought of highly.

kural.pope_couplet: Whate'er men think, ev'n as they think, may men obtain,If those who think can steadfastness of will retain
kural.pope_exp: If those who have planned (an undertaking) possess firmness (in executing it) they will obtain what they have desired even as they have desired it
kural.kannan_exp: What they seek, they will achieve as they seek, if those who seek are made of firm resolve.

kural.pope_couplet: Despise not men of modest bearing; Look not at form, but what men are:For some there live, high functions sharing, Like linch-pin of the mighty car
kural.pope_exp: Let none be despised for (their) size; (for) the world has those who resemble the linch-pin of the big rolling car
kural.kannan_exp: Deride not a person seeing their appearance; there are those who are like a small lynchpin that make a large chariot roll.

kural.pope_couplet: What clearly eye discerns as right, with steadfast will,And mind unslumbering, that should man fulfil
kural.pope_exp: An act that has been firmly resolved on must be as firmly carried out without delay
kural.kannan_exp: Do the task that you conceived with clarity of thought, unwaveringly and without procrastination.

kural.pope_couplet: Though toil and trouble face thee, firm resolve hold fast,And do the deeds that pleasure yield at last
kural.pope_exp: Though it should cause increasing sorrow (at the outset), do with firmness the act that yield bliss (in the end)
kural.kannan_exp: Even if it causes distress while doing, daringly do the task that brings joy.

kural.pope_couplet: The world desires not men of every power possessed,Who power in act desire not,- crown of all the rest
kural.pope_exp: The great will not esteem those who esteem not firmness of action, whatever other abilities the latter may possess
kural.kannan_exp: Whatever ability they may have acquired, the world desires them not, when they desire not the resoluteness to execute.

kural.pope_couplet: The Resolve is counsel's end, If resolutions halt In weak delays, still unfulfilled, 'tis grievous fault
kural.pope_exp: Consultation ends in forming a resolution (to act); (but) delay in the execution of that resolve is an evil
kural.kannan_exp: The end of strategizing is gaining the confidence to execute; it is wasteful to cede that confidence in delays.

kural.pope_couplet: Slumber when sleepy work's in hand beware Thou slumber not when action calls for sleepless care
kural.pope_exp: Sleep over such (actions) as may be slept over; (but) never over such as may not be slept over
kural.kannan_exp: Delay those tasks that better be delayed; delay not, those tasks that cannot be delayed.

kural.pope_couplet: When way is clear, prompt let your action be; When not, watch till some open path you see
kural.pope_exp: Whenever it is possible (to overcome your enemy) the act (of fighting) is certainly good; if not, endeavour to employ some more successful method
kural.kannan_exp: Act whenever possible; when not possible, do whatever is needed to make action possible. Execute as planned whenever possible; when not possible, do whatever is needed to resume action. V2

kural.pope_couplet: With work or foe, when you neglect some little thing, If you reflect, like smouldering fire, 'twill ruin bring
kural.pope_exp: When duly considered, the incomplete execution of an undertaking and hostility will grow and destroy one like the (unextinguished) remnant of a fire
kural.kannan_exp: The remnants of a task and an enmity, (left unfinished,) when we think of it, can harm as much as the remains of a fire.

kural.pope_couplet: Treasure and instrument and time and deed and place of act These five, till every doubt remove, think o'er with care exact
kural.pope_exp: Do an act after a due consideration of the (following) five, viz money, means, time, execution and place
kural.kannan_exp: Resources, tools, time, place and the task – analyze these beyond doubt, and then act.

kural.pope_couplet: Accomplishment, the hindrances, large profits won By effort these compare,- then let the work be done
kural.pope_exp: An act is to be performed after considering the exertion required, the obstacles to be encountered, and the great profit to be gained (on its completion)
kural.kannan_exp: The means to the end, the obstacles and the fruits of the deed – anticipate all these, and then act.

kural.pope_couplet: Who would succeed must thus begin first let him ask The thoughts of them who thoroughly know the task
kural.pope_exp: The method of performance for one who has begun an act is to ascertain the mind of him who knows the secret thereof
kural.kannan_exp: One who is excellent at execution, executes after grasping the subtleties of all tasks from the experts.

kural.pope_couplet: By one thing done you reach a second work's accomplishment; So furious elephant to snare its fellow brute is sent
kural.pope_exp: To make one undertaking the means of accomplishing another (similar to it) is like making one rutting elephant the means of capturing another
kural.kannan_exp: Using one task to accomplish another task, is like tethering a musth elephant using another.

kural.pope_couplet: Than kindly acts to friends more urgent thing to do, Is making foes to cling as friends attached to you
kural.pope_exp: One should rather hasten to secure the alliance of the foes (of one's foes) than perform good offices to one's friends
kural.kannan_exp: More pressing than doing favors to friends, is befriending foes.

kural.pope_couplet: The men of lesser realm, fearing the people's inward dread, Accepting granted terms, to mightier ruler bow the head
kural.pope_exp: Ministers of small states, afraid of their people being frightened, will yield to and acknowledge their superior foes, if the latter offer them a chance of reconciliation
kural.kannan_exp: The smaller state, fearing internal panic, will submit to a superior power, if their concerns are addressed.

kural.pope_couplet: Benevolence high birth, the courtesy kings love:-These qualities the envoy of a king approve
kural.pope_exp: The qualification of an ambassador are affection (for his relations) a fitting birth, and the possession of attributes pleasing to royalty
kural.kannan_exp: Love, birth in a suitable family, affable nature attractive to any king are qualities of an emissary.

kural.pope_couplet: Love, knowledge, power of chosen words, three things,Should he possess who speaks the words of kings
kural.pope_exp: Love (to his sovereign), knowledge (of his affairs), and a discriminating power of speech (before other sovereigns) are the three sine qua non qualifications of an ambassador
kural.kannan_exp: Love, wisdom and sagacious speech are three qualities essential for an envoy.

kural.pope_couplet: Mighty in lore amongst the learned must he be,Midst jav'lin-bearing kings who speaks the words of victory
kural.pope_exp: To be powerful in politics among those who are learned (in ethics) is the character of him who speaks
kural.kannan_exp: An emissary on a mission, seeking a diplomatic win over other rulers, should be erudite enough to excel amongst the erudite.

kural.pope_couplet: Sense, goodly grace, and knowledge exquisiteWho hath these three for envoy's task is fit
kural.pope_exp: He may go on a mission (to foreign rulers) who has combined in him all these three viz, (natural) sense, an attractive bearing and well-tried learning
kural.kannan_exp: Wisdom, physical presence and thorough learning – he who has these three in abundance, let him be the one to go on a diplomatic mission.

kural.pope_couplet: In terms concise, avoiding wrathful speech, who utters pleasant word,An envoy he who gains advantage for his lord
kural.pope_exp: He is an ambassador who (in the presence of foreign rulers) speaks briefly, avoids harshness, talks so as to make them smile, and thus brings good (to his own sovereign)
kural.kannan_exp: Being coherent, avoiding objectionable words, and evoking smiles are the ways of an envoy to get desired results.

kural.pope_couplet: An envoy meet is he, well-learned, of fearless eyeWho speaks right home, prepared for each emergency
kural.pope_exp: He is an ambassador who having studied (politics) talks impressively, is not afraid of angry looks, and knows (to employ) the art suited to the time
kural.kannan_exp: A good envoy is well learned, can look anyone in the eye, has compelling speech and comes up with timely strategies.

kural.pope_couplet: He is the best who knows what's due, the time considered well,The place selects, then ponders long ere he his errand tell
kural.pope_exp: He is chief (among ambassadors) who understands the proper decorum (before foreign princes), seeks the (proper) occasion, knows the (most suitable) place, and delivers his message after (due)
kural.kannan_exp: Foremost among envoys is one who knows the task, weighs the time and place, and speaks with sagacity.

kural.pope_couplet: Integrity, resources, soul determined, truthfulnessWho rightly speaks his message must these marks possess
kural.pope_exp: The qualifications of him who faithfully delivers his (sovereign's) message are purity, the support (of foreign ministers), and boldness, with truthfulness in addition to the (aforesaid) three
kural.kannan_exp: Principled, endearing and courageous – these three are qualities of an envoy conveying a message truthfully.

kural.pope_couplet: His faltering lips must utter no unworthy thing,Who stands, with steady eye, to speak the mandates of his king
kural.pope_exp: He alone is fit to communicate (his sovereign's) reply, who possesses the firmness not to utter even inadvertently what may reflect discredit (on the latter)
kural.kannan_exp: An emissary conveying his ruler’s message to another, should be firm enough never to denigrate him even by slip of tongue.

kural.pope_couplet: Death to the faithful one his embassy may bring;To envoy gains assured advantage for his king
kural.pope_exp: He is the ambassador who fearlessly seeks his sovereign's good though it should cost him his life (to deliver his message)
kural.kannan_exp: Even if it means meeting his own end, an emissary ought to further his leader’s ends.

kural.pope_couplet: Who warm them at the fire draw not too near, nor keep too much aloof;Thus let them act who dwell beneath of warlike kings the palace-roof
kural.pope_exp: Thus let them act who dwell beneath of warlike kings the palace-roof
kural.kannan_exp: Not too far, not too near – while being with an irritable ruler, resemble those warming before a fire.

kural.pope_couplet: To those who prize not state that kings are wont to prize,The king himself abundant wealth supplies
kural.pope_exp: For ministers not to cover the things desired by their kings will through the kings themselves yield them everlasting wealth
kural.kannan_exp: Desiring not the objects of desire for the king, gives lasting riches through the king.

kural.pope_couplet: Who would walk warily, let him of greater faults beware;To clear suspicions once aroused is an achievement rare
kural.pope_exp: Ministers who would save themselves should avoid (the commission of) serious errors for if the king's suspicion is once roused, no one can remove it
kural.kannan_exp: If you deem it imperative, maintain impeccable decorum; it maybe tough to placate anyone, once they turn bitter.

kural.pope_couplet: All whispered words and interchange of smiles repress,In presence of the men who kingly power possess
kural.pope_exp: While in the presence of the sovereign, ministers should neither whisper to nor smile at others
kural.kannan_exp: Whisper not in others’ ears nor giggle with them in the presence of dignified elders.

kural.pope_couplet: Seek not, ask not, the secret of the king to hear;But if he lets the matter forth, give ear
kural.pope_exp: (When the king is engaged) in secret counsel (with others), ministers should neither over-hear anything whatever nor pry into it with inquisitive questions, but (wait to) listen when it is divulged (by
kural.kannan_exp: Don’t eavesdrop on or badger about any confidential matter; hear it only when it is revealed.

kural.pope_couplet: Knowing the signs, waiting for fitting time, with courteous care,Things not displeasing, needful things, declare
kural.pope_exp: Knowing the (king's disposition and seeking the right time, (the minister) should in a pleasing manner suggest things such as are desirable and not disagreeable
kural.kannan_exp: Gauge the mood; await the ripe time; avoid what he abhors; and speak what is essential, such that it charms him.

kural.pope_couplet: Speak pleasant things, but never utter idle word;Not though by monarch's ears with pleasure heard
kural.pope_exp: Ministers should (always) give agreeable advice but on no occasion recommend useless actions, though requested (to do so)
kural.kannan_exp: Tell him what will enthrall him; but indulge not in useless small talk, even if he desires so.

kural.pope_couplet: Say not, 'He's young, my kinsman,' despising thus your king;But reverence the glory kingly state doth bring
kural.pope_exp: Ministers should behave in accordance with the (Divine) light in the person of kings and not despise them saying, "He is our junior (in age) and connected with our family!"
kural.kannan_exp: Scorn him not because he is younger or is related; respect him for his position and reputation.

kural.pope_couplet: 'We've gained his grace, boots nought what graceless acts we do',So deem not sages who the changeless vision view
kural.pope_exp: Those whose judgement is firm will not do what is disagreeable (to the sovereign) saying (within
kural.kannan_exp: Those with a clarity of purpose will refrain from acting repulsively thinking they command respect.

kural.pope_couplet: Who think 'We're ancient friends' and do unseemly things;To these familiarity sure ruin brings
kural.pope_exp: The (foolish) claim with which a minister does unbecoming acts because of his (long) familiarity (with the king) will ensure his ruin
kural.kannan_exp: Taking advantage of proximity to the top and acting out of character brings ruin.

kural.pope_couplet: Who knows the sign, and reads unuttered thought, the gem is he,Of earth round traversed by the changeless sea
kural.pope_exp: The minister who by looking (at the king) understands his mind without being told (of it), will be a perpetual ornament to the world which is surrounded by a never-drying sea
kural.kannan_exp: He who reads minds by observing, with no words spoken, is ever an adornment for the world with unchanging oceans.

kural.pope_couplet: Undoubting, who the minds of men can scan,As deity regard that gifted man
kural.pope_exp: He is to be esteemed a god who is able to ascertain without a doubt what is within (one's mind)
kural.kannan_exp: Rate him amongst gods, he who can read minds with indubitable certainty.

kural.pope_couplet: Who by the sign the signs interprets plain,Give any member up his aid to gain
kural.pope_exp: The king should ever give whatever (is asked) of his belongings and secure him who, by the indications (of his own mind) is able to read those of another
kural.kannan_exp: Those who can read others’ minds by observing their own minds- if need be, give any of your organs to have them with you. Those who can read minds based on gestures or expressions – if need be, give any of your organs to have them with you. V2

kural.pope_couplet: Who reads what's shown by signs, though words unspoken be,In form may seem as other men, in function nobler far is he
kural.pope_exp: Those who understand one's thoughts without being informed (thereof) and those who do not, may (indeed) resemble one another bodily; still are they different (mentally)
kural.kannan_exp: Who can sense thoughts without being told, they are distinct, resembling others only in their human forms.

kural.pope_couplet: By sign who knows not sings to comprehend, what gain,'Mid all his members, from his eyes does he obtain
kural.pope_exp: Of what use are the eyes amongst one's members, if they cannot by their own indications dive those of another ?
kural.kannan_exp: If one can’t observe and interpret body language, what purpose do eyes serve amongst the organs?

kural.pope_couplet: As forms around in crystal mirrored clear we find,The face will show what's throbbing in the mind
kural.pope_exp: As the mirror reflects what is near so does the face show what is uppermost in the mind
kural.kannan_exp: The face, like a crystal that shows the hues of objects around, betrays the mood of the mind.

kural.pope_couplet: Than speaking countenance hath aught more prescient skill?Rejoice or burn with rage, 'tis the first herald still
kural.pope_exp: Is there anything so full of knowledge as the face ? (No) it precedes the mind, whether (the latter is) pleased or vexed
kural.kannan_exp: What can be smarter than the face? It is quick to sense and show if the heart is pleased or peeved.

kural.pope_couplet: To see the face is quite enough, in presence brought,When men can look within and know the lurking thought
kural.pope_exp: If the king gets those who by looking into his mind can understand (and remove) what has occurred (to him) it is enough that he stand looking at their face
kural.kannan_exp: When those who can look into your heart and know your intentions, be with you, tasks will be accomplished if you just face them.

kural.pope_couplet: The eye speaks out the hate or friendly soul of man;To those who know the eye's swift varying moods to scan
kural.pope_exp: If a king gets ministers who can read the movements of the eye, the eyes (of foreign kings) will (themselves) reveal (to him) their hatred or friendship
kural.kannan_exp: The eyes will convey the animosity or affinity to those who can decipher the subtleties of the eyes.

kural.pope_couplet: The men of keen discerning soul no other test apply(When you their secret ask) than man's revealing eye
kural.pope_exp: The measuring-rod of those (ministers) who say "we are acute" will on inquiry be found to be their (own) eyes and nothing else
kural.kannan_exp: The scale used by the astute to gauge the emotions, if you think of it, is nothing but the eyes.

kural.pope_couplet: Men pure in heart, who know of words the varied force,Should to their audience known adapt their well-arranged discourse
kural.pope_exp: Let the pure who know the arrangement of words speak with deliberation after ascertaining (the nature of) the court (then assembled)
kural.kannan_exp: Those who are well versed with the various ways of speech, know and assess the audience before speaking.

kural.pope_couplet: Good men to whom the arts of eloquence are known,Should seek occasion meet, and say what well they've made their own
kural.pope_exp: Let the good who know the uses of words speak with a clear knowledge after ascertaining the time (suited to the court)
kural.kannan_exp: Before speaking,anticipate the reaction of the audience and master the subject, if you are conversant with the modes of expression.

kural.pope_couplet: Unversed in councils, who essays to speakKnows not the way of suasive words,- and all is weak
kural.pope_exp: Those who undertake to speak without knowing the (nature of the) court are ignorant of the quality of words as well as devoid of the power (of learning)
kural.kannan_exp: Those who know not their audience and yet endeavor to speak, know not the styles of speech and their reach, nor can they be competent.

kural.pope_couplet: Before the bright ones shine as doth the lightBefore the dull ones be as purest stucco white
kural.pope_exp: Ministers should be lights in the assembly of the enlightned, but assume the pure whiteness of mortar (ignorance) in that of fools
kural.kannan_exp: Be brilliant before the bright, and amidst the ignorant turn blank as a wall plastered white.

kural.pope_couplet: Midst all good things the best is modest grace,That speaks not first before the elders' face
kural.pope_exp: The modesty by which one does not rush forward and speak in (an assembly of) superiors is the best among all (one's) good qualities
kural.kannan_exp: It is the best among all the good deeds to have the restraint to not speak out of turn, in a forum of learned elders.

kural.pope_couplet: As in the way one tottering falls, is slip beforeThe men whose minds are filled with varied lore
kural.pope_exp: (For a minister) to blunder in the presence of those who have acquired a vast store of learning and know (the value thereof) is like a good man stumbling (and falling away) from the path (of virtue)
kural.kannan_exp: It will tantamount to swerving from the righteous path, being disgraced before an audience, widely-read but highly-receptive.

kural.pope_couplet: The learning of the learned sage shines brightTo those whose faultless skill can value it aright
kural.pope_exp: The learning of those who have read and understood (much) will shine in the assembly of those who faultlessly examine (the nature of) words
kural.kannan_exp: The expertise of the erudite gets enhanced by addressing an audience capable of flawlessly grasping those words.

kural.pope_couplet: To speak where understanding hearers you obtain,Is sprinkling water on the fields of growing grain
kural.pope_exp: Lecturing to those who have the ability to understand (for themselves) is like watering a bed of plants that are growing (of themselves)
kural.kannan_exp: To speak before an audience who possess clear understanding is like watering a sapling, growing by itself in a nursery.

kural.pope_couplet: In councils of the good, who speak good things with penetrating power,In councils of the mean, let them say nought, e'en in oblivious hour
kural.pope_exp: Those who are able to speak good things impressively in an assembly of the good should not even forgetfully speak them in that of the low
kural.kannan_exp: Those who can speak lucidly in a learned forum should refrain from even forgetfully speaking the same in an unworthy forum.

kural.pope_couplet: Ambrosia in the sewer spilt, is wordSpoken in presence of the alien herd
kural.pope_exp: To utter (a good word) in the assembly of those who are of inferior rank is like dropping nectar on the ground
kural.kannan_exp: Speaking before an audience who are no match for you, is like throwing away the elixir of life into the drains.

kural.pope_couplet: Men, pure in heart, who know of words the varied force,The mighty council's moods discern, nor fail in their discourse
kural.pope_exp: The pure who know the classification of words having first ascertained the nature (of the court) will not (through fear) falter in their speech before the powerful body
kural.kannan_exp: Those who are well versed with the various ways of speech, will choose the right style for a forum, and won’t blunder out of fear.

kural.pope_couplet: Who what they've learned, in penetrating words heve learned to say,Before the learn'd among the learn'd most learn'd are they
kural.pope_exp: Those who can agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned will be regarded as the most learned among the learned
kural.kannan_exp: They are known the most learned amongst the learned, those who can express their learnings persuasively before a learned audience.

kural.pope_couplet: Many encountering death in face of foe will hold their ground;Who speak undaunted in the council hall are rarely found
kural.pope_exp: Many indeed may (fearlessly) die in the presence of (their) foes; (but) few are those who are fearless in the assembly (of the learned)
kural.kannan_exp: Simple people, ready to die at the warfront, abound; those who fearlessly address an audience are a rare breed.

kural.pope_couplet: What you have learned, in penetrating words speak out beforeThe learn'd; but learn what men more learn'd can teach you more
kural.pope_exp: (Ministers) should agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned and acquire more (knowledge) from their superiors (in learning)
kural.kannan_exp: Speak persuasively before the learned, what you have learnt, and absorb more from those who are more learned than you.

kural.pope_couplet: By rule, to dialectic art your mind apply,That in the council fearless you may make an apt reply
kural.pope_exp: In order to reply fearlessly before a foreign court, (ministers) should learn logic according to the rules (of grammar)
kural.kannan_exp: Choose the right works and learn, knowing the limitations, so that you can debate fearlessly with any audience.

kural.pope_couplet: To those who lack the hero's eye what can the sword availOr science what, to those before the council keen who quail
kural.pope_exp: What have they to do with a sword who are not valiant, or they with learning who are afraid of an intelligent assembly ?
kural.kannan_exp: What use is the sword to cowards? Of what use are books to those who fear a learned audience?

kural.pope_couplet: As shining sword before the foe which 'sexless being' bears,Is science learned by him the council's face who fears
kural.pope_exp: The learning of him who is diffident before an assembly is like the shining sword of an hermaphrodite in the presence of his foes
kural.kannan_exp: A sharp sword in the hands of a coward before foes, is the scholarship of him who fears a forum.

kural.pope_couplet: Though many things they've learned, yet useless are they all,To man who cannot well and strongly speak in council hall
kural.pope_exp: Those who cannot agreeably speak good things before a good assembly are indeed unprofitable persons inspite of all their various acquirements
kural.kannan_exp: They may be of great learning but can serve no purpose if they shy away from speaking compellingly to a good audience.

kural.pope_couplet: Who, though they've learned, before the council of the good men quake,Than men unlearn'd a lower place must take
kural.pope_exp: They who, though they have learned and understood, are yet afraid of the assembly of the good, are said to be inferior (even) to the illiterate
kural.kannan_exp: Though well learned, they’re considered worse than the ignorant, those who fear an assembly of good people.

kural.pope_couplet: Who what they've learned, in penetrating words know not to say,The council fearing, though they live, as dead are they
kural.pope_exp: Those who through fear of the assembly are unable to set forth their learning in an interesting manner, though alive, are yet like the dead
kural.kannan_exp: Out of stage-fright, those who can’t articulate their learnings well, maybe alive but are as good as lifeless.

kural.pope_couplet: Where spreads fertility unfailing, where resides a band,Of virtuous men, and those of ample wealth, call that a 'land'
kural.pope_exp: A kingdom is that in which (those who carry on) a complete cultivation, virtuous persons, and
kural.kannan_exp: Unfailing crops, exemplary people, and the wealthy with untarnished and undiminishing wealth, constitute a country.

kural.pope_couplet: That is a 'land' which men desire for wealth's abundant share,Yielding rich increase, where calamities are rare
kural.pope_exp: A kingdom is that which is desire for its immense wealth, and which grows greatly in prosperity, being free from destructive causes
kural.kannan_exp: Desirable due to its huge wealth; devoid of detriments for high yields: such should a country be.

kural.pope_couplet: When burthens press, it bears; Yet, With unfailing handTo king due tribute pays: that is the 'land'
kural.pope_exp: A kingdom is that which can bear any burden that may be pressed on it (from adjoining kingdoms) and (yet) pay the full tribute to its sovereign
kural.kannan_exp: In an ideal country, its citizens bear any new burdens which, all at once,afflict them, and continue to willingly pay taxes.

kural.pope_couplet: That is a 'land' whose peaceful annals know,Nor famine fierce, nor wasting plague, nor ravage of the foe
kural.pope_exp: A kingdom is that which continues to be free from excessive starvation, irremediable epidemics, and destructive foes
kural.kannan_exp: Acute hunger, debilitating diseases and warring foes are absent in a good state.

kural.pope_couplet: From factions free, and desolating civil strife, and bandOf lurking murderers that king afflict, that is the 'land'
kural.pope_exp: A kingdom is that which is without various (irregular) associations, destructive internal enemies, and murderous savages who (sometimes) harass the sovereign
kural.kannan_exp: Multiple factions, destructive dissent, and murderous criminals who torment the rulers are not found in a good state.

kural.pope_couplet: Chief of all lands is that, where nought disturbs its peace;Or, if invaders come, still yields its rich increase
kural.pope_exp: The learned say that the best kingdom is that which knows no evil (from its foes), and, if injured (at all), suffers no diminution in its fruitfulness
kural.kannan_exp: It faces no calamities; even if it does, its resources are undiminished: such a nation is the foremost amongst nations.

kural.pope_couplet: Waters from rains and springs, a mountain near, and waters thence;These make a land, with fortress' sure defence
kural.pope_exp: The constituents of a kingdom are the two waters (from above and below), well situated hills and an undestructible fort
kural.kannan_exp: Lakes above and wells below, mountains well-located, rivers and streams flowing from them, and strong fortresses constitute a country.

kural.pope_couplet: A country's jewels are these five: unfailing health,Fertility, and joy, a sure defence, and wealth
kural.pope_exp: Freedom from epidemics, wealth, produce, happiness and protection (to subjects); these five, the learned, say, are the ornaments of a kingdom
kural.kannan_exp: Health, wealth, high yields, happiness and strong defence – these five adorn a state.

kural.pope_couplet: That is a land that yields increase unsought,That is no land whose gifts with toil are bought
kural.pope_exp: The learned say that those are kingdom whose wealth is not laboured for, and those not, whose wealth is only obtained through labour
kural.kannan_exp: A good state is one which is self-sufficient; it is not one, if it is dependent on external resources.

kural.pope_couplet: Though blest with all these varied gifts' increase,A land gains nought that is not with its king at peace
kural.pope_exp: Although in possession of all the above mentioned excellences, these are indeed of no use to a country, in the absence of harmony between the sovereign and the sujects
kural.kannan_exp: A state might have everything; but they are of no use, if it doesn’t have the right ruler.

kural.pope_couplet: A fort is wealth to those who act against their foes;Is wealth to them who, fearing, guard themselves from woes
kural.pope_exp: A fort is an object of importance to those who march (against their foes) as well as to those who through fear (of pursuers) would seek it for shelter
kural.kannan_exp: A fortress is critical for those on the offensive; so is it, for those on the defensive to protect themselves.

kural.pope_couplet: A fort is that which owns fount of waters crystal clear,An open space, a hill, and shade of beauteous forest near
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which has everlasting water, plains, mountains and cool shady forests
kural.kannan_exp: Pearl-like perennial water, sand, mountains and shaded woods – a strong fortress contains all these.

kural.pope_couplet: Height, breadth, strength, difficult access:Science declares a fort must these possess
kural.pope_exp: The learned say that a fortress is an enclosure having these four (qualities) viz, height, breadth, strength and inaccessibility
kural.kannan_exp: Tall, vast, impregnable and unapproachable – experts prescribe these four measures for forts.

kural.pope_couplet: A fort must need but slight defence, yet ample be,Defying all the foeman's energy
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which has an extensive space within, but only small places to be guarded, and such as can destroy the courage of besieging foes
kural.kannan_exp: Boundaries, vulnerable and needing protection, are minimal but area enclosed is vast – such a fortress destroys the confidence of advancing foes.

kural.pope_couplet: Impregnable, containing ample stores of food,A fort for those within, must be a warlike station good
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which cannot be captured, which abounds in suitable provisions, and affords a position of easy defence to its inmates
kural.kannan_exp: A good fortress is unassailable, contains sufficient food and makes life easy for the residents.

kural.pope_couplet: A fort, with all munitions amply stored,In time of need should good reserves afford
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which has all (needful) things, and excellent heroes that can help it against destruction (by foes)
kural.kannan_exp: A strong fortress contains all required resources and valiant warriors who will support during a siege.

kural.pope_couplet: A fort should be impregnable to foes who gird it round,Or aim there darts from far, or mine beneath the ground
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which cannot be captured by blockading, assaulting, or undermining it
kural.kannan_exp: Neither siege, nor an all-out attack, nor sowing dissent will befell a strong fortress.

kural.pope_couplet: Howe'er the circling foe may strive access to win,A fort should give the victory to those who guard within
kural.pope_exp: That is a fort whose inmates are able to overcome without losing their ground, even abler men who have besieged it
kural.kannan_exp: A strong fortress aids those devoted to stay and defend it, to defeat the formidable foes who have besieged it.

kural.pope_couplet: At outset of the strife a fort should foes dismay;And greatness gain by deeds in every glorious day
kural.pope_exp: A fort is that which derives excellence from the stratagems made (by its inmates) to defeat their enemies in the battlefield
kural.kannan_exp: A fortress attains glory through the glory attained by its residents, who, through their daring deeds, swiftly subdue the foes on the warfront.

kural.pope_couplet: Howe'er majestic castled walls may rise,To craven souls no fortress strength supplies
kural.pope_exp: Although a fort may possess all (the above-said) excellence, it is, as it were without these, if its inmates possess not the excellence of action
kural.kannan_exp: However formidable it maybe, a fortress is futile for those not formidable in their deeds.

kural.pope_couplet: Nothing exists save wealth, that canChange man of nought to worthy man
kural.pope_exp: Besides wealth there is nothing that can change people of no importance into those of (some) importance
kural.kannan_exp: Wealth makes them, who were deemed worthless, worthy; if not, it is not wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: Those who have nought all will despise;All raise the wealthy to the skies
kural.pope_exp: All despise the poor; (but) all praise the rich
kural.kannan_exp: The poor are ridiculed by all, and the rich esteemed by all.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth, the lamp unfailing, speeds to every land,Dispersing darkness at its lord's command
kural.pope_exp: The imperishable light of wealth goes into regions desired (by its owner) and destroys the darkness (of enmity therein)
kural.kannan_exp: The unfailing lamp called wealth will dislodge darkness by throwing light anywhere it wants to.

kural.pope_couplet: Their wealth, who blameless means can use aright,Is source of virtue and of choice delight
kural.pope_exp: The wealth acquired with a knowledge of the proper means and without foul practices will yield virtue and happiness
kural.kannan_exp: It yields righteousness and joy, the wealth acquired capably without causing any harm.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth gained by loss of love and grace,Let man cast off from his embrace
kural.pope_exp: (Kings) should rather avoid than seek the accumulation of wealth which does not flow in with mercy and love
kural.kannan_exp: Consider it unworthy of acquiring – wealth that is not generated with compassion and love.

kural.pope_couplet: Wealth that falls to him as heir, wealth from the kingdom's dues,
kural.pope_exp: The spoils of slaughtered foes; these are the royal revenues
kural.kannan_exp: Funds generated in the normal course, internal taxes and acquisitions from enemies are sources of wealth for the king.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis love that kindliness as offspring bears:And wealth as bounteous nurse the infant rears
kural.pope_exp: The child mercy which is borne by love grows under the care of the rich nurse of wealth
kural.kannan_exp: The infant called compassion, birthed by love, is nurtured by the rich custodian called wealth.

kural.pope_couplet: As one to view the strife of elephants who takes his stand,On hill he's climbed, is he who works with money in his hand
kural.pope_exp: An undertaking of one who has wealth in one's hands is like viewing an elephant-fight from a hill-top
kural.kannan_exp: Doing a deed with some wealth on hand is like climbing a hilltop and watching tuskers tussle.

kural.pope_couplet: Make money! Foeman's insolence o'ergrownTo lop away no keener steel is known
kural.pope_exp: Accumulate wealth; it will destroy the arrogance of (your) foes; there is no weapon sharper than it
kural.kannan_exp: Make money – there is no weapon sharper than it to sever the pride of your foes.

kural.pope_couplet: Who plenteous store of glorious wealth have gained,By them the other two are easily obtained
kural.pope_exp: To those who have honestly acquired an abundance of riches, the other two, (virtue and pleasure) are things easy (of acquisition)
kural.kannan_exp: For those who have made abundant wealth through fair means, the remaining two (righteousness and love) are easy to achieve.

kural.pope_couplet: A conquering host, complete in all its limbs, that fears no wound,Mid treasures of the king is chiefest found
kural.pope_exp: The army which is complete in (its) parts and conquers without fear of wounds is the chief wealth of the king
kural.kannan_exp: A well-structured, indomitable military, never daunted by dire prospects, is primary amongst all possessions of the king.

kural.pope_couplet: In adverse hour, to face undaunted might of conquering foe,Is bravery that only veteran host can show
kural.pope_exp: Ancient army can alone have the valour which makes it stand by its king at the time of defeat, fearless of wounds and unmindful of its reduced strength
kural.kannan_exp: The undaunted valour in dire situations, with no fear of consequences, is rarely seen outside of a seasoned army.

kural.pope_couplet: Though, like the sea, the angry mice send forth their battle cry;What then? The dragon breathes upon them, and they die
kural.pope_exp: What if (a host of) hostile rats roar like the sea ? They will perish at the mere breath of the cobra
kural.kannan_exp: What if a rival army of rats comes roaring like an ocean, they will dissipate when the snake hisses.

kural.pope_couplet: That is a host, by no defeats, by no desertions shamed,For old hereditary courage famed
kural.pope_exp: That indeed is an army which has stood firm of old without suffering destruction or deserting (to the enemy)
kural.kannan_exp: A real army is one that displays the innate valour of never getting vanquished by any disaster.

kural.pope_couplet: That is a 'host' that joins its ranks, and mightily withstands,Though death with sudden wrath should fall upon its bands
kural.pope_exp: That indeed is an army which is capable of offering a united resistance, even if Yama advances against it with fury
kural.kannan_exp: An army is one which has the courage to battle united, even if the Lord of Death descends on them.

kural.pope_couplet: Valour with honour, sure advance in glory's path, with confidence;To warlike host these four are sure defence
kural.pope_exp: Valour, honour, following in the excellent-footsteps (of its predecessors) and trust-worthiness; these four alone constitute the safeguard of an army
kural.kannan_exp: Courage, pride, striding the honorable course, clarity – these four best fortify an army.

kural.pope_couplet: A valiant army bears the onslaught, onward goes,Well taught with marshalled ranks to meet their coming foes
kural.pope_exp: That is an army which knowing the art of warding off an impending struggle, can bear against the dust-van (of a hostile force)
kural.kannan_exp: The army that can discern the tactics of its advancing foes, will stride over the dust the foes bite.

kural.pope_couplet: Though not in war offensive or defensive skilled;An army gains applause when well equipped and drilled
kural.pope_exp: Though destitute of courage to fight and strength (to endure), an army may yet gain renown by the splendour of its appearance
kural.kannan_exp: An army though bereft of the skills and resources to wage a war, will still gain renown for its discipline and preparation.

kural.pope_couplet: Where weakness, clinging fear and povertyAre not, the host will gain the victory
kural.pope_exp: An army can triumph (over its foes) if it is free from diminution; irremediable aversion and poverty
kural.kannan_exp: Pettiness, unabated fury and hatred, and poverty – an army not having these will win.

kural.pope_couplet: Though men abound, all ready for the war,No army is where no fit leaders are
kural.pope_exp: Though an army may contain a large number of permanent soldiers, it cannot last if it has no generals
kural.kannan_exp: An army may have brave warriors in abundance, but will meet its end if there are no great leaders.

kural.pope_couplet: Ye foes stand not before my lord for many a oneWho did my lord withstand, now stands in stone
kural.pope_exp: O my foes, stand not before my leader; (for) many are those who did so but afterwards stood (in the shape of) statues
kural.kannan_exp: Oh foes, stand not facing my leader! Many have done so, and stand as stones.

kural.pope_couplet: Who aims at elephant, though dart should fail, has greater praiseThan he who woodland hare with winged arrow slays
kural.pope_exp: It is more pleasant to hold the dart that has missed an elephant than that which has hit hare in the forest
kural.kannan_exp: Better to bear the spear that missed the tusker than the arrow that got the rabbit.

kural.pope_couplet: Fierceness in hour of strife heroic greatness shows;Its edge is kindness to our suffering foes
kural.pope_exp: The learned say that fierceness (incontest with a foe) is indeed great valour; but to become a benefactor in case of accident (to a foe) is the extreme (limit) of that valour
kural.kannan_exp: Great manliness lies in bellicose valor; grace towards ailing foes, adds steel to it.

kural.pope_couplet: At elephant he hurls the dart in hand; for weapon pressed,He laughs and plucks the javelin from his wounded breast
kural.pope_exp: The hero who after casting the lance in his hand on an elephant, comes (in search of another) will pluck the one (that sticks) in his body and laugh (exultingly)
kural.kannan_exp: He spent his spear slaying an elephant, but breaks into a smile, plucking out the spear that pierces him.

kural.pope_couplet: To hero fearless must it not defeat appear,If he but wink his eye when foemen hurls his spear
kural.pope_exp: Is it not a defeat to the valiant to wink and destroy their ferocious look when a lance in cast at them (by their foe) ?
kural.kannan_exp: Doesn’t it equal defeat, blinking the eyes when a spear is thrown at him, the eyes that are staring the foe down.

kural.pope_couplet: The heroes, counting up their days, set down as vainEach day when they no glorious wound sustain
kural.pope_exp: The hero will reckon among wasted days all those on which he had not received severe wounds
kural.kannan_exp: Count those as wasted days, the days when you didn’t earn a wound in a battle.

kural.pope_couplet: Who seek for world-wide fame, regardless of their life,The glorious clasp adorns, sign of heroic strife
kural.pope_exp: The fastening of ankle-ring by those who disire a world-wide renown and not (the safety of) their lives is like adorning (themselves)
kural.kannan_exp: The anklets of courage become ornate when they adorn those who spurn their lives seeking lasting fame.

kural.pope_couplet: Fearless they rush where'er 'the tide of battle rolls';The king's reproof damps not the ardour of their eager souls
kural.pope_exp: The heroes who are not afraid of losing their life in a contest will not cool their ardour, even if the king prohibits (their fighting)
kural.kannan_exp: When a battle begins, the warriors who war without fear for life, do not let their vigour reduce even when the king restrains them.

kural.pope_couplet: Who says they err, and visits them scorn,Who die and faithful guard the vow they've sworn
kural.pope_exp: Who would reproach with failure those who seal their oath with their death ?
kural.kannan_exp: When he is ready to embrace death to fulfill his vow, who can taunt him for failure.

kural.pope_couplet: If monarch's eyes o'erflow with tears for hero slain,Who would not beg such boon of glorious death to gain
kural.pope_exp: If (heroes) can so die as to fill with tears the eyes of their rulers, such a death deserves to be obtained even by begging
kural.kannan_exp: If one overwhelms his patron with tears while dying for him, death deserves to be beseeched.

kural.pope_couplet: What so hard for men to gain as friendship trueWhat so sure defence 'gainst all that foe can do
kural.pope_exp: What so sure defence 'gainst all that foe can do?
kural.kannan_exp: What is better than making friends? What better protection can there be for accomplishing a task?

kural.pope_couplet: Friendship with men fulfilled of good Waxes like the crescent moon;Friendship with men of foolish mood, Like the full orb, waneth soon
kural.pope_exp: The friendship of the wise waxes like the new moon; (but) that of fools wanes like the full moon
kural.kannan_exp: Amongst the wise, camaraderie waxes like the crescent, and amongst fools, wanes like the full moon.

kural.pope_couplet: Learned scroll the more you ponder, Sweeter grows the mental food;So the heart by use grows fonder, Bound in friendship with the good
kural.pope_exp: Like learning, the friendship of the noble, the more it is cultivated, the more delightful does it become
kural.kannan_exp: The nuances of a book are enjoyed more, the deeper one reads it; the more you nurture a friendship, the more the joy.

kural.pope_couplet: Nor for laughter only friendship all the pleasant day,But for strokes of sharp reproving, when from right you stray
kural.pope_exp: Friendship is to be practised not for the purpose of laughing but for that of being beforehand in giving one another sharp rebukes in case of transgression
kural.kannan_exp: A friendship is not merely to have fun; it is also to admonish when a friend errs.

kural.pope_couplet: Not association constant, not affection's token bind;'Tis the unison of feeling friends unites of kindred mind
kural.pope_exp: Living together and holding frequent intercourse are not necessary (for friendship); (mutual) understanding can alone create a claim for it
kural.kannan_exp: Friendship is forged on shared feelings; physical proximity or long association is inconsequential.

kural.pope_couplet: Not the face's smile of welcome shows the friend sincere,But the heart's rejoicing gladness when the friend is near
kural.pope_exp: The love that dwells (merely in the smiles of the face is not friendship; (but) that which dwells deep in the smiles of the heart is true friendship
kural.kannan_exp: A smile on the face does not make a friendship; a smile in the depths of the heart does.

kural.pope_couplet: Friendship from ruin saves, in way of virtue keeps;In troublous time, it weeps with him who weeps
kural.pope_exp: (True) friendship turns aside from evil (ways) makes (him) walk in the (good) way, and, in case of loss if shares his sorrow (with him)
kural.kannan_exp: Rescuing from ruin, steering along the right path, and when in distress, sharing it, is friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: As hand of him whose vesture slips away,Friendship at once the coming grief will stay
kural.pope_exp: (True) friendship hastens to the rescue of the afflicted (as readily) as the hand of one whose garment is loosened (before an assembly)
kural.kannan_exp: Like the hand that moves reflexively when the dress slips, a friend reacts swiftly to remove a woe.

kural.pope_couplet: And where is friendship's royal seat? In stable mind,Where friend in every time of need support may find
kural.pope_exp: Friendship may be said to be on its throne when it possesses the power of supporting one at all times and under all circumstances, (in the practice or virtue and wealth)
kural.kannan_exp: Crowning glory for friendship is when a friend supports unflinchingly in all ways.

kural.pope_couplet: Mean is the friendship that men blazon forth,'He's thus to me' and 'such to him my worth'
kural.pope_exp: Though friends may praise one another saying, "He is so intimate with us, and we so much (with him)"; (still) such friendship will appear mean
kural.kannan_exp: “He is so dear to me; I mean so much to him” – to even utter this, takes the lustre off friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: To make an untried man your friend is ruin sure;For friendship formed unbroken must endure
kural.pope_exp: As those who are of a friendly nature will not forsake (a friend) after once loving (him), there is no evil so great as contracting a friendship without due inquiry
kural.kannan_exp: Nothing can be more pernicious than accepting a friend without assessing; after accepting, there is no letting go of them.

kural.pope_couplet: Alliance with the man you have not proved and proved again,In length of days will give you mortal pain
kural.pope_exp: The friendship contracted by him who has not made repeated inquiry will in the end grieve (him) to death
kural.kannan_exp: Assess and assess before taking a friend, else the ensuing anguish will be fatal.

kural.pope_couplet: Temper, descent, defects, associations freeFrom blame: know these, then let the man be friend to thee
kural.pope_exp: Make friendship (with one) after ascertaining (his) character, birth, defects and the whole of one's relations
kural.kannan_exp: Know one’s traits, roots, faults and flawless kinship, and then forge a friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: Who, born of noble race, from guilt would shrink with shame,Pay any price so you as friend that man may claim
kural.pope_exp: The friendship of one who belongs to a (good) family and is afraid of (being charged with) guilt, is worth even purchasing
kural.kannan_exp: Of high birth, and fears disgrace – give whatever and gain the friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: Make them your chosen friend whose words repentance move,With power prescription's path to show, while evil they reprove
kural.pope_exp: You should examine and secure the friendship of those who can speak so as to make you weep over a crime (before its commission) or rebuke you severely (after you have done it) and are able to teach
kural.kannan_exp: When you err, they may chide you till you cry, and show you the right way – assess and accept their friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: Ruin itself one blessing lends:'Tis staff that measures out one's friends
kural.pope_exp: Even in ruin there is some good; (for) it is a rod by which one may measure fully (the affection of one's) relations
kural.kannan_exp: There is a gain in grief: it is a tool to stretch and gauge a friend.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis gain to any man, the sages say,Friendship of fools to put away
kural.pope_exp: It is indead a gain for one to renounce the friendship of fools
kural.kannan_exp: It is a gain to lose the friendship of a fool.

kural.pope_couplet: Think not the thoughts that dwarf the soul; nor takeFor friends the men who friends in time of grief forsake
kural.pope_exp: Do not think of things that discourage your mind, nor contract friendship with those who would forsake you in adversity
kural.kannan_exp: Think not of trifles that stifle your fervor; take not the friendship of those who desert in distress.

kural.pope_couplet: Of friends deserting us on ruin's brink,'Tis torture e'en in life's last hour to think
kural.pope_exp: The very thought of the friendship of those who have deserted one at the approach of adversity will burn one's mind at the time of death
kural.kannan_exp: A friend who abandons in times of adversity, will torment the heart even at death’s door.

kural.pope_couplet: Cling to the friendship of the spotless one's; whate'er you payRenounce alliance with the men of evil way
kural.pope_exp: Continue to enjoy the friendship of the pure; (but) renounce even with a gift, the friendship of those who do not agree (with the world)
kural.kannan_exp: Seek friendship with the impeccable; give anything to sever ties with unbefitting allies.

kural.pope_couplet: Familiarity is friendship's silent pact,That puts restraint on no familiar act
kural.pope_exp: Imtimate friendship is that which cannot in the least be injured by (things done through the) right (of longstanding intimacy)
kural.kannan_exp: When a friend takes the liberty to do anything, and you never hinder it, that is called rapport.

kural.pope_couplet: Familiar freedom friendship's very frame supplies;To be its savour sweet is duty of the wise
kural.pope_exp: The constituents of friendship are (things done through) the right of intimacy; to be pleased with such a right is the duty of the wise
kural.kannan_exp: Taking the liberty is a part of friendship; to oblige and salt it is the duty of the noble.

kural.pope_couplet: When to familiar acts men kind response refuse,What fruit from ancient friendship's use
kural.pope_exp: Of what avail is long-standing friendship, if friends do not admit as their own actions done through the right of intimacy ?
kural.kannan_exp: What purpose does intimate friendship serve, when one can’t indulge a friend who uses his rights to do something unsolicited.

kural.pope_couplet: When friends unbidden do familiar acts with loving heart,Friends take the kindly deed in friendly part
kural.pope_exp: If friends, through the right of friendship, do (anything) without being asked, the wise will be pleased with them on account of its desirability
kural.kannan_exp: Without asking, when a friend acts, presuming assent, one accepts it as if they desired it.

kural.pope_couplet: Not folly merely, but familiar carelessness,Esteem it, when your friends cause you distress
kural.pope_exp: If friends should perform what is painful, understand that it is owing not only to ignorance, but also to the strong claims of intimacy
kural.kannan_exp: Discern it not merely as ignorance, but as a sign of intimacy, when a friend does an undesired act that hurts.

kural.pope_couplet: Who stand within the bounds quit not, though loss impends,Association with the old familiar friends
kural.pope_exp: Those who stand within the limits (of true friendship) will not even in adversity give up the intimacy of long-standing friends
kural.kannan_exp: A friend who has stood by you at all times, even when he causes harm – those who know the expanse of friendship will never let go.

kural.pope_couplet: True friends, well versed in loving ways,Cease not to love, when friend their love betrays
kural.pope_exp: Those who have (long) stood in the path of affection will not give it up even if their friends cause (them) their ruin
kural.kannan_exp: In friendships built on love, no love is lessened even when one does a destructive deed.

kural.pope_couplet: In strength of friendship rare of friend's disgrace who will not hear,The day his friend offends will day of grace to him appear
kural.pope_exp: To those who understand that by which they should not listen to (tales about) the faults of their friends, that is a (profitable) day on which the latter may commit a fault
kural.kannan_exp: For one who brooks no charges against an intimate friend, the day is made when the friend errs.

kural.pope_couplet: Friendship of old and faithful friends,Who ne'er forsake, the world commends
kural.pope_exp: They will be loved by the world, who have not forsaken the friendship of those with whom they have kept up an unbroken long-standing intimacy
kural.kannan_exp: Friends with resolute rapport, will never let it rupture even if the world wills it.

kural.pope_couplet: Ill-wishers even wish them well, who guardFor ancient friends, their wonted kind regard
kural.pope_exp: Even enemies will love those who have never changed in their affection to their long-standingfriends
kural.kannan_exp: One who by nature never breaks with intimate friends Shall be loved even by those who loathe them.

kural.pope_couplet: Though evil men should all-absorbing friendship show,Their love had better die away than grow
kural.pope_exp: The decrease of friendship with those who look as if they would eat you up (through excess of love) while they are really destitute of goodness is far better than its increase
kural.kannan_exp: Their gaze may seem to guzzle you lovingly; but let the ties with characterless friends wane than flourish.

kural.pope_couplet: What though you gain or lose friendship of men of alien heart,Who when you thrive are friends, and when you fail depart
kural.pope_exp: Of what avail is it to get or lose the friendship of those who love when there is gain and leave when there is none ?
kural.kannan_exp: Ill-suited mates who are intimate if they benefit and distant if they don’t – does it matter if we gain them or lose them?

kural.pope_couplet: These are alike: the friends who ponder friendship's gainThose who accept whate'er you give, and all the plundering train
kural.pope_exp: Friendship who calculate the profits (of their friendship), prostitutes who are bent on obtaining their gains, and thieves are (all) of the same character
kural.kannan_exp: Friends who only gauge what they gain, whores who embrace only what they are paid, and thieves are all the same.

kural.pope_couplet: A steed untrained will leave you in the tug of war;Than friends like that to dwell alone is better far
kural.pope_exp: Solitude is more to be desired than the society of those who resemble the untrained horses which throw down (their riders) in the fields of battle
kural.kannan_exp: Better be lonely than have the company of those, who are like untrained horses that can’t bear you on the battlefield.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis better not to gain than gain the friendship profitlessOf men of little minds, who succour fails when dangers press
kural.pope_exp: It is far better to avoid that to contract the evil friendship of the base who cannot protect (their friends) even when appointed to do so
kural.kannan_exp: Regardless of what you do, petty people who can’t protect you – it is better not to gain their vain friendship.

kural.pope_couplet: Better ten million times incur the wise man's hate,Than form with foolish men a friendship intimate
kural.pope_exp: The hatred of the wise is ten-million times more profitable than the excessive intimacy of the fool
kural.kannan_exp: Million times worthwhile it is to be foes with the wise than be bosom friends with the foolish.

kural.pope_couplet: From foes ten million fold a greater good you gain,Than friendship yields that's formed with laughers vain
kural.pope_exp: What comes from enemies is a hundred million times more profitable than what comes from the friendship of those who cause only laughter
kural.kannan_exp: Billion times rewarding it is to have adversaries than friends who engage only in ridicule.

kural.pope_couplet: Those men who make a grievous toil of what they doOn your behalf, their friendship silently eschew
kural.pope_exp: Gradually abandon without revealing (beforehand) the friendship of those who pretend inability to carry out what they (really) could do
kural.kannan_exp: If a friend keeps shirking from doing what they are capable of, make no fuss and let the ties wither away.

kural.pope_couplet: E'en in a dream the intercourse is bitternessWith men whose deeds are other than their words profess
kural.pope_exp: The friendship of those whose actions do not agree with their words will distress (one) even in (one's) dreams
kural.kannan_exp: Bonds with those whose words and deeds differ, alas, causes mayhem even in dreams.

kural.pope_couplet: In anywise maintain not intercourse with those,Who in the house are friends, in hall are slandering foes
kural.pope_exp: Avoid even the least approach to a contraction of friendship with those who would love you in private but ridicule you in public
kural.kannan_exp: Cosy in private and derisive in public – allow not a hint of a link with such a person.

kural.pope_couplet: Anvil where thou shalt smitten be, when men occasion find,Is friendship's form without consenting mind
kural.pope_exp: The friendship of those who behave like friends without inward affection is a weapon that may be thrown when a favourable opportunity presents itself
kural.kannan_exp: Fair-weather friendship based on opportunism than feelings is like an anvil to take the blow when the tool has to strike.

kural.pope_couplet: Friendship of those who seem our kin, but are not really kindWill change from hour to hour like woman's mind
kural.pope_exp: The friendship of those who seem to be friends while they are not, will change like the love of women
kural.kannan_exp: Friendship with those who profess amity but lack it will oscillate like the heart of a woman.

kural.pope_couplet: To heartfelt goodness men ignoble hardly may attain,Although abundant stores of goodly lore they gain
kural.pope_exp: Though (one's) enemies may have mastered many good books, it will be impossible for them to become truly loving at heart
kural.kannan_exp: They may have learnt from many a good book but the ungracious shall never turn good-natured.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis fitting you should dread dissemblers' guile,Whose hearts are bitter while their faces smile
kural.pope_exp: One should fear the deceitful who smile sweetly with their face but never love with their heart
kural.kannan_exp: The schemers with a sweet smile on the face but devious at heart ought to be feared.

kural.pope_couplet: When minds are not in unison, 'its never; just,In any words men speak to put your trust
kural.pope_exp: In nothing whatever is it proper to rely on the words of those who do not love with their heart
kural.kannan_exp: When the hearts don’t converge, never conclude based on their words to embark on any task.

kural.pope_couplet: Though many goodly words they speak in friendly tone,The words of foes will speedily be known
kural.pope_exp: Though (one's) foes may utter good things as though they were friends, once will at once understand (their evil, import)
kural.kannan_exp: Though, like friends, they speak of what is right, words of foes will be exposed right away.

kural.pope_couplet: To pliant speech from hostile lips give thou no ear;'Tis pliant bow that show the deadly peril near
kural.pope_exp: Since the bending of the bow bespeaks evil, one should not accept (as good) the humiliating speeches of one's foes
kural.kannan_exp: The bow bends not to greet but to hurt. Likewise, the greeting of your enemy signifies no bonhomie.

kural.pope_couplet: In hands that worship weapon ten hidden lies;Such are the tears that fall from foeman's eyes
kural.pope_exp: A weapon may be hid in the very hands with which (one's) foes adore (him) (and) the tears they shed are of the same nature
kural.kannan_exp: Hands folded in reverence may conceal a weapon; so do the tears of your foes.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Tis just, when men make much of you, and then despise,To make them smile, and slap in friendship's guise
kural.pope_exp: It is the duty of kings to affect great love but make it die (inwardly); as regard those foes who shew them great friendship but despise them (in their heart)
kural.kannan_exp: Exuding affection externally but harboring derision inside – humour such people but let their friendship fade away.

kural.pope_couplet: When time shall come that foes as friends appear,Then thou, to hide a hostile heart, a smiling face may'st wear
kural.pope_exp: When one's foes begin to affect friendship, one should love them with one's looks, and, cherishing no love in the heart, give up (even the former)
kural.kannan_exp: If there comes a time for camaraderie with your adversaries, sport it on the face but keep it out of your heart.

kural.pope_couplet: What one thing merits folly's special name.Letting gain go, loss for one's own to claim
kural.pope_exp: Folly is one (of the chief defects); it is that which (makes one) incur loss and forego gain
kural.kannan_exp: Naivete can be defined as embracing all that is detrimental and relinquishing all that is rewarding.

kural.pope_couplet: 'Mid follies chiefest folly is to fix your loveOn deeds which to your station unbefitting prove
kural.pope_exp: The greatest folly is that which leads one to take delight in doing what is forbidden
kural.kannan_exp: The height of naivete is to fall in love with what can never be one’s own.

kural.pope_couplet: Ashamed of nothing, searching nothing out, of loveless heart,Nought cherishing, 'tis thus the fool will play his part
kural.pope_exp: Shamelessness indifference (to what must be sought after), harshness, and aversion for everything (that ought to be desired) are the qualities of the fool
kural.kannan_exp: Lack of remorse, having no mission, being devoid of compassion, inability to cherish anything are traits of the witless.

kural.pope_couplet: The sacred law he reads and learns, to other men expounds,-Himself obeys not; where can greater fool be found
kural.pope_exp: There are no greater fools than he who, though he has read and understood (a great deal) and even taught it to others, does not walk according to his own teaching
kural.kannan_exp: There is no greater dolt than one who has learnt the essential texts, grasped their essence and expounds them to others but does not abide by them.

kural.pope_couplet: The fool will merit hell in one brief life on earth,In which he entering sinks through sevenfold round of birth
kural.pope_exp: A fool can procure in a single birth a hell into which he may enter and suffer through all the seven births
kural.kannan_exp: The deeds of a dimwit in one life is enough to doom him in hell for seven lifetimes.

kural.pope_couplet: When fool some task attempts with uninstructed pains,It fails; nor that alone, himself he binds with chains
kural.pope_exp: If the fool, who knows not how to act undertakes a work, he will (certainly) fail (But) is it all ? He will even adorn himself with fetters
kural.kannan_exp: If an injudicious idiot takes up a task, it is not only destined to fail but will also land him up in fetters.

kural.pope_couplet: When fools are blessed with fortune's bounteous store,Their foes feed full, their friends are prey to hunger sore
kural.pope_exp: If a fool happens to get an immense fortune, his neighbours will enjoy it while his relations starve
kural.kannan_exp: When great wealth falls on a fool, strangers shall feast, while the kith and kin starve.

kural.pope_couplet: When folly's hand grasps wealth's increase, 'twill beAs when a mad man raves in drunken glee
kural.pope_exp: A fool happening to possess something is like the intoxication of one who is (already) giddy
kural.kannan_exp: When an idiot ends up possessing something, it resembles someone already in a groggy state getting drunk.

kural.pope_couplet: Friendship of fools is very pleasant thing,Parting with them will leave behind no sting
kural.pope_exp: The friendship between fools is exceedingly delightful (to each other): for at parting there will be
kural.kannan_exp: Friendship with dimwits is terribly sweet; there is no grief when they part.

kural.pope_couplet: Like him who seeks his couch with unwashed feet,Is fool whose foot intrudes where wise men meet
kural.pope_exp: The appearance of a fool in an assembly of the learned is like placing (one's) unwashed feet on a bed
kural.kannan_exp: A fool mingling with the learned and noble is like placing unwashed dirty feet on a clean bed.

kural.pope_couplet: Want of knowledge, 'mid all wants the sorest want we deem;Want of other things the world will not as want esteem
kural.pope_exp: The want of wisdom is the greatest of all wants; but that of wealth the world will not regard as such
kural.kannan_exp: Lack of wisdom is the worst that one can lack; whatever else they lack, the world cares not.

kural.pope_couplet: The gift of foolish man, with willing heart bestowed, is nought,But blessing by receiver's penance bought
kural.pope_exp: (The cause of) a fool cheerfully giving (something) is nothing else but the receiver's merit (in a former birth)
kural.kannan_exp: If ever the unwise give wholeheartedly, it is nothing but the result of the receiver’s penance.

kural.pope_couplet: With keener anguish foolish men their own hearts wring,Than aught that even malice of their foes can bring
kural.pope_exp: The suffering that fools inflict upon themselves is hardly possible even to foes
kural.kannan_exp: The injury that the unintelligent can inflict on themselves – not even their enemies can fare better.

kural.pope_couplet: What is stupidity? The arrogance that cries,'Behold, we claim the glory of the wise.'
kural.pope_exp: What is called want of wisdom is the vanity which says, "We are wise"
kural.kannan_exp: What is simplemindedness but the vain presumption of one’s own intelligence.

kural.pope_couplet: If men what they have never learned assume to know,Upon their real learning's power a doubt 'twill throw
kural.pope_exp: Fools pretending to know what has not been read (by them) will rouse suspicion even as to what they have thoroughly mastered
kural.kannan_exp: Brazenly acting out what one has not learnt arouses doubts over that they’ve flawlessly mastered.
